name: Senior Web Developer
job_info: Senior Web Developer<br>Job Description<br>Senior Web DeveloperCoStar delivers real-time, verified commercial real estate data that helps clients confidently spot great opportunities and make smart choices ahead of competitors. By combining the power of CoStar’s independent research organization – the industry’s largest – with global data delivery, software, and application solutions, clients can act on opportunities with confidence.CoStar’s software developers build products that facilitate 86% of commercial real estate transactions in the United States. These transactions range from a small business owner leasing their first office space to a large multi-national buying a new headquarters campus. On any given day our developers are building products that manage nearly a trillion dollars of potential real estate transactions.RESPONSIBILITIES Build big, distributed, API-driven systems for tens of thousands of usersProduce bullet-proof code that is robust, efficient and maintainable; our primary tools are C#, .NET Framework, JavaScript, React, JSON, SQL ServerDrive and lead software design, development standards, code reviews.Continually evaluate emerging technologies to identify opportunities, trends, and best practices that can be leveraged to strength CoStar’s technology platform and develop practices.QUALIFICATIONS5+ years in experience in JavaScript and React5+ years experience in architecting, designing and building large scale distributed, services-oriented systems and web applications in an agile environment5+ years experience Data modeling experienceBachelor’s DegreePREFERRED QUALIFCATIONS AND SKILLS (Nice to haves)Strong communication skills (to both business and technical partners)Knowledge of SQL experienceData modeling experience from conceptual, logical and physical designsExperience with RESTful web servicesWe welcome all qualified candidates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the United States to apply.  However, please note that CoStar is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position<br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

name: Sales Executive, CoStar - CA-ON Toronto
job_info: Sales Executive, CoStar - CA-ON Toronto<br>Job Description<br>OVERVIEWCoStar Group is the world’s leading provider of information and marketing solutions for the Commercial Real Estate industry.  We are a NASDAQ listed company with a market cap of over $30B+.As a technology company, we are the trusted partner for all commercial real estate professionals empowering many of the most well-respected landlords, development companies, brokerage firms, banks, lenders, investors and government agencies.We do this by actively researching the commercial real estate markets and providing data, analytics, innovative tools and powerful marketing platforms in the U.S. and Internationally to help our clients transact with one another. CoStar continues to win multiple awards including one of Forbes most innovative companies (2017) and Fortune’s fastest growing companies (2020). As a CoStar Sales Executive you will prospect and engage potential clients while managing, nurturing, and growing our existing client base. Promoting both CoStar and LoopNet products, you will have the opportunity to take an entrepreneurial approach to sell, train, and retain your book of business.  You will receive a first-class onboarding and training experience where you will learn how the different players in Commercial Real Estate operate, what is important to them and what solutions we have that meet their needs. You will have your own book of business, an endless supply of well qualified leads to develop, excellent products to sell, an excellent career development path.  RESPONSIBILITIES•    Gain a thorough understanding of your clients and their needs•    Become an expert in CoStar’s critical information and marketing solutions including LoopNet, the leading online commercial real estate marketplace•    Complete ownership of the full sales cycle including: prospecting, demoing, closing, onboarding, training and renewing•    Conduct a high level of in person client and prospect product demonstrations•    Provide valuable insight to all participants in the commercial property market, including Brokers, Owners, Investors, Lenders, Appraisers and Service Providers•    Represent CoStar by hosting and attending industry events and networking with commercial real estate professionals in your marketBASIC QUALIFICATIONS•    Bachelor’s degree required•    Client facing experience in the Commercial Real Estate industry strongly preferred•    Five or more years of successful outside sales experience in a B2B environment selling Data, Research and Analytic platforms or tools, commercial real estate, financial services, business intelligence, marketing or information providers. •    Proven track record exceeding sales targets and quotas in a consultative sales environment•    Three or more years of experience training clients on how to use a solution post saleOUR BEST PERFORMERS ARE•    Passionate, hard-working and ambitious – As an innovator, we are fast paced and creative and expect our Sales Executives to move quickly to seize opportunity.•    Fast to learn new concepts and apply them - CoStar clients and prospects are diverse and demanding. With a constantly evolving suite of products, successful Sales Executives are skilled at introducing them to their clients.•    Curious - Our best salespeople ask intelligent questions, demonstrate strong listening skills and learn from customers and colleagues•    Excellent communicators - our broad-ranging solutions require clear, concise communication tailored to the relevant audience.•    Committed to Customer Service – Successful Sales Executives at CoStar provide valuable insights and take ownership of their client’s requests, managing them to a successful outcome.WHY COSTAR?•    The industry leader with an energetic and fast paced dynamic culture•    Innovative technology and a reputation for outstanding products•    95% customer renewal rate •    Consistent 20%+ average of year over year growth •    Outstanding sales and product training programs•    Excellent career growth opportunities•    High compensation with uncapped commissions and an outstanding annual Presidents Club trip •    Exceptional benefit plan including an employee discounted stock purchase planBe part of a team of sales professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. But don't just take our word for it -- see why our team chose to work at and stay at CoStar Group: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CVbJRnJ2sX0We welcome all qualified candidates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the United States to apply.  However, please note that CoStar is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this positionPlease noteCoStar Group seeks information for job applications from candidates in the U.S. through only the following channels:•    The CoStar Group website and RecruitiFi. •    Via email to/from addresses using only the CoStar domain of “@Costar.com.” •    Screening and interaction by telephone and through the Microsoft Teams or Zoom platforms.Be aware that:•    CoStar does not use Wire, Google Hangouts, or any other platform for any recruitment-related activities.•    Disregard any solicitation or request for information related to job applications with CoStar via any other means and/or using email addresses with any other domain.•    CoStar will never ask candidates to make any type of personal financial investment related to gaining employment with the company.If you have any questions about CoStar Group and the application process, please contact us at recruiting@costar.com. <br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

name: Telecommunications Engineer
job_info: Telecommunications Engineer<br>Job Description<br>Telecommunications Engineer – CoStar Group – Washington, DC OVERVIEW CoStar provides industry professionals and consumers of commercial real estate and apartments with critical knowledge to explore and complete transactions by offering the most comprehensive, timely and standardized information on commercial real estate and apartments and the right innovative tools to be able to effectively utilize that information.  Our current global collaboration and customer engagement architecture supports 90 offices in the U.S., Spain, France and the UK.  The current infrastructure includes: Avaya CM with 80 media gateways Call Center Elite with 400+ Agents Nice Call Recording Microsoft Teams, Zoom 4500 employees, 400+ call center agents  6 Data Centers, 3,000 VM hosts, F5 load balancers, Checkpoint firewalls   CoStar Group, Inc. is seeking a highly qualified Telecommunication professional responsible for validating, certifying and automating communications and collaboration in an international business setting.   The candidate must be independent, highly motivated, and willing to collaborate with a high-performance team. Candidate should be able to prioritize and manage projects from design through implementation, testing and documentation. Position requires a minimum of 1-2 years of hands-on expertise with enterprise class business communication systems, solutions and technologies. Ability and willingness to work early and late hours as needed RESPONSIBILITIES Provide Voice/VoIP design, architecture and engineering support. Provide expert support for security posturing and configuration of the voice systems. Provide interface to service providers with an expert ability for troubleshooting. Monitor and implement changes deemed to make systems more efficient and redundant. Monitor and troubleshoot backups of the systems to ensure recovery of systems should failure occur to redundant systems. Provide top level support to technicians and other engineers working projects, trouble tickets and system failures. Able to communicate effectively with other contacts in order to make projects successful Have advanced knowledge of configuration and administration of the Avaya Suite of products (Communication Manager, Session Manager, System Manager, Aura Messaging, AES) BASIC QUALIFICATIONSBachelor’s DegreeEnterprise voice and Data Center expertise working with collaboration platforms & solutions (Avaya preferred) Proven track record working with leading unified collaboration systems like Cisco, Microsoft, Avaya Experience with MACDs within a communication solution Ability to troubleshoot issue with Digital, H.323, and SIP endpoints Analyze and troubleshoot internal and external VOIP issues  Document test results and provide configuration guides  Develop test plans & test solutions  Develop configuration and maintenance procedures  Troubleshoot and document deployment Experience working with switching and routing protocols Knowledge of VOIP protocols such as SIP, RTP/SRTP including TLS  PREFERRED QUALIFCATIONS AND SKILLS Knowledge of IVR and Call Center design, configuration, and routing Hands-on experience with Session Border Controllers and Voice Gateways  Research new technologies and solutions Very good knowledge of protocol and packet analysis Excellent customer service skills Excellent problem-solving skills. Highly dedicated and organized. Solid problem solving and consultative skills in a fast-paced environment Solid organizational skills, including multitasking and time-management OVERVIEW OF COMPANY:Founded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availability. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; LoopNet, the most heavily trafficked mobile and online real estate marketplace; Apartments.com, the premier rental home resource for renters, property managers and owners; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry; BizBuySell, the largest online marketplace for businesses-for-sales; and Lands of America, the leading operator of online marketplaces for rural real estate.Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of over 4,300 worldwide.WHATS IN IT FOR YOU:Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. In addition to generous compensation and performance-based incentives, you'll be supported in both your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program.Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to):Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription DrugLife, legal, and supplementary insuranceCommuter and parking benefits401(K) retirement plan with matching contributionsEmployee stock purchase planPaid time offTuition reimbursementOn-site fitness center and/or reimbursed fitness center membership costs (location dependent), with yoga studio, Pelotons, personal training, group exercise classes, as well as Segways and bikes available for use during the dayComplimentary gourmet coffee, tea, hot chocolate, prepared foods, fresh fruit, and other healthy snacksBe part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. name: Representative, LoopNet Operations- Richmond, VA
job_info: Representative, LoopNet Operations- Richmond, VA<br>Job Description<br>OVERVIEWCoStar Group is the world’s leading provider of information and advertising marketplaces for the Real Estate industry.  We are a NASDAQ-listed company with a market cap of over $30B+. We are constantly innovating on behalf of our clients, and we have consistently been recognized as one of the world’s most innovative growth companies by Forbes and other media outlets.  We’re proud to be the trusted partner for all commercial real estate professionals including many of the most well-respected landlords, development companies, brokerage firms, banks, lenders, investors and government agencies.LoopNet, part of CoStar Group, is the leading advertising platform for the Commercial Real Estate industry.  Over 10 million tenants, property owners and investors use LoopNet each month – and we’re just getting started!  LoopNet has invested heavily in its product over the past few years, and we’re looking to further cement our leading position in the market with top-tier talent. While you may be familiar with LoopNet, the future of the product and brand are also incredibly exciting.As the LoopNet Operations Representative, you will support our internal customers by helping with advertising contract exposure inquiries, researching issues, and sharing insight into product and fulfillment rules. RESPONSIBILITIESProactively monitor reports and inbound queues (email & telephone) to ensure timely resolution to inquiries resulting in minimal brand impact and maximum customer satisfaction.Assist internal customers with inquiries about contract structure best practices, ad fulfillment rules, pricing, contract bill date/term, advertising exposure issues and client escalations, while ensuring the highest standard of customer service.Handle time-sensitive research, route inquiries to the appropriate team for follow up, and own the question or issue until it is resolved.Submit all interactions pertaining to a client’s account in notes detailed enough that subsequent users can track your actions.Responsible for researching, replicating, performing root cause analysis, documenting and submitting product issues reported by customers.Support ad-hoc account audits and research requests as needed by the business.Maintain the highest professional standards and promote our ethics of trust, open communication, creative thinking and cohesive team effort.Maintain an excellent understanding of CoStar Group Products.Meet and exceed customer and CoStar’s expectations.BASIC QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS Bachelors degree2-3 years’ office experience.PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS Proficient in Word, Excel, Outlook; Salesforce.com experience a plus.Excellent written and verbal communication (phone) skills required.Experience handling customer service calls a plus.Able to work independently as well as contribute to a team in a dynamic, innovative high-growth environment.Highly organized, conscientious, detail- and service-oriented.Ability to multi-task and dynamically prioritize duties during periods of high activity.Self-motivated, high aptitude to learn quickly with a tenacious approach to problem solving.Flexibility, willingness to learn/adjust/adapt to changing priorities, requirements and conditions.WHY COSTAR?Industry leader with an energetic and fast paced dynamic culture20%+ average of year over year growthOutstanding sales and product training programsGrowth opportunities within LoopNet and the broader CoStar portfolio of companies and brandsComprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription DrugLife, legal, and supplementary insuranceCommuter and parking benefits401(K) retirement plan with matching contributionsEmployee stock purchase planPaid time offTuition reimbursementOn-site fitness center and/or reimbursed fitness center membership costs (location dependent), with yoga studio, Pelotons, personal training, group exercise classes, as well as Segways and bikes available for use during the dayComplimentary gourmet coffee, tea, hot chocolate, prepared foods, fresh fruit, and other healthy snacksCheck out some of our recent LoopNet ads here: https://www.youtube.com/c/loopnet/videosBe part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. name: Hospitality Research Associate
job_info: Hospitality Research Associate<br>Job Description<br>OVERVIEW: STR was acquired in October 2019 as a division of CoStar Group, Inc., the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics and online marketplaces. STR is in the process of combining CoStar’s largest and most up-to-date properties database with STR’s global hospitality performance data, to give both real estate and hospitality customers a unique and powerful combined view of their local markets.Hospitality Research is responsible for updating and maintaining STR/CoStar’s hospitality inventory database which is the primary basis for most of STR’s products. The research teams work with various internal and external stakeholders to receive up-to date information (such as openings, closings, brand changes, pipeline proposals) on hospitality properties including hotels, hostels, and serviced apartments. Additionally, hospitality research utilizes web research, phone calls and other available resources (e.g. planning documents, construction feeds) to obtain additional details on hospitality properties. As a Hospitality Research Associate, you will be responsible for the ongoing maintenance of the hospitality inventory database including adding new records and updating existing property records. The position will require detail-oriented online research as well as phone calls to complete database records. RESPONSIBILITIES:Contribute to the growth of an accurate and complete database of hospitality inventoryConduct independent online research using a variety of sources, including but not limited to: search engines, industry publications, industry associations, etc.Add applicable new records and update existing records as new information is made available and/or obtained through proactive research, GIS & municipal websites, corporate portfolio listings, phone calls, chain feeds, enrollment forms, websites, emails, and any other verifiable sourceComplete assigned projects in a timely mannerStay knowledgeable of industry trends and current industry news that may affect the assigned region or companyUnderstanding of how current events have an impact on assigned region or company.Communicate effectively and professionally with properties, clients, and other industry professionals regarding STR/CoStar’s policies and guidelinesStay knowledgeable and aware of updates or changes to any of STR/CoStar’s methodology, policies, or proceduresPartner closely with STR business development to identify new opportunities, successfully onboard new clients and resolve client inquiresBASIC QUALIFICATIONS:External applicants are expected to have the following name: Director, Lifecycle Marketing LoopNet
job_info: Director, Lifecycle Marketing LoopNet<br>Job Description<br>CoStar is looking for a Director of Lifecycle/CRM Marketing the LoopNet platform.  In this role, you will work with marketing and product teams to create a seamless and powerful customer/client experience.  You will build and execute a communications strategy to foster a positive relationship with our customers and increase the overall customer lifetime value by promoting new product features and partnerships.  The ideal candidate will have a strong sense of the customer/client lifecycle, an ability to iterate on ideas and optimize paid media and other owned channels to grow LoopNet’s customer/client base.  This individual will have experience with Lifecycle marketing and have a keen understanding of how to make the most of every customer/client touchpoint (email capture, impressions, virtual/web sessions).  Ideal candidates will also have experience reporting on advertising and marketing campaigns across channels and strategies.  Experience leading multi-million-dollar ad campaign budgets is required.  Responsibilities: ·Map and analyze our customer/client journey, including building and understanding customer/client personas and segmentation (owners, brokers, tenants and lenders)·Build, manage and maintain automated communication workflows using marketing automation tools·Constantly experiment, test and refine messaging and communication tactics (Email, SMS, push notifications, Social, etc)·Work with product team on go-to-market strategies for new product features and enhancements including messaging, positioning, launch, etc·Create, manage and monitor a reputation management system to achieve higher customer/client satisfaction rates·Build and obsess over success metrics and analytics·Manage and aggregate channel level reporting to build an integrated view of LoopNet’s acquisition landscape and advertising effectiveness Experience/Requirements: ·Bachelors degree required; computer science, engineering or other quantitative studies preferred·7+ years of relevant marketing experience ·3+ years of experience in a lifecycle marketing or growth marketing role·2+ years of media buying experience·Experience working with a large and complex customer base·Experience in an e-commerce business with an omnichannel approach ·Strong project management, attention to detail and no-task-too-small mentality·Possess a combination of B2B and B2C experienceProficient in SQL<br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

name: Software Engineer
job_info: Software Engineer<br>Job Description<br>Software Engineer - CoStar Austin, TXOverview and MissionCoStar is the owner of Lands of America, Land and Farm, Land Watch and Land.com and is the leading operator of online marketplaces that support the sale and purchase of farms, ranches, country homes, and rural land. Our customers include real-estate brokers, real-estate agents, owners, and investors who need internet listing services and information to help them sell/purchase properties and track competitive trends.CoStar is currently seeking a full-time Senior Software Engineer in our Austin office where you will be responsible for designing, developing, and troubleshooting high performance and high availability web applications that will drive the growth of our Land business unit. Key Responsibilities:Analyze technical requirements and design new components, web pages and controls to meet functional, performance and availability requirements.Design ASP.NET Core MVC based applications using React, Typescript, HTML5, CSS, and JavaScript that are highly performant, maintainable and reusable.Design and develop using software design patterns to attain high reusability and maintainability.Apply software design patterns, sound quality management methods, tools, and techniques to create and support defect-free application software that meets the needs of the organizationDevelop database stored procedures and SQL scriptsMaintain and support existing products.Required Skills:BA/BS Degree (Completed)4+ years of development experience in production environmentExpert knowledge of C#, .NET DevelopmentDemonstrated knowledge of SQL and stored procedure developmentDemonstrated knowledge of JavaScript ES6 or Typescript or HTML5/CSSExperience working within an Agile team environmentDemonstrated knowledge of SOLID principals and design patternsPreferred Skills:Experience with software testing (Unit, Integration, Functional, Performance)Experience with Visual Studio or Azure DevOps or GitExperience with ElasticsearchAbility to clearly communicate thoughts and ideas within and across teamsAbility to work well with other developers and managementAbility to juggle priorities and work with minimal supervision or assistance to complete tasksOverview of CoStar: Founded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availability. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; LoopNet, the most heavily trafficked mobile and online real estate marketplace; Apartments.com, the premier rental home resource for renters, property managers and owners; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry; BizBuySell, the largest online marketplace for businesses-for-sales; and Lands of America, the leading operator of online marketplaces for rural real estate. Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of over 4,300 worldwide. WHATS IN IT FOR YOU: Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. In addition to generous compensation and performance-based incentives, you'll be supported in both your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program. Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to): Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription Drug Life, legal, and supplementary insurance Commuter and parking benefits 401(K) retirement plans with matching contributions Employee stock purchase plan Paid time off Tuition reimbursement On-site fitness center and/or reimbursed fitness center membership costs (location dependent), with yoga studio, Pelotons, personal training, group exercise classes, as well as Segway and bikes available for use during the day Complimentary gourmet coffee, tea, hot chocolate, prepared foods, fresh fruit, and other healthy snacks <br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

name: Pricing Analyst I
job_info: Pricing Analyst I<br>Job Description<br>CoStar Group, the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics and online marketplaces, is looking to fill a role on the Pricing and Sales operations team.  The primary responsibility of this role is to partner with the sales organization to provide licensing and pricing expertise. The pricing team serves as trusted advisors to help the sales team move contract proposals through the quote to cash process quickly and seamlessly. The Pricing Analyst will be responsible for ensuring that accurate pricing is provided to existing and prospective clients. They will also ensure alignment with company policy, and triage approvals for any non-standard requests.  This individual will work cross-functionally within the business to deliver successful solutions to our clients.  The role is based out of CoStar’s headquarter office in Washington, DC and will report to the Senior Director of Finance.This position will support a national field sales organization and will require the candidate to work a schedule that provides coverage for the Mountain and Pacific time zones (11-8 ET).Responsibilities:Develop in-depth knowledge of CoStar’s licensing and pricing models in order to provide contract proposal support to our field sales teams.Review and approve proposals submitted through our customer relationship management (CRM) system by the sales’ teams, considering and resolving any compliance, software revenue recognition or legal issues prior to deal closure.Work closely with sales, finance, and marketing to continuously review pricing structure, rates and discounts on existing and new product offerings to ensure competitive market placementCreate recommendations on standard deal structure models.Provide reports and analysis in order to advise management.Provide ad hoc analyses to sales management.Act as a subject matter expert on CoStar sales process and procedures.Serve as subject matter and policy expert for all matters related to software pricing, commercial terms as well as legal complianceConduct market research in order to identify potential competitors for the sales team.Identify internal process improvement initiatives related to proposal and pricing workflows.Required Experience:Bachelor’s Degree Required1-3 years’ experience in sales, sales-oriented finance or sales operations with proven success navigating complex proposals quotes and contracts.Experience working cross-functionally with Sales, Legal, Contracts and FinanceDemonstrated effective verbal and written communication skillsBasic Microsoft Excel skillsOVERVIEW OF COMPANY:Founded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availability. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; LoopNet, the most heavily trafficked mobile and online real estate marketplace; Apartments.com, the premier rental home resource for renters, property managers and owners; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry; BizBuySell, the largest online marketplace for businesses-for-sales; and Lands of America, the leading operator of online marketplaces for rural real estate.Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of over 4,300 worldwide.WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU:Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. In addition to generous compensation and performance-based incentives, you'll be supported in both your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program.Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to):Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription DrugLife, legal, and supplementary insuranceCommuter and parking benefits401(K) retirement plan with matching contributionsEmployee stock purchase planPaid time offTuition reimbursementOn-site fitness center and/or reimbursed fitness center membership costs (location dependent), with yoga studio, Pelotons, personal training, group exercise classes, as well as Segways and bikes available for use during the dayComplimentary gourmet coffee, tea, hot chocolate, prepared foods, fresh fruit, and other healthy snacksBe part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. The Sourcing Lead will take a leading role in driving local and regional cost savings, contributing to overall ROI of procurement performance in line with the overall category strategy. name: Business Analyst
job_info: Business Analyst<br>Job Description<br>OVERVIEW CoStar Group is the world’s leading provider of information and marketing solutions for the commercial real estate industry. Since 1987, we’ve been on a mission to create efficiency and transparency within commercial real estate. From our earliest days, as the first company to offer real estate firms comprehensive, objective, reliable information, to our expansion into operating the most active Internet marketplaces for buying and selling commercial real estate, apartments, businesses and land, we’ve been committed to excellence and creating the most innovative and insight company in our industry. As a technology company, we are the trusted partner for all commercial real estate professionals empowering many of the most well-respected landlords, development companies, brokerage firms, banks, lenders, investors and government agencies.The Finance department is looking for a Business Analyst, who will perform critical data analysis and process support related to billing and contracts on a daily and monthly basis. This individual will work on the Billing Operations team, providing structured data, quantitative insights, and project leadership to drive business results. name: Digital Content Specialist, STR
job_info: Digital Content Specialist, STR<br>Job Description<br>STR was acquired in October 2019 as a division of CoStar Group, Inc., the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics and online marketplaces. STR is in the process of combining CoStar’s largest and most up-to-date properties database with STR’s global hospitality performance data, to give both real estate and hospitality customers a unique and powerful combined view of their local markets.Main Purpose of JobThe Digital Content Specialist is responsible for all elements of the brand copy that underpins STR’s marketing strategy and corporate messaging. The successful candidate will create dynamic original content and update/edit existing content in accordance with STR’s brand voice, tone and style. Additionally, the successful candidate will serve as one of the organization’s subject matter experts on content to ensure consistent and accurate messaging is shared to multiple audiences via engaging and dynamic content. This role will be responsible for the creation of written content for email campaigns and newsletters, website pages, social media campaigns, long-form blog posts and video scripts for STR products and initiatives. This person will also own all content needs for the annual Hotel Data Conference and Global Edition, including attendee marketing emails, prospective sponsorship emails, and social media promotions.Responsibilities:Research, generate and edit a high volume of diverse copy to be used in a variety of public-facing sales and marketing channels, including emails, blogs, websites, multimedia training curriculum, presentations, brochures, social media, etc.Manage content deliverable for multiple audiences (examples: sales copy, educational pieces, customer support messaging).Ensure content is aligned with STR brand standards and corporate culture.Create and implement extensive content plans to market the Hotel Data Conference.Develop pieces specifically focused on SEO – taking keywords into consideration as well as reading level and content length.           Identify keywords to use and when during the year based on search volume and trends.Manage a deadline-driven content calendar and execute a global content strategy across multiple channels.Incorporate ideas and direction into written pieces with minimal direction from other staff.Report on the performance of marketing activity to internal stakeholders and contribute to the improvement and internal reporting of marketing performance.Work with team members from other departments and functions in a timely fashion to ensure deadlines are met.Create short- and long-term content calendars based on availability and relevancy of topics.Keep up to date with market and other industry developments. Attend training as required and actively seek to continually enhance understanding of STR products and value proposition.Attend marketing events, team meetings, kick-off meetings and functions as required.Adhere to all STR processes and policies and maintain customer confidentiality.Exceptional, detail-oriented writer who can create original brand copy and update/edit existing copy in accordance with brand voice, tone and style.Ability to focus on the customer, both internal and external, at all times. Ensure the right message is being delivered.Ability to anticipate and respond to client requirements and a genuine desire to exceed expectations at a global level.The position requires someone with flexible work hours due to interaction with global offices. #LI-SB1Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, or related field from an accredited educational institution.3-5 years’ experience working in digital content role.A background in Marketing is essential.A background in writing is essential.Experience writing for SEO – taking keywords into consideration as well as reading level and content length.      Keyword research – Identifying best keywords to use based on search volume and trends.Familiar with writing for the web, blog posts, product promotions, social, and LinkedIn and Google Ad content.Creating short and long-term content calendars based on availability and relevancy of topics.Excellent use of Microsoft Office applications, proven numeracy and literacy skills.Knowledge of systems such as Salesforce, Mailchimp, Eventbrite, Survey Monkey, social media platforms, CMS platforms, Google Analytics and/or other marketing tools will be beneficial.Preferred Qualifications:Experience within the hospitality industry is desirable but not essential.Consistently focused on delivering an excellent customer-service experience.Capability to build and maintain relationships with internal and external stakeholders.An eye for detail to ensure the release of accurate and timely content often underpinned by hotel performance data.Able to manage a variety of projects to meet a high standard within tight deadlines across multiple time zones.Efficient and effective forward planner of work and projects.Able to create solutions to solve problems and is not afraid to make informed decisions.Ability to focus on the customer, both internal and external, at all times. Ensure the right message is being delivered.Adapts to changing work environments, work priorities and organizational needs.OVERVIEW OF COMPANY: Founded in 1987, we are a NASDAQ listed company with a market cap of over US$30B and sit alongside other notable names such as Amazon, Facebook, Google and Apple. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; LoopNet, the most heavily trafficked mobile and online real estate marketplace; Apartments.com, the premier rental home resource for renters, property managers and owners; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry; BizBuySell, the largest online marketplace for businesses-for-sales; and Lands of America, the leading operator of online marketplaces for rural real estate. As a technology company, we are the trusted partner for all commercial real estate professionals empowering many of the most well-respected landlords, development companies, brokerage firms, banks, lenders, investors and government agencies with our data products and leading marketplaces.  We do this by actively researching the commercial real estate markets and providing data, analytics, innovative tools and powerful marketing platforms in the U.S. and Internationally to help our clients transact with one another. CoStar continues to win multiple awards including one of Forbes most innovative companies (2017) and Fortune’s fastest growing companies (2018). Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of over 4,300 worldwide. WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU: Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. In addition to generous compensation and performance-based incentives, you'll be supported in both your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program. Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to): Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription Drug Life, legal, and supplementary insurance Commuter and parking benefits 401(K) retirement plan with matching contributions Employee stock purchase plan Paid time off Tuition reimbursement On-site fitness center and/or reimbursed fitness center membership costs (location dependent), with yoga studio, Pelotons, personal training, group exercise classes, as well as Segways and bikes available for use during the day Complimentary gourmet coffee, tea, hot chocolate, prepared foods, fresh fruit, and other healthy snacks Be part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. But don't just take our word for it -- see why our team chose to work at and stay at CoStar Group: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CVbJRnJ2sX0 We welcome all qualified candidates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the United States to apply.  However, please note that CoStar is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position.<br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

With a constantly evolving suite of products, successful Sales Executives are skilled at introducing them to their clients.•    Curious - Our best salespeople ask intelligent questions, demonstrate strong listening skills and learn from customers and colleagues•    Excellent communicators - our broad-ranging solutions require clear, concise communication tailored to the relevant audience.•    Committed to Customer Service – Successful Sales Executives at CoStar provide valuable insights and take ownership of their client’s requests, managing them to a successful outcome.WHY COSTAR?•    The industry leader with an energetic and fast paced dynamic culture•    Innovative technology and a reputation for outstanding products•    95% customer renewal rate •    Consistent 20%+ average of year over year growth •    Outstanding sales and product training programs•    Excellent career growth opportunities•    High compensation with uncapped commissions and an outstanding annual Presidents Club trip •    Exceptional benefit plan including an employee discounted stock purchase planBe part of a team of sales professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. name: Sr. Human Resources Business Partner
job_info: Sr. Human Resources Business Partner<br>Job Description<br>Senior HR Business Partner – CoStar – Washington DCOVERVIEW CoStar delivers real-time, verified commercial real estate data that helps clients confidently spot great opportunities and make smart choices ahead of competitors. By combining the power of CoStar’s independent research organization – the industry’s largest – with global data delivery, software, and application solutions, clients can act on opportunities with confidence.Joining the human resources team at CoStar Group, you will contribute to the creation of a highly successful, fast paced, growth oriented global organization. Our people vision and strategy are aligned with CoStar Group’s overall business objectives, and at its core, is centered on attracting, retaining and developing diverse talent in the communities that we operate within.CoStar Group is currently looking for a highly motivated and experienced Senior HR Business Partner to join our team in Washington, DC. If you thrive in a fast paced, growth environment and are results oriented, this is a great opportunity to join a company that continues to beat our growth records and offers opportunities to grow with the business. The primary responsibility of this position is to work closely with the business leaders to develop and implement human resources initiatives that are aligned with business objectives and strategy. Specifically, you will be responsible for driving talent needs through the development and effective execution of talent management programs (e.g., talent development, workforce planning, leadership assessment and development, succession planning, organizational design, performance management and employee retention and engagement). We strive to create a high-performance culture and therefore, you will be involved in coaching management and employees related to policies, procedures and programs and act as a sounding board for compensation and employee relations issues.RESPONSIBILITIES Work with business leadership and employees to understand and anticipate business priorities and translate them into actionable human resources objectives, initiatives and plansProvide counsel to leaders and managers regarding people, policy and organizational decisionsMeet the short- and long-term business objectives through effective facilitation of talent management processes and programs to include the coaching and supporting of business leadersSupport change efforts across the organizationLeverage and adapt as needed HR programs and resourcesShare knowledge and collaborate across functional HR groupsUtilize data driven metrics to make recommendations to improve organizational and business effectivenessSupport acquisition due diligence activities and cultural integration of newly acquired businesses as neededBASIC QUALIFICATIONSBachelor’s degree12 years of HR experience preferably within a technology or informational services environment8 years of experience driving partnerships with business stakeholders5+ years of experience using people analytics and data to drive decision makingPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS Master’s DegreeKnowledge and experience managing performance review, compensation and general HR practicesExcellent listening and communication skillsStrong business acumenExperience using WorkdayOVERVIEW OF COMPANY:Founded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availability. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; LoopNet, the most heavily trafficked mobile and online real estate marketplace; Apartments.com, the premier rental home resource for renters, property managers and owners; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry; BizBuySell, the largest online marketplace for businesses-for-sales; and Lands of America, the leading operator of online marketplaces for rural real estate.Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of over 4,300 worldwide.What's in it for you?Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. In addition to generous compensation and performance-based incentives, you'll be supported in both your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program.Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to):Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription DrugLife, legal, and supplementary insuranceCommuter and parking benefits401(K) retirement plan with matching contributionsEmployee stock purchase planPaid time offTuition reimbursementOn-site fitness center and/or reimbursed fitness center membership costs (location dependent), with yoga studio, Pelotons, personal training, group exercise classes, as well as Segways and bikes available for use during the dayComplimentary gourmet coffee, tea, hot chocolate, prepared foods, fresh fruit, and other healthy snacksBe part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. But don't just take our word for it -- see why our team chose to work at and stay at CoStar Group: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CVbJRnJ2sX0We welcome all qualified candidates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the United States to apply.  However, please note that CoStar is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position.#LI-DC1<br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

name: Senior Market Analyst, Nashville
job_info: Senior Market Analyst, Nashville<br>Job Description<br>OVERVIEW CoStar delivers real-time, verified commercial real estate data that helps clients confidently spot great opportunities and make smart choices ahead of competitors. By combining the power of CoStar’s independent research organization – the industry’s largest – with global data delivery, software, and application solutions, clients can act on opportunities with confidence.The Marketing Research team is the heart of CoStar, capturing market-critical information that enables our commercial real estate clients to make informed, high impact business decisions daily. CoStar Group’s research contributes to the most important segment of our economy, helping businesses open offices, retail stores, warehouses, and manufacturing facilities. CoStar Group is seeking a Senior Market Analyst to join our growing research organization.As CoStar SENIOR MARKET ANALYST, you will compile comprehensive information and data about specific markets. Responsible for the creation of graphics utilizing both Excel and PowerPoint to showcase market trends and analysis for internal and external presentations and reports. Communicate findings regarding the state of their markets. Work side by side with the Researchers, Pipeline Analysts and Research Managers within their markets to share influential market analysis and trends.RESPONSIBILITIESResponsible for producing meaningful, relevant, and insightful analysis of real estate market conditions for inclusion in CoStar’s product offerings. Content will take various forms, including 1) written narratives in CoStar’s market and sub-market reports; 2) visual content included in presentations about the market; 3) verbal discussions about the market with CoStar customers; and 4) written and visual content sent to the media.Works to compile comprehensive information and data about specific markets utilizing that information and personal market knowledge to develop an informed opinion of overall market conditions and peculiarities. Prepares edited market reports that identify trends and data inconsistencies. Uses multiple software platforms to develop/create graphics to showcase market trends and analysis for internal and external presentations and reports. Responsible for analyzing market data and draw insightful conclusions. Responsible for utilizing all the data available at CoStar and to manipulate, aggregate and organize this data to uncover trends, patterns and other insights of interest to the commercial real estate industry.Maintain well-written, timely CRE market and sub-market reports for analysis and commentary on sub-markets and markets covered by CoStar. Commentary should be relevant, insightful, interesting and thought provoking to CoStar clients.Regularly review CoStar data for accuracy, timeliness and quality and ensuring errors and outliers are corrected in a timely manner.Translate analysis and insights into meaningful presentations and deliver them to the market.Deliver in person and video market updates to CoStar clients and industry groups, focusing on economic and CRE trends in the market.Other products containing commentary and analysis may be added as the MA team develops strategies to inform Costar clients and disseminate expert market knowledge.Manages multiple projects simultaneously.BASIC QUALIFICATIONSBachelor's degree, preferably in economics, finance, urban planning or real estate; graduate degree preferred.5+ years of work experience in commercial real estate with familiarity of the local market.PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS Firm understanding of economic theory and principles and their application to the real estate industry.Demonstrated writing skills; ability to write effectively and in large volumes.Strong data and analysis skills, in particular using MS Office.Good communication skills.Polished presentation skills.Strong work ethic and ability to work in a team environment.Must be legally authorized to work in the US.OVERVIEW OF COMPANY:Founded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. name: Senior Software Developer
job_info: Senior Software Developer<br>Job Description<br>]Homesnap, now a member of the CoStar Family, is an award-winning, fast-growing, DC area based company. We’ve built a real estate mobile and web solution that gives real estate agents access to the tools and information that they need to be great agents, and we believe that we can be the most important tool for every real estate agent in the country.We're looking for an object-oriented C# .NET Developer who takes pride in building innovative, scalable applications in pursuit of a great user experience. If this sounds like you, please read on.Every day we make design and development decisions that impact millions of real estate agents and consumers – this is a rare and exciting opportunity to help create something revolutionary!Using .NET and C# we’ve built a highly scalable backend architecture to service our products. If our website and apps are the tip of the iceberg, our .NET services are the bummock (look it up, it’s totally a word).Our infrastructure is built using IIS, SQL Server, RabbitMQ, Redis, AWS (Fargate, EC2, DynamoDB, Redshift, S3), and more. We integrate with several third-party SaaS providers, including SendGrid, Twilio, Pusher, Mixpanel, Zoho, Elastic.co (Elasticsearch), and more. We also leverage various marketing APIs (Facebook, Adwords, etc) to drive our successful revenue products.As an integral member of our world-class development team, you'll help us develop the next generation of Homesnap products, apps and services. You’ll gain experience in many different areas and have the opportunity to make a real impact to the company’s bottom-line.About YouWe’re looking for a teammate, not an “employee”. Someone that has a real passion for building quality products and can take an idea run with it. We want someone who enjoys what they do, loves to learn new things, and has the ability to work both independently and collaboratively with team members.Core ResponsibilitiesUse object-oriented design principles to write efficient, modular C# codeWork with designers, front-end developers and product managers to build modern appsConvert specifications and requirements into functional web servicesModify, test, debug, and implement changes to data-driven apps and librariesDesign and implement data models with SQL and/or LINQ/EFBasic QualificationsBachelor’s Degree4+ years practical, hands-on experience developing with .NET and C#4+ years experience with Microsoft SQL Server1+ years experience working with AWS technologiesPreferred QualificationsDetail-oriented and able to self-manage several concurrent tasksAbility to work both independently and collaboratively with team membersEffective written and verbal communication skills, with both technical and non-technical audiencesFor Special ConsiderationInclude links to websites or apps that you’ve built, along with a description of your role and responsibilitiesInclude links to your AngelList, Github, or StackOverflow profileWe welcome all qualified candidates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the United States to apply. name: Senior Quality Assurance Engineer
job_info: Senior Quality Assurance Engineer<br>Job Description<br>Homesnap, now a member of the CoStar Family, is an award-winning, fast-growing, DC area based company. We’ve built a real estate mobile and web solution that gives real estate agents access to the tools and information that they need to be great agents, and we believe that we can be the most important tool for every real estate agent in the country. We're looking for a Senior Quality Assurance to join our growing team to ensure we ship world-class software. We don’t cut corners, and we don’t make compromises—we aim to create reliable products that are polished, fast, well-tested, and a joy for people to use.You will join the dynamic engineering team responsible for building and testing all of Homesnap’s software products. You will work closely will developers and project management to track, test, and deliver high-quality software written in a variety of programming languages (C#, SQL, JavaScript, Swift, Kotlin, and beyond). You’re organized, methodical, fun, and love the details!RESPONSIBILITIESEstablishing and maintaining automation pipeline for development efforts Provides oversight into key quality assurance metricsCreates and maintains SQA deliverables including bug reports, test plans, test cases, test data, and overall project progressManually tests new functionality simultaneously built out on native apps and our web application. Coordinates testing efforts with engineers, designers, and managementBASIC QUALIFICATIONS5+ years of software development QA experienceExperience setting up automation frameworks such as selenium, cucumber, etc and integrating them into a CI/CD pipeline from scratchExperience with testing/debugging tools including Chrome Debugger, Postman, Fiddler, Kibana, Firebase, Etc.Proven ability to own a complete functional area of an application or productKnowledge of modern web, iOS, and Android development practicesStrong communication skills (to both business and technical partners)Excellent problem solving skillsBachelor’s Degree  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS (Nice to haves)Experience creating automated tests for web, api and mobile applications. Proven ability to deliver on creating and automating tests in addition to providing manual test coverage for development teamsExperience with native application development a plusLaser-focused on the smallest details that are meaningful to our customers yet comfortable with iterative and incremental development #LI-AR1<br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing<br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

name: Data Analyst
job_info: Data Analyst<br>Job Description<br>Position Overview:Apartments.com is the leading online apartment listing website, connecting renters to more than 1mm rentals across the country. Powered by CoStar, the Apartments.com network of home rental sites includes Apartments.com, ApartmentFinder.com, Apartamentos.com, ForRent.com, ApartmentHomeLiving.com, and WestsideRentals.com. These unique rental sites offer advertisers expansive exposure for their available rental listings of all kinds.The Apartments.com analytics and reporting team is looking for a self-starter with 1-5 years of hands-on data analytics or reporting experience.  In this role, analysts will be expected learn essential business functions, develop key metrics, and deliver analyses and reporting that contribute to business decisions across the organization. Candidates will be required to work cross-functionally with management, analysts, developers, and product teams to meet objectives and deliver actionable insights to the business.Within the role, analysts will have the opportunity to explore all areas of the data analysis discipline including database design & architecture, query creation & optimization, ETL creation & maintenance, on-demand report creation, and analytic modeling.Essential Team Functions:Partner across departments to identify key information gaps and plans to provide or obtain that informationUtilize multiple data sources (primarily MS/T-SQL) build datasets and perform ad hoc analyses that drive actionable insights for the businessDesign and build reports, create models and analyses to identify trends and improve existing business processesDevelop metrics and create dashboards to understand trends and track progress against key metricsExperience, Skills and Qualifications:1-5 years of data analytics experience with experience, including:SQL experience including query writing, dataset creationAnalytical programming experienceStrong technical aptitude with the ability to analyze data, interpret information and trends in large amounts of data to develop actionable recommendationsAbility to work on multiple projects and deliverables simultaneously and quickly adapt as business needs and objectives changeAbility to work both as an individual and within a team to resolve issues, create new approaches to analyzing data, and drive decisions and consensus within the businessBA/BS degree required.Technical Skills:Intermediate SQL knowledge and experienceFamiliarity with other scripting languages (R, Python, JavaScript, etc.)Intermediate experience in data visualization (PowerBI, Tableau)<br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

name: Manager, Finance Customer Contact Center
job_info: Manager, Finance Customer Contact Center<br>Job Description<br>OVERVIEW CoStar delivers real-time, verified commercial real estate data that helps clients confidently spot great opportunities and make smart choices ahead of competitors. By combining the power of CoStar’s independent research organization – the industry’s largest – with global data delivery, software, and application solutions, clients can act on opportunities with confidence.At CoStar Group, our finance group centralizes transaction processes, providing accurate reporting, financial resolutions, and proper forecasting analysis. Joining the team offers access to financial specializations, including accounts payable, accounts receivable, cash and asset management, client contracts and billing, and revenue recognition.CoStar Group is continuing to grow and is looking of an energetic, customer focused, problem-solver to join our Finance Customer Contact management team as Manager, Finance Customer Contact Center in our office in downtown Richmond, VA!The Manager is responsible for one of our Finance Customer Care support teams.  The team receives, analyzes, and resolves inquiries/and tickets from our internal and external stakeholders.Key deliverables include partnering and building meaningful relationships with the sales organization, internal sales support teams, and other functional lanes within Finance.RESPONSIBILITIES Helps direct the finance support team with business leaders in all daily activities to deliver a ‘World Class’ Customer experience to all stakeholders.Directs email support center activities that assess & trouble-shoot all billing, contracts and other finance questions that come from sales (internal) or clients (external).Accomplishes the department objectives by recruiting, selecting, training, scheduling, coaching; communicating job expectations; planning, monitoring, measuring department key performance indicators (KPIs).Supports directional assistance to stakeholders to provide contract clarity, contract updates, billing support and collections details.Meets customer service finance objectives by forecasting headcount requirements, preparing targets, measuring department performance, and proposing new work methods/processes and system efficiencies.Maintains existing Service Level Agreements (SLAs) that promote “Best in Class” Quality, Service, and Productivity metrics.Improves customer service quality results by studying, evaluating, and re-designing processes; establishing and communicating service metrics; monitoring and analyzing results; implementing change.BASIC QUALIFICATIONSBachelor’s degree in Accounting, Business, or related field is required.5+ years of contracts or other customer/sales support within CoStar or related experience in an external high-volume sales/customer contact center.Preferred candidates will have hands-on CoStar and/or Apartments.com experience with (internal) Enterprise/CRM.Possesses management acumen and leadership skills.PREFERRED QUALIFCATIONS AND SKILLS Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.Advanced data analyticsAbility to track & assess KPIsLean Six Sigma certificationsOracle experience is preferred.OVERVIEW OF COMPANY:Founded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availability. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; LoopNet, the most heavily trafficked mobile and online real estate marketplace; Apartments.com, the premier rental home resource for renters, property managers and owners; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry; BizBuySell, the largest online marketplace for businesses-for-sales; and Lands of America, the leading operator of online marketplaces for rural real estate.Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of over 4,300 worldwide.WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU:Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. With a constantly evolving suite of products, successful Sales Executives are skilled at introducing them to their clients.•    Curious - Our best salespeople ask intelligent questions, demonstrate strong listening skills and learn from customers and colleagues•    Excellent communicators - our broad-ranging solutions require clear, concise communication tailored to the relevant audience.•    Committed to Customer Service – Successful Sales Executives at CoStar provide valuable insights and take ownership of their client’s requests, managing them to a successful outcome.WHY COSTAR?•    The industry leader with an energetic and fast paced dynamic culture•    Innovative technology and a reputation for outstanding products•    95% customer renewal rate •    Consistent 20%+ average of year over year growth •    Outstanding sales and product training programs•    Excellent career growth opportunities•    High compensation with uncapped commissions and an outstanding annual Presidents Club trip •    Exceptional benefit plan including an employee discounted stock purchase planBe part of a team of sales professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. name: Asset Manager
job_info: Asset Manager<br>Job Description<br>CoStar Group is the world’s leading provider of information and marketing solutions for the Commercial Real Estate industry. We are a NASDAQ listed company with a market cap of over US$30B and sit alongside other notable names such as Amazon, Facebook, Google and Apple.Ten-X Commercial, a CoStar Group Company, is the world's largest online commercial real estate marketplace, conducting more transactions via an online auction format than any other platform in the world.  Ten-X recently surpassed $24 Billion in closed transactions, averaging between $2-3 Billion in closings each year since inception in 2009.  Ten-X assists commercial owners and brokers in selling and closing transactions through worldwide marketing campaigns and a best in class process which provides transparency, efficiency and expedited selling and closing time frames.The Asset Manager is the main support role for sell-side positions, responsible for working with the Sellers, Brokers, and Buyers throughout the lifecycle of assets on the Ten-X platform, including during asset onboarding, the marketing period, and through the successful sale of the asset. The Asset Manager is responsible for overseeing and managing all aspects of CRE transactional activities necessary to provide a smooth and professional experience to Sellers and Brokers. This role is a customer-facing role with focus on process and operational items in addition to customer experience.Specifically, the Asset Manager is responsible for managing a wide range of (a) operational functions throughout the real estate transaction process, and (b) supporting the company’s mission to become the preeminent online marketplace for real estate sales. The position requires a working knowledge of commercial real estate, in addition to interpersonal, organizational, technical, and analytical skills to achieve superior sales execution through operational excellence and efficiency.This position is responsible for onboarding commercial real estate assets to the Ten-X platform, as well as coordinating logistics and communication with Sellers and/or Brokers on the sell-side required for a successful transaction.  Once a seller and broker are ready to onboard and list assets with Ten-X, the Asset Manager professionally facilitates the process of bringing those assets online with support from the Operations team and through the use of various internal systems, which are collectively and interdependently used to input, store, and organize all data, descriptors, photographs, due diligence documents, and any other variables necessary for assets to be placed on the Ten-X platform for public viewing.Additionally, the Asset Manager collects and reviews all commercial real estate due diligence within a compressed timeline from the Business Development Associates, Sellers, and Brokers. The Asset Manager must regularly coordinate and support the scheduling of recurring update calls with Sellers, Brokers, and Business Development Associates, while preparing structured reports for recurring calls.RESPONSIBILITIES:Responsible for overseeing the onboarding of commercial real estate assets to the Ten-X platform and ensuring assets are ready to be sold via auction.  Act as the single point of contact and own the life cycle of assigned account transactions from onboarding, marketing, sale and close of escrow.Manage the day-to-day transactional and customer support functions related to pre-event, event, and post-event activities for all assigned Sellers and/or Brokers on the sell-side.Review initial onboarding of assets completed by the Operations team; collect, analyze, and organize additional due diligence, data points, descriptors, photographs, other system-required variables and marketing material in order to showcase all property page(s) on the website optimally.Work closely with Marketing and Operations team to ensure accuracy of marketing collateral for each assigned asset, including, but not limited to, the property webpage (including photo gallery, property details/overview, broker info), event marketing brochure, and signage.Conduct a “kick-off” call with all stakeholders, including Brokers, Sellers, Business Development and Marketing Associates, to discuss the sales process, expectations, and deadlines.Oversee the review, finalization, and publishing of 3rd party reports. Ensure Purchase and Sale Agreements and Title commitments are prepared and finalized two-weeks prior to the auction date.Understand the value drivers of the asset being sold including market strength/ weaknesses, stability/ variability of cash flows, capital needs, environmental concerns, and reduce investor risk by gathering and providing as much information as necessary to underwrite the transaction.Successfully manage and organize weekly seller update calls, which entails gathering market feedback, guidance, and analytics, as well as requesting any missing diligence materials.Serve as a dedicated resource for Sellers and guide them through the Ten-X process in a professional and transparent manner.Engage with all interested investors, helping build an investor profile by saving relevant information to internal systems, and determine level of interest, pricing guidance, and items needed to participate in the auction.Minimize, to the extent possible, auction surprises by communicating auction expectations including number of bidders and pricing guidance, to the Auction Manager.Manage the auction for the seller on auction day to include placing bids, changing increments, conducting auction day call (“qualifying the deal”)Effectively communicate and promote the benefits of the Ten-X platform to Sellers, Brokers, and Buyers, educating them on the nuances of the Ten-X platform and the various transaction methods (i.e. Live Bid, Managed Bid).Produce, review, and interpret reports as necessary for various stakeholders.Work productively and collaboratively with other business units, such as, Business Development, Contracts/Legal, Title/Escrow, Marketing, and Operations to ensure maximum chance of successful marketing, sale and closing of assigned assets.BASIC QUALIFICATIONSBachelor’s degree3 years of experience with commercial real estate transaction management, escrow and/or mortgage loan sale transactions including timelines, required documentation, and disclosures.3 years of demonstrated analytical and organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to handle confidential material within the CRE arena.PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONSReal estate broker or salesperson license a plusIntermediate/advanced Microsoft Excel skills and basic knowledge of other Microsoft Office applications.Demonstrated sales support and consulting capabilities for real estate assets.Experience in communicating effectively both written and verbally with internal and external parties (i.e. Sellers, buyers, and Brokers).Should be a self-motivated, organized individual, with a keen ability to multi-task at a high level and make independent decisions with minimal supervision. Understanding and Mastery of specialized internal databases and reporting systems to provide relevant data and information to Sellers, Brokers, and the Business Development team quickly.WHATS IN IT FOR YOU:Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. In addition to generous compensation and performance-based incentives, you'll be supported in both your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program.Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to):Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription DrugLife, legal, and supplementary insuranceCommuter and parking benefits401(K) retirement plan with matching contributionsEmployee stock purchase planPaid time offTuition reimbursementOn-site fitness center and/or reimbursed fitness center membership costs (location dependent), with yoga studio, Pelotons, personal training, group exercise classes, as well as Segways and bikes available for use during the dayComplimentary gourmet coffee, tea, hot chocolate, prepared foods, fresh fruit, and other healthy snacksBe part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. name: Regional Vice President, Apartments.com - Denver, CO
job_info: Regional Vice President, Apartments.com - Denver, CO<br>Job Description<br>OVERVIEWApartments.com is the leading online apartment rental listing website, offering property, commuter, and neighborhood information for more than 1,000,000 available units nationwide. A CoStar Group subsidiary, the Apartments.com network includes Apartments.com, ForRent.com, ApartmentFinder.com, Apartamentos.com, ApartmentHomeLiving.com, ForRentUniversity.com, After55.com, CorporateHousing.com and WestsideRentals.com. Reaching millions of renters worldwide, enabling both qualified traffic and highly engaged renters, Apartments.com is the fastest growing site within the residential rental industry.As a Regional Vice President for Apartments.com you will be responsible for leading a team of Regional Sales Directors and Sales Associates to achieve revenue growth goals, maintain renewal goals and expand revenue opportunities. The qualified executive will be responsible for building and developing a high-performing sales organization and culture. To be successful, you will inspire and create excitement with the customer base and sales prospects, your sales teams, as well as across the entire organization and in the marketplace.
