name: Software Engineer
job_info: Software Engineer<br>Job Description<br>Job DescriptionHomesnap, now a member of the CoStar Family, is an award-winning, fast-growing, DC area based company. We’ve built a real estate mobile and web solution that gives real estate agents access to the tools and information that they need to be great agents, and we believe that we can be the most important tool for every real estate agent in the country.We're looking for an object-oriented C# .NET Developer who takes pride in building innovative, scalable applications in pursuit of a great user experience. If this sounds like you, please read on.Every day we make design and development decisions that impact millions of real estate agents and consumers – this is a rare and exciting opportunity to help create something revolutionary!Using .NET and C# we’ve built a highly scalable backend architecture to service our products. If our website and apps are the tip of the iceberg, our .NET services are the bummock (look it up, it’s totally a word).Our infrastructure is built using IIS, SQL Server, RabbitMQ, Redis, AWS (Fargate, EC2, DynamoDB, Redshift, S3), and more. We integrate with several third-party SaaS providers, including SendGrid, Twilio, Pusher, Mixpanel, Zoho, Elastic.co (Elasticsearch), and more. We also leverage various marketing APIs (Facebook, Adwords, etc) to drive our successful revenue products.As an integral member of our world-class development team, you'll help us develop the next generation of Homesnap products, apps and services. You’ll gain experience in many different areas and have the opportunity to make a real impact to the company’s bottom-line.About YouWe’re looking for a teammate, not an “employee”. Someone that has a real passion for building quality products and can take an idea run with it. We want someone who enjoys what they do, loves to learn new things, and has the ability to work both independently and collaboratively with team members.Core ResponsibilitiesUse object-oriented design principles to write efficient, modular C# codeWork with designers, front-end developers and product managers to build modern appsConvert specifications and requirements into functional web servicesModify, test, debug, and implement changes to data-driven apps and librariesDesign and implement data models with SQL and/or LINQ/EFBasic QualificationsBachelor’s Degree2+ years practical, hands-on experience developing with .NET and C#2+ years experience with Microsoft SQL Server1+ years experience working with AWS technologiesPreferred QualificationsDetail-oriented and able to self-manage several concurrent tasksAbility to work both independently and collaboratively with team membersEffective written and verbal communication skills, with both technical and non-technical audiencesFor Special ConsiderationInclude links to websites or apps that you’ve built, along with a description of your role and responsibilitiesInclude links to your AngelList, Github, or StackOverflow profileWe welcome all qualified candidates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the United States to apply. However, please note that CoStar is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position.<br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

job_info: Lead Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC) Engineer<br>Job Description<br>Lead Governance, Risk, & Compliance (GRC) EngineerReporting to the Manager of Cybersecurity, the Lead Compliance Engineer will be responsible to establish and maintain the Governance, Risk and Compliance program including CCPA, GDPR, PCI-DSS, SOC1, SOC2 Type II, SOX, and any additional compliance requirements CoStar encounters. The Lead Compliance Engineer will work with our internal teams and various marketplaces to help formulate, test and measure control testing procedures. Specifically, the candidate will assist in the creation, maintenance, and enhancement of risk reduction initiatives and drive report output for key security and compliance threat vectors such as infrastructure and compliance risk, third-party suppliers, security incidents, data transfers, vulnerability assessments, system entitlements, etc. In addition to construction and management of the security controls testing lifecycle, this individual will be fundamental in interpreting the data as a subject matter expert adding value to CoStar’s overall compliance testing framework. The candidate will collaborate with key partners across the organization and distill information into management and executive-level reporting. The candidate will have a strong understanding of security and compliance related risks and controls, and effectively collaborate with multiple stakeholders.In this role, the Lead Compliance Engineer will develop Policies, Standards, Security baselines, risk framework & treatment strategy, maintenance of compliance framework, as well as build & measure KRI & KPI metrics for compliance. Additionally, the Lead Compliance Engineer will execute the planning and performance of risk assessments, while working directly with the technical and business stakeholders to identify appropriate risk factors, assess the adequacy of existing controls, assist and drive remediation of control weaknesses to ensure compliance requirements are maintained.What You’ll Be Doing:Lead the IT Compliance ProgramsContribute to the development, administration and regular enhancement of CoStar’s risk-based security controlsManage and track certification and audit work as it relates to PCI-DSS, SOX, SOC1, You will own and be responsible for deeply understanding what drives the business for which you are helping with the testing to ensure the products we release are defect free. name: Director, Trust & Safety
job_info: Director, Trust & Safety<br>Job Description<br>DIRECTOR, TRUST & SAFETY – APARTMENTS.COM – ATLANTA, GA OVERVIEW Seeking an experienced risk professional to lead the Apartments.com Trust and Safety team. You will lead a growing team of fraud investigators, a project manager, and a data analyst to protect our platforms, including rental payments, from fraud and abuse.  As a leader within the Apartments organization and a subject matter expert in your field, you will be responsible for growing and scaling teams, processes, and tools. You will regularly engage with senior leadership, analytics teams, product managers, developers, cross-functional partners, and vendors to develop strategy, drive roadmaps, build risk systems and platforms, increase automation, and ensure operational excellence.  ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES You’ll develop, implement, own, and improve end-to-end risk processes. You’ll design scalable risk and fraud prevention and detection solutions that account for customer growth, product innovation, and a diverse group of marketplaces. You’ll collaborate with key cross functional stakeholders to mitigate risk across CoStar Group’s suite of brands. You’ll work closely with development teams to build fraud solutions into products. You’ll lead, develop, and mentor a high-performing team. You’ll produce metrics to show the performance of the fraud prevention teams and systems for use in management reporting. You’ll manage and develop a vendor portfolio that complements our suite of internal fraud detection and security applications. You’ll manage complicated escalations, including press inquiries, and quickly execute remediation strategies. You’ll build solutions that reduce spam across our platforms, enhancing the customer experience, and improving our products. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS 8+ years of experience in within risk, fraud, cyber security, trust and safety, investigations, payments, or spam prevention 5+ years of experience building, managing, and leading teams Knowledge of e-commerce and payments industry practices (e.g., disputes processes, fraud types, and network rules)  Experience using anti-fraud machine learning and analytical reporting software  Experience working with ambiguity, make recommendations to a wide range of stakeholders, and deliver results. Strong project management skills with experience delivering high quality results in tight deadline environments Outstanding written and verbal communications skills and comfort engaging with senior leadership Bachelor’s degree in Technology, Business, Statistics, Public Policy, or related field  PREFERRED QUALIFCATIONS AND SKILLS Experience writing SQL to query relational databases is a plus  Experience managing fraud and risk across multiple marketplaces Masters’ degree in Technology, Business, Statistics, Public Policy, or related field  ABOUT COSTAR GROUP CoStar Group is the world’s leading provider of information and marketing solutions for the commercial real estate industry. We are a publicly traded company (NASDAQ:CSGP) with a market cap of over US$30B and sit alongside other notable names such as Amazon, Facebook, Google, and Apple. We've been living and breathing the world of commercial real estate information and marketplaces for over 30 years, giving us the perspective to create truly unique and valuable offerings. We’re working to build a world where people can reach their real estate goals more efficiently and effectively with the best tools and information available. That’s why we created CoStar Group, and that vision keeps us moving forward every day. We do this by actively researching the commercial real estate markets and providing data, analytics, innovative tools, and powerful marketing platforms in the U.S. and Internationally to help our clients transact with one another. CoStar Group continues to win multiple awards including one of Forbes most innovative companies (2014, 2017) and Fortune’s fastest growing companies (2016, 2018, 2020). Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of approximately 4,900 worldwide, including the industry’s largest professional research organization.WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU? Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. In addition to generous compensation and performance-based incentives, you'll be supported in both your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program. Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to): Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription Drug Life, legal, and supplementary insurance Commuter and parking benefits 401(K) retirement plan with matching contributions Employee stock purchase plan Paid time off Tuition reimbursement Complimentary gourmet coffee, tea, prepared foods, fresh fruit, and other healthy snacks Be part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. But don't just take our word for it -- see why our team chose to work at and stay at CoStar Group: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CVbJRnJ2sX0 We welcome all qualified candidates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the United States to apply. However, please note that CoStar is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position. <br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

job_info: Executive Assistant<br>Job Description<br>Executive Assistant to SVP of Global Marketing ResearchJob Description:CoStar is pleased to be seeking an Executive Assistant to support our Senior Vice President of Global Marketing Research.  This role is full-time based in our beautiful Richmond, VA office.  The best candidate for this role will be a resourceful self-starter with the ability to take initiative and see things through juggling competing priorities and taking pride in flawless execution and quick thinking.  The company is in growth mode and the support of a strong assistant is necessary to help propel our Senior Vice President of Research to be more effective and efficient in leading the research department forward.  They are an outgoing, energetic, and genuine group that value hard work, teamwork, and innovation – no day is the same!Primary Responsibilities:Schedule all meetings and make all travel arrangements for the SVP, including overseeing/managing the SVP’s calendar and scheduling appointments by balancing priorities and effectively negotiating with internal & external resources.Provide the SVP with background information and /or supporting documents in preparation for scheduled appointments, meetings, speaking engagements, conferences, interviews, etc.Provide administrative support such as expense reimbursement, call screening, submitting purchase orders, managing distribution groups and other record-keeping functions.Compose, modify, and proofread email correspondence, reports and presentations. name: Market Manager
job_info: Market Manager<br>Job Description<br>OVERVIEW:CoStar delivers real-time, verified commercial real estate data that helps clients confidently spot great opportunities and make smart choices ahead of competitors. By combining the power of CoStar’s independent research organization – the industry’s largest – with global data delivery, software, and application solutions, clients can act on opportunities with confidence.The Marketing Research team is the heart of CoStar, capturing market-critical information that enables our commercial real estate clients to make informed, high impact business decisions daily. CoStar Group’s research contributes to the most important segment of our economy, helping businesses open offices, retail stores, warehouses, and manufacturing facilities. Costar Group is seeking a Market Manager to join our growing research organization.As a Market Manager, you will be leading a team of Researchers who are responsible for investigating and profiling companies to help owners, brokers and real estate professionals identify which companies are best suited for their buildings. CoStar Group’s research contributes to the most important segment of our economy, helping businesses open offices, stores, and warehouse and manufacturing facilities. name: Mid-Market Sales Associate, Apartments.com - Norfolk, VA

name: Senior Accountant
job_info: Senior Accountant<br>Job Description<br>CoStar delivers real-time, verified commercial real estate data that helps clients confidently spot great opportunities and make smart choices ahead of competitors. By combining the power of CoStar’s independent research organization – the industry’s largest – with global data delivery, software, and application solutions, clients can act on opportunities with confidence.At CoStar Group, our finance group centralizes transaction processes, providing accurate reporting, financial resolutions, and proper forecasting analysis. Joining the team offers access to financial specializations, including accounts payable, accounts receivable, cash and asset management, client contracts and billing, and revenue recognition.As a Senior Accountant, you will be primarily responsible for assisting in the global monthly revenue close process, including preparation of (i) monthly journal entries, (ii) account reconciliations, and (iii) variance analyses related to the monthly results. This position will also collaboration with the Financial Planning and Analysis, Billings, Cash collections and Revenue Service teams to assist in the monthly close process and to understand fluctuations from budget and forecast. The Senior Accountant should have a general knowledge Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (“GAAP”) and experience (i) working within a monthly close process, (ii) preparing journal entries and account reconciliations, (iii) identifying and improving monthly processes. The Senior Accountant should be eager to learn and demonstrate strong communication, time management and organizational skills. The Senior Accountant should be highly adaptable to change due to Costar’s rapid growth via organic growth and acquisitions. The Senior Accountant will have a strong work ethic and the ability to work both independently and collaboratively. This position will report to the Director of Revenue.This position may get exposure to technical accounting issues and interactions with external auditors related to the close process, account reconciliations and variance analyses.RESPONSIBILITIES· Preparation of monthly journal entries and supporting schedules and review of monthly financial results· Assistance in a variety of aspects of the Enterprise Resource Planning system implementation· Assistance with special projects within department or as part of cross-functional teams· Research technical accounting issues· Work with external auditors and facilitate review of the close process, account reconciliations and variance analyses· Ensure timely monthly close and accurate monthly resultsBASIC QUALIFICATIONS· B.A in Accounting with CPA or pursing CPA· 3-5 years’ experience working in a large international public company and/or Big 4 accounting firm (preferred)· Preparing or review monthly journal entries and account reconciliations· Implementing processes· Experience with Oracle Fusion a plus· Strong project management, time management, and organizational skills· General knowledge of GAAP guidelines and ability to enhance knowledge and apply to a variety of situations (ASC 606 experience preferred)· Familiarity with systems and optimizing use of systems to generate data for analyses· Strong Excel skills requiredOVERVIEW OF COMPANY:Founded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availability. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; LoopNet, the most heavily trafficked mobile and online real estate marketplace; Apartments.com, the premier rental home resource for renters, property managers and owners; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry; BizBuySell, the largest online marketplace for businesses-for-sales; and Lands of America, the leading operator of online marketplaces for rural real estate.Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of over 4,300 worldwide.WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. In addition to generous compensation and performance-based incentives, you'll be supported in both your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program.Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to):· Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription Drug· Life, legal, and supplementary insurance· Commuter and parking benefits· 401(K) retirement plan with matching contributions· Employee stock purchase plan· Paid time off· Tuition reimbursement· On-site fitness center and/or reimbursed fitness center membership costs (location dependent), with yoga studio, Pelotons, personal training, group exercise classes, as well as Segway’s and bikes available for use during the day· Complimentary gourmet coffee, tea, hot chocolate, prepared foods, fresh fruit, and other healthy snacksBe part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. However, please note that CoStar is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position<br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

job_info: Senior Market Analyst<br>Job Description<br>SENIOR MARKET ANALYST – COSTAR – BIRMINGHAM  OVERVIEWCoStar delivers real-time, verified commercial real estate data that helps clients confidently spot great opportunities and make smart choices ahead of competitors. name: Associate Editor - Cleveland, OH
job_info: Associate Editor - Cleveland, OH<br>Job Description<br>OVERVIEW:As a Hotel News Now Associate Editor, you will be responsible for both writing and curating content covering the global hotel industry as well as copyediting and other editing/proofreading/website production tasks. Our team covers stories happening around the world and most reporting is done over the phone, with some in-person interviewing. Additionally, the Associate Editor participates in other related functions of Hotel News Now, including social media, some video production and more; and provides some administrative support to the office.Our award-winning team of journalists delivers daily news, analysis and features about the business of buying, selling and operating hotels to our readers around the world. Hotel News Now enjoys a top-notch reputation in the travel industry for its unbiased, thorough reporting; involvement in the industry; and access to C-suite leaders at all levels of the hotel industry.Hotel News Now is the go-to news source for the global hotel industry. Founded in 2008 as the news division of STR, Hotel News Now joined CoStar Group, Inc,. the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces through an acquisition in October 2019. STR is in the process of combining CoStar’s largest and most up-to-date properties database with STR’s global hospitality performance data, to give both real estate and hospitality customers a unique and powerful combined view of their local markets.RESPONSIBILITIES:Demonstrate an ability to report and write content at the level required for the position, which includes but is not limited to: Multisource news and feature stories; coverage of public company earnings calls, coordinating publication of regular lists and curated content; coverage of industry events; and more.Demonstrate strong editing skills, both big-picture content editing and copyediting, according to AP Style. job_info: Sales Associate, CoStar – Ft. Lauderdale, FL<br>Job Description<br>CoStar Group is the world’s leading provider of information and marketing solutions for the Commercial Real Estate industry.  We are a NASDAQ listed company with a market cap of over $30B.+As a technology company, we are the trusted partner for all commercial real estate professionals empowering many of the most well-respected landlords, development companies, brokerage firms, banks, lenders, investors and government agencies.We do this by actively researching the commercial real estate markets and providing data, analytics, innovative tools and powerful marketing platforms in the U.S. and Internationally to help our clients transact with one another. CoStar continues to win multiple awards including one of Forbes most innovative companies (2017) and Fortune’s fastest growing companies (2020). As a CoStar Sales Associate you will prospect and engage potential clients while managing, nurturing, and growing our existing client base. Promoting both CoStar and LoopNet products, you will have the opportunity to take an entrepreneurial approach to sell, train, and retain your book of business.  You will receive a first class onboarding and training experience where you will learn how the different players in Commercial Real Estate operate, what is important to them and what solutions we have that meet their needs. You will have your own book of business, an endless supply of well qualified leads to develop, excellent products to sell, an excellent career development path.  RESPONSIBILITIESGain a thorough understanding of your clients and their needsBecome an expert in CoStar’s critical information and marketing solutions including LoopNet, the leading online commercial real estate marketplaceComplete ownership of the full sales cycle including: prospecting, demoing, closing, onboarding, training and renewingConduct a high level of in person client and prospect product demonstrationsProvide valuable insight to all participants in the commercial property market, including Brokers, Owners, Investors, Lenders, Appraisers and Service ProvidersRepresent CoStar by hosting and attending industry events and networking with commercial real estate professionals in your marketBASIC QUALIFICATIONSBachelor’s degree requiredClient facing experience in the Commercial Real Estate industry strongly preferredTwo or more years of successful outside sales experience in a B2B environment selling Data, Research and Analytic platforms or tools, commercial real estate, financial services, business intelligence, marketing or information providers. Proven track record exceeding sales targets and quotas in a consultative sales environmentTwo or more years of experience training clients on how to use a solution post saleOUR BEST PERFORMERS AREPassionate, hard-working and ambitious – As an innovator, we are fast paced and creative and expect our Sales Associates to move quickly to seize opportunity.Fast to learn new concepts and apply them - CoStar clients and prospects are diverse and demanding. name: Customer Support Specialist
job_info: Customer Support Specialist<br>Job Description<br>OVERVIEW Ten-X Commercial, a CoStar Group Company, is the world's largest online commercial real estate marketplace, conducting more transactions via an online auction format than any other platform in the world.  Ten-X recently surpassed $24 Billion in closed transactions, averaging between $2-3 Billion in closings each year since inception in 2009.  Ten-X assists commercial owners and brokers in selling and closing transactions through worldwide marketing campaigns and a best-in-class process which provides transparency, efficiency and expedited selling and closing time frames.As an Auction Support Specialist, you will be responsible for customer assistance and engagement through our various inbound communication channels and approving prospective buyers to bid on the Ten-X platform. The role serves as the primary contact for bidder registration and is responsible for resolving common inbound customer issues as received through Ten-X’s customer service lines and chats.  This includes engaging clients to gather and input proof of funds and organizational documents.RESPONSIBILITIES The Customer Auction Support Specialist remains primarily available for customer assistance and engagement through our various inbound communication channels. The role is responsible for serving as a generalist, tasked with resolving most common inbound customer issues while providing white-glove service that illuminates the Ten-X value proposition. Register prospective buyers to bid by reviewing and approving proof of funds, lending commitments, and organizational documents.Handle case by case escalations to determine proof of funds provided that fit outside company standards.Manage and process defaulted bidders and facilitate defaulted bidder reinstatement process.Manage offline deposit holds for auction registrations and the return of all post auction deposits.Be able to multitask, prioritize, and demonstrate good time management skills.Being able to resolve the most common issues/aspects/objections while delivering a stellar customer experience.Being equipped to converse intelligently about the Ten-X platform while guiding user through the most common aspects.Along with serving as a first point of contact for inbound inquiries, this role will identify/capture prospective inbound leads for our sales channels.Enter customer information into the customer relationship management system (Salesforce) and assign prospects to sales channels as needed.Identify, communicate, and troubleshoot any technical issues or concerns that arise.Escalate matters to technology team to work through and fix any concerns.Support internal partners and stakeholders with all registration related items. This requires an in-depth overall understanding of the entire Ten-X Commercial platform.BASIC QUALIFICATIONSBachelor’s degree required.Proficient in Microsoft applications including Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and OutlookDemonstrated ability to leverage tools, processes, training and coaching to improve the customer experience.Strong Customer service orientation.Solid interpersonal communication skills particularly telephone etiquette skills.Time management and prioritization.Multitasking proficiency.PREFERRED QUALIFCATIONS AND SKILLS Background in a call center, mortgage servicing and or real estate preferred.OVERVIEW OF COMPANY:Founded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availability. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; LoopNet, the most heavily trafficked mobile and online real estate marketplace; Apartments.com, the premier rental home resource for renters, property managers and owners; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry; BizBuySell, the largest online marketplace for businesses-for-sales; and Lands of America, the leading operator of online marketplaces for rural real estate.Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of over 4,300 worldwide.WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU:Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. In addition to generous compensation and performance-based incentives, you'll be supported in both your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program.Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to):Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription DrugLife, legal, and supplementary insuranceCommuter and parking benefits401(K) retirement plan with matching contributionsEmployee stock purchase planPaid time offTuition reimbursementOn-site fitness center and/or reimbursed fitness center membership costs (location dependent), with yoga studio, Pelotons, personal training, group exercise classes, as well as Segways and bikes available for use during the dayComplimentary gourmet coffee, tea, hot chocolate, prepared foods, fresh fruit, and other healthy snacksBe part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. But don't just take our word for it -- see why our team chose to work at and stay at CoStar Group: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CVbJRnJ2sX0We welcome all qualified candidates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the United States to apply.  However, please note that CoStar is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position#LI-MP2<br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

name: Sales Associate, CoStar - Boise, Idaho
job_info: Sales Associate, CoStar - Boise, Idaho<br>Job Description<br>OVERVIEWCoStar Group is the world’s leading provider of information and marketing solutions for the Commercial Real Estate industry.  We are a NASDAQ listed company with a market cap of over $30B.+ As a technology company, we are the trusted partner for all commercial real estate professionals empowering many of the most well-respected landlords, development companies, brokerage firms, banks, lenders, investors and government agencies. We do this by actively researching the commercial real estate markets and providing data, analytics, innovative tools and powerful marketing platforms in the U.S. and Internationally to help our clients transact with one another. CoStar continues to win multiple awards including one of Forbes most innovative companies (2017) and Fortune’s fastest growing companies (2020).As a CoStar Sales Associate you will prospect and engage potential clients while managing, nurturing, and growing our existing client base. Promoting both CoStar and LoopNet products, you will have the opportunity to take an entrepreneurial approach to sell, train, and retain your book of business. You will receive a first class onboarding and training experience where you will learn how the different players in Commercial Real Estate operate, what is important to them and what solutions we have that meet their needs. You will have your own book of business, an endless supply of well qualified leads to develop, excellent products to sell, an excellent career development path. RESPONSIBILITIESGain a thorough understanding of your clients and their needsBecome an expert in CoStar’s critical information and marketing solutions including LoopNet, the leading online commercial real estate marketplaceComplete ownership of the full sales cycle including: prospecting, demoing, closing, onboarding, training and renewingConduct a high level of in person client and prospect product demonstrationsProvide valuable insight to all participants in the commercial property market, including Brokers, Owners, Investors, Lenders, Appraisers and Service ProvidersRepresent CoStar by hosting and attending industry events and networking with commercial real estate professionals in your marketBASIC QUALIFICATIONSBachelor’s degree requiredClient facing experience in the Commercial Real Estate industry strongly preferredTwo or more years of successful outside sales experience in a B2B environment selling data, research and analytic platforms or tools, commercial real estate, financial services or business intelligence.Proven track record exceeding sales targets and quotas in a consultative sales environmentTwo or more years of experience training clients on how to use a solution post saleAbility to travel within market for client meetings.  Employees who drive themselves for this purpose must have a current and valid driver’s license (or the ability to obtain a driver’s license prior to start date).OUR BEST PERFORMERS AREPassionate, hard-working and ambitious – As an innovator, we are fast paced and creative and expect our Sales Associates to move quickly to seize opportunity.Fast to learn new concepts and apply them - CoStar clients and prospects are diverse and demanding. With a constantly evolving suite of products, successful Sales Associates are skilled at introducing them to their clients.Curious - Our best salespeople ask intelligent questions, demonstrate strong listening skills and learn from customers and colleaguesExcellent communicators - our broad-ranging solutions require clear, concise communication tailored to the relevant audience.Committed to Customer Service – Successful Sales Associate’s at CoStar provide valuable insights and take ownership of their client’s requests, managing them to a successful outcome.WHY COSTAR?The industry leader with an energetic and fast paced dynamic cultureInnovative technology and a reputation for outstanding products95% customer renewal rateConsistent 20%+ average of year over year growthOutstanding sales and product training programsExcellent career growth opportunitiesHigh compensation with uncapped commissions and an outstanding annual Presidents Club tripExceptional benefit plan including an employee discounted stock purchase planBe part of a team of sales professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. But don't just take our word for it -- see why our team chose to work at and stay at CoStar Group: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CVbJRnJ2sX0We welcome all qualified candidates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the United States to apply.  However, please note that CoStar is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this positionPlease noteCoStar Group seeks information for job applications from candidates in the U.S. through only the following channels:The CoStar Group website and RecruitiFi. Via email to/from addresses using only the CoStar domain of “@Costar.com.” Screening and interaction by telephone and through the Microsoft Teams or Zoom platforms.Be aware that:CoStar does not use Wire, Google Hangouts, or any other platform for any recruitment-related activities.Disregard any solicitation or request for information related to job applications with CoStar via any other means and/or using email addresses with any other domain.CoStar will never ask candidates to make any type of personal financial investment related to gaining employment with the company.If you have any questions about CoStar Group and the application process, please contact us at recruiting@costar.com.<br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

name: Digital Content Specialist, STR, Hendersonville
job_info: Digital Content Specialist, STR, Hendersonville<br>Job Description<br>OVERVIEW  STR was acquired in October 2019 as a division of CoStar Group, Inc., the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics and online marketplaces. STR is in the process of combining CoStar’s largest and most up-to-date properties database with STR’s global hospitality performance data, to give both real estate and hospitality customers a unique and powerful combined view of their local markets.Main Purpose of JobThe Digital Content Specialist is responsible for all elements of the brand copy that underpins STR’s marketing strategy and corporate messaging. The successful candidate will create dynamic original content and update/edit existing content in accordance with STR’s brand voice, tone and style. Additionally, the successful candidate will serve as one of the organization’s subject matter experts on content to ensure consistent and accurate messaging is shared to multiple audiences via engaging and dynamic content. This role will be responsible for the creation of written content for email campaigns and newsletters, website pages, social media campaigns, long-form blog posts and video scripts for STR products and initiatives. This person will also own all content needs for the annual Hotel Data Conference and Global Edition, including attendee marketing emails, prospective sponsorship emails, and social media promotions.Responsibilities:Research, generate and edit a high volume of diverse copy to be used in a variety of public-facing sales and marketing channels, including emails, blogs, websites, multimedia training curriculum, presentations, brochures, social media, etc.Manage content deliverable for multiple audiences (examples: sales copy, educational pieces, customer support messaging).Ensure content is aligned with STR brand standards and corporate culture.Create and implement extensive content plans to market the Hotel Data Conference.Develop pieces specifically focused on SEO – taking keywords into consideration as well as reading level and content length.           Identify keywords to use and when during the year based on search volume and trends.Manage a deadline-driven content calendar and execute a global content strategy across multiple channels.Incorporate ideas and direction into written pieces with minimal direction from other staff.Report on the performance of marketing activity to internal stakeholders and contribute to the improvement and internal reporting of marketing performance.Work with team members from other departments and functions in a timely fashion to ensure deadlines are met.Create short- and long-term content calendars based on availability and relevancy of topics.Keep up to date with market and other industry developments. Attend training as required and actively seek to continually enhance understanding of STR products and value proposition.Attend marketing events, team meetings, kick-off meetings and functions as required.Adhere to all STR processes and policies and maintain customer confidentiality.Exceptional, detail-oriented writer who can create original brand copy and update/edit existing copy in accordance with brand voice, tone and style.Ability to focus on the customer, both internal and external, at all times. Ensure the right message is being delivered.Ability to anticipate and respond to client requirements and a genuine desire to exceed expectations at a global level.The position requires someone with flexible work hours due to interaction with global offices. #LI-SB1Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, or related field from an accredited educational institution.3-5 years’ experience working in digital content role.A background in Marketing is essential.A background in writing is essential.Experience writing for SEO – taking keywords into consideration as well as reading level and content length.      Keyword research – Identifying best keywords to use based on search volume and trends.Familiar with writing for the web, blog posts, product promotions, social, and LinkedIn and Google Ad content.Creating short and long-term content calendars based on availability and relevancy of topics.Excellent use of Microsoft Office applications, proven numeracy and literacy skills.Knowledge of systems such as Salesforce, Mailchimp, Eventbrite, Survey Monkey, social media platforms, CMS platforms, Google Analytics and/or other marketing tools will be beneficial.Preferred Qualifications:Experience within the hospitality industry is desirable but not essential.Consistently focused on delivering an excellent customer-service experience.Capability to build and maintain relationships with internal and external stakeholders.An eye for detail to ensure the release of accurate and timely content often underpinned by hotel performance data.Able to manage a variety of projects to meet a high standard within tight deadlines across multiple time zones.Efficient and effective forward planner of work and projects.Able to create solutions to solve problems and is not afraid to make informed decisions.Ability to focus on the customer, both internal and external, at all times. Ensure the right message is being delivered.Adapts to changing work environments, work priorities and organizational needs.OVERVIEW OF COMPANY: Founded in 1987, we are a NASDAQ listed company with a market cap of over US$30B and sit alongside other notable names such as Amazon, Facebook, Google and Apple. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; LoopNet, the most heavily trafficked mobile and online real estate marketplace; Apartments.com, the premier rental home resource for renters, property managers and owners; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry; BizBuySell, the largest online marketplace for businesses-for-sales; and Lands of America, the leading operator of online marketplaces for rural real estate. As a technology company, we are the trusted partner for all commercial real estate professionals empowering many of the most well-respected landlords, development companies, brokerage firms, banks, lenders, investors and government agencies with our data products and leading marketplaces.  We do this by actively researching the commercial real estate markets and providing data, analytics, innovative tools and powerful marketing platforms in the U.S. and Internationally to help our clients transact with one another. CoStar continues to win multiple awards including one of Forbes most innovative companies (2017) and Fortune’s fastest growing companies (2018). Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of over 4,300 worldwide. WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU: Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. In addition to generous compensation and performance-based incentives, you'll be supported in both your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program. Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to): Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription Drug Life, legal, and supplementary insurance Commuter and parking benefits 401(K) retirement plan with matching contributions Employee stock purchase plan Paid time off Tuition reimbursement On-site fitness center and/or reimbursed fitness center membership costs (location dependent), with yoga studio, Pelotons, personal training, group exercise classes, as well as Segways and bikes available for use during the day Complimentary gourmet coffee, tea, hot chocolate, prepared foods, fresh fruit, and other healthy snacks Be part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. But don't just take our word for it -- see why our team chose to work at and stay at CoStar Group: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CVbJRnJ2sX0 We welcome all qualified candidates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the United States to apply.  However, please note that CoStar is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position.<br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

CoStar continues to win multiple awards including one of Forbes most innovative companies (2017) and Fortune’s fastest growing companies (2020).As a CoStar Sales Associate you will prospect and engage potential clients while managing, nurturing, and growing our existing client base. Promoting both CoStar and LoopNet products, you will have the opportunity to take an entrepreneurial approach to sell, train, and retain your book of business. You will receive a first class onboarding and training experience where you will learn how the different players in Commercial Real Estate operate, what is important to them and what solutions we have that meet their needs. You will have your own book of business, an endless supply of well qualified leads to develop, excellent products to sell, an excellent career development path. RESPONSIBILITIESGain a thorough understanding of your clients and their needsBecome an expert in CoStar’s critical information and marketing solutions including LoopNet, the leading online commercial real estate marketplaceComplete ownership of the full sales cycle including: prospecting, demoing, closing, onboarding, training and renewingConduct a high level of in person client and prospect product demonstrationsProvide valuable insight to all participants in the commercial property market, including Brokers, Owners, Investors, Lenders, Appraisers and Service ProvidersRepresent CoStar by hosting and attending industry events and networking with commercial real estate professionals in your marketBASIC QUALIFICATIONSBachelor’s degree requiredClient facing experience in the Commercial Real Estate industry strongly preferredTwo or more years of successful outside sales experience in a B2B environment selling data, research and analytic platforms or tools, commercial real estate, financial services or business intelligence.Proven track record exceeding sales targets and quotas in a consultative sales environmentTwo or more years of experience training clients on how to use a solution post saleAbility to travel within market for client meetings.  Employees who drive themselves for this purpose must have a current and valid driver’s license (or the ability to obtain a driver’s license prior to start date).OUR BEST PERFORMERS AREPassionate, hard-working and ambitious – As an innovator, we are fast paced and creative and expect our Sales Associates to move quickly to seize opportunity.Fast to learn new concepts and apply them - CoStar clients and prospects are diverse and demanding. With a constantly evolving suite of products, successful Sales Associates are skilled at introducing them to their clients.Curious - Our best salespeople ask intelligent questions, demonstrate strong listening skills and learn from customers and colleaguesExcellent communicators - our broad-ranging solutions require clear, concise communication tailored to the relevant audience.Committed to Customer Service – Successful Sales Associate’s at CoStar provide valuable insights and take ownership of their client’s requests, managing them to a successful outcome.WHY COSTAR?The industry leader with an energetic and fast paced dynamic cultureInnovative technology and a reputation for outstanding products95% customer renewal rateConsistent 20%+ average of year over year growthOutstanding sales and product training programsExcellent career growth opportunitiesHigh compensation with uncapped commissions and an outstanding annual Presidents Club tripExceptional benefit plan including an employee discounted stock purchase planBe part of a team of sales professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. But don't just take our word for it -- see why our team chose to work at and stay at CoStar Group: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CVbJRnJ2sX0We welcome all qualified candidates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the United States to apply.  However, please note that CoStar is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this positionPlease noteCoStar Group seeks information for job applications from candidates in the U.S. through only the following channels:The CoStar Group website and RecruitiFi. Via email to/from addresses using only the CoStar domain of “@Costar.com.” Screening and interaction by telephone and through the Microsoft Teams or Zoom platforms.Be aware that:CoStar does not use Wire, Google Hangouts, or any other platform for any recruitment-related activities.Disregard any solicitation or request for information related to job applications with CoStar via any other means and/or using email addresses with any other domain.CoStar will never ask candidates to make any type of personal financial investment related to gaining employment with the company.If you have any questions about CoStar Group and the application process, please contact us at recruiting@costar.com.<br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

name: Credit Controller
job_info: Credit Controller<br>Job Description<br>COSTAR GROUP - CREDIT CONTROLLER - LONDON OVERVIEWCoStar delivers real-time, verified commercial real estate data that helps clients confidently spot great opportunities and make smart choices ahead of competitors. By combining the power of CoStar’s independent research organization – the industry’s largest – with global data delivery, software, and application solutions, clients can act on opportunities with confidence.As a Credit Controller, within the CoStar Finance and Facilities Group, you will be responsible for collecting the monies owed to STR/CoStar businesses in a timely fashion in the line with the customers’ agreements, minimizing aged debt and bad debt. Reporting to the Senior Revenue Manager, you will be liaising with key teams across the US and Europe maintaining a customer centric approach for both internal and external stakeholders.  RESPONSIBILITIESManaging the Accounts Receivables inboxesProduction of customer statements and dunning lettersProactively contacting clients to ensure payments are incoming and to chase overduesPreparation and execution of approved direct debit runsAllocation of credit notesPrompt follow up with customers receipts with no remittance adviceMaintain an accurate and up to date query log, resolution of queries working with Sales and the rest of the business as necessaryManage any documentation required by the customer for payment facilitation (eg compliance and tax documents) as required Regular reporting on collections. Monitor and reduce aged debt.Allocate customer remittances to STR and CoStar invoices in an accurate and timely manner Reconcile customer accounts.Assist invoicing team as requiredAssist with audit as requiredBASIC QUALIFICATIONSMembership of Chartered Institute Credit Management Significant experience in a high volume AR environment Educated to degree levelExcellent knowledge of Microsoft Office Excel Experience with Oracle PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLSWell organised and ability to adhere to deadlines and timetables, ability to handle multiple tasks and assignments at onceCollaborative and proactiveExcellent oral and written communication skillsCustomer centric, able to build relationship within the business and with customersTrack record of improving and modernizing processesSolutions oriented with natural problem-solving skillsStrong attention to detail COMPANY OVERVIEWFounded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availability. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; Realla, the UK’s newest online commercial real estate marketplace; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry.Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of over 4,300 worldwide.WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. As well as having an outstanding working environment based in the Shard, other perks include full private medical cover and member rewards, 25 days annual leave, a competitive pension, season ticket loans, birthday lunches and much more! Take a look at our Instagram Page @CoStarSocial to find out more!At CoStar, we recognise the positive value of diversity and promote equality. We aim at all times to recruit the person who is most suited to the job and welcome applications from people of all backgrounds – people of all ages, gender identities, sexual orientations, nationalities, religions and beliefs.However, we particularly encourage applications from women, disabled and Black, Asian and Minority Ethnic (BAME) candidates, as these groups are underrepresented throughout the commercial real estate industry.<br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

name: Director of Operations
job_info: Director of Operations<br>Job Description<br>We’re looking for an analytical, detail-oriented and results driven leader to help add structure and scale to our business. The Director of Operations will lead the development and execution of our key business and operational workflows to drive improvements upon the systems and processes that we’ve built for our core and revenue-driving products.Core Responsibilities:Oversee the teams that support revenue, MLS and training operationsEvaluate, recommend and implement key business processes and workflowsIdentify, deploy and administer the necessary software, tools, data and other resources in order to properly run our business Partner with the product and marketing organizations to ensure operational readiness for all new product launches and/or changesOversee the operational aspects of all new agent on boardingBuild proper support structure for all sales team activity and fulfillmentWork closely with the sales team and technical team to ensure that clients accounts are set up and managed appropriatelyEstablish and drive accountability of SLAs for orders placed and contracts provisionedAnalyze data to help improve our processes and productsPartner with customer experience organization to ensure proper support of our customersCreate and communicate all relevant data, performance vs. plan, performance vs. SLAs to the broader organizationDrive a culture of continuous improvement and strive for operational excellence Desired Skills & Experiences:You have at least 8 years of relevant experience in an operational roleYou have direct experience implementing and administering CRM software tools and systemsYou have demonstrated the ability to self-manage towards a set of defined goals and prioritize among many different tasksYou are highly analytical and process drivenYou are excited by a culture built on meritocracy and motivated by the fact that your measured performance will drive your compensation and career growth.You have a can-do attitude and are fanatical about execution and continuous self improvementYou are organized and have a proven ability to exceed performance goals.You have excellent verbal and written communication skills.You are goal-oriented and have accountability for your work.Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or universitySpecial Consideration:Specific examples of goals, your performance to those goals and tactical approach to achieve those goals.Make sure you let us know if you have any experience or connection to the real estate industry as that helps - though is certainly not requiredIf you want to be part of a company that is building the software platform of the future for real estate agents, apply today.<br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

name: Client Support Specialist I - STR - Hendersonville
job_info: Client Support Specialist I - STR - Hendersonville<br>Job Description<br>OVERVIEW STR, acquired by CoStar Group in 2019, provides premium data benchmarking, analytics, and marketplace insights for global hospitality sectors. headquarters in Singapore.The Client Support Specialist I is responsible for creating a positive service experience for our customers.  This is achieved by providing product or website support via phone and/or email for STR customers around the world.  The Client Support Specialist will work cohesively and efficiently with other departments in the organization to ensure customer inquiries are fully resolved. RESPONSIBILITIES Maintain appropriate knowledge of CoStar & STR products and services to resolve client questions or concerns in a timely mannerSeek to understand the issue a client is experiencing, communicate a willingness to help, and provide a comprehensive solutionWork on assignments that are semi-routine in nature and recognize the need for occasional deviation from the normal practice.Support customers within multiple asset classes: hospitality, hostels, short term rentals, serviced apartments, industry partners, tourism bureaus, real estate, and others as needed  Maintain customer records by updating and entering account/subscription information in various systems, including Salesforce and other internal CoStar & STR platformsBecome a Subject Matter Expert on CoStar’s & STR’s products and services in order to educate clients on what is available to best fit their needsCreate and maintain accurate records regarding customer interactionsProvide support services to other CoStar & STR departments as neededEnsure our response time commitments to our clients are metProvide training to CoStar & STR customers, which may include: product overviews, methodology reviews, and website usageKeep managers informed of client feedback received and how to best action for better future outcomesBASIC QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCEAssociate Degree minimum or two years of experience working directly in the hospitality sectorTwo or more years of experience in a customer facing roleTwo or more years of experience using the Microsoft Office suite of applications (Excel, Outlook, and Word).PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLSBachelor’s Degree preferredPrior experience working at a hotel property or in a hotel corporate environmentExperience working with a CRM system, preferably Salesforce and/or HelpDesk ticketing systemAbility to work in multiple systems simultaneouslyAbility to multi-task in a fast paced environment while prioritizing your workloadAbility to manage and hit deadlinesAbility to work well independently, while also contributing to a larger team as neededExcellent communication skills, both written and verbal with a willingness to go above and beyond to solve problemsAbility to develop innovative solutions to client questions and concernsAbility to adapt to change in a high growth companyAbility to quickly adopt change and remain flexible to learning new thingsAbility to analyze data and understand issues and discrepanciesWHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU:Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. name: Inside Sales Manager
job_info: Inside Sales Manager<br>Job Description<br>CoStar Group is the world’s leading provider of information and marketing solutions for the Commercial Real Estate industry. We are a NASDAQ listed company with a market cap of over US$30B and sit alongside other notable names such as Amazon, Facebook, Google and Apple.Homesnap, now a member of the CoStar family, is a fast-moving, technology-focused provider of marketing solutions for Real Estate professionals. name: Senior SQL Engineer
job_info: Senior SQL Engineer<br>Job Description<br>Senior SQL Engineer – CoStar – Washington, DC OVERVIEW CoStar delivers real-time, verified commercial real estate data that helps clients confidently spot great opportunities and make smart choices ahead of competitors. By combining the power of CoStar’s independent research organization – the industry’s largest – with global data delivery, software, and application solutions, clients can act on opportunities with confidence.CoStar’s software developers build products that facilitate 86% of commercial real estate transactions in the United States. These transactions range from a small business owner leasing their first office space to a large multi-national buying a new headquarters campus. On any given day our developers are building products that manage nearly a trillion dollars of potential real estate transactions.As a CoStar Database Developer you will be responsible for architecting and building data solutions that operate on terabytes of data and scale to support the internal processes of our company and process over a billion dollars of revenue per year.RESPONSIBILITIES Deeply understand what drives the business for which you are building softwareDrive the design of highly performant and highly available data solutionsBuild solutions that operate on massive amounts of data in high transaction volume applicationsWork with QA resources to ensure that the software delivered is of the highest qualityAct as a key member of the product launch team and work closely with DevOps to resolve operational issuesEvaluate emerging technologies to identify opportunities, trends and best practices that can be leveraged to strengthen CoStar’s technology platform and development practices.BASIC QUALIFICATIONSBachelor’s Degree4+ years of SQL database development experienceDemonstrable track record of building and launching successful products that leverage terabytes of dataDatabase design, T-SQL programming, performance tuning, index analysisExperience in database performance testingDefine database architecture and development best practicesPREFERRED QUALIFCATIONS AND SKILLS Experienced in database performance testing and SQL code unit testing strategies and implementationsComfortable facilitating discussions among database developers to exchange ideas and introduce new database technologiesStrong communication skills (to the business and technical partners)OVERVIEW OF COMPANY:Founded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. name: Senior Sales Director, CoStar - New York, NY
job_info: Senior Sales Director, CoStar - New York, NY<br>Job Description<br>CoStar Group is the world’s leading provider of information and marketing solutions for the Commercial Real Estate industry.  We are a NASDAQ listed company with a market cap of over $30B+. As a technology company, we are the trusted partner for all commercial real estate professionals empowering many of the most well-respected landlords, development companies, brokerage firms, banks, lenders, investors and government agencies.We do this by actively researching the commercial real estate markets and providing data, analytics, innovative tools and powerful marketing platforms in the U.S. and Internationally to help our clients transact with one another. CoStar continues to win multiple awards including one of Forbes most innovative companies (2017) and Fortune’s fastest growing companies (2020). As a CoStar Senior Sales Director you will prospect and engage potential clients while managing, nurturing, and growing our existing client base. Promoting both CoStar and LoopNet products, you will have the opportunity to take an entrepreneurial approach to sell, train, and retain your book of business.  You will receive a first class onboarding and training experience where you will learn how the different players in Commercial Real Estate operate, what is important to them and what solutions we have that meet their needs. You will have your own book of business, an endless supply of well qualified leads to develop, excellent products to sell, an excellent career development path.  RESPONSIBILITIES•    Gain a thorough understanding of your clients and their needs•    Become an expert in CoStar’s critical information and marketing solutions including LoopNet, the leading online commercial real estate marketplace•    Complete ownership of the full sales cycle including: prospecting, demoing, closing, onboarding, training and renewing•    Conduct a high level of in person client and prospect product demonstrations•    Provide valuable insight to all participants in the commercial property market, including Brokers, Owners, Investors, Lenders, Appraisers and Service Providers•    Represent CoStar by hosting and attending industry events and networking with commercial real estate professionals in your marketBASIC QUALIFICATIONS•    Bachelor’s degree required•    Client facing experience in the Commercial Real Estate industry strongly preferred•    Ten or more years of successful outside sales experience in a B2B environment selling Data, Research and Analytic platforms or tools, commercial real estate, financial services, business intelligence, marketing or information providers. •    Proven track record exceeding sales targets and quotas in a consultative sales environment•    Five or more years of experience training clients on how to use a solution post saleOUR BEST PEFORMERS ARE•    Passionate, hard-working and ambitious – As an innovator, we are fast paced and creative and expect our Sales Directors to move quickly to seize opportunity.•    Fast to learn new concepts and apply them - CoStar clients and prospects are diverse and demanding. With a constantly evolving suite of products, successful Sales Directors are skilled at introducing them to their clients.•    Curious - Our best salespeople ask intelligent questions, demonstrate strong listening skills and learn from customers and colleagues•    Excellent communicators - our broad-ranging solutions require clear, concise communication tailored to the relevant audience.•    Committed to Customer Service – Successful Sales Directors at CoStar provide valuable insights and take ownership of their client’s requests, managing them to a successful outcome.WHY COSTAR?•    The industry leader with an energetic and fast paced dynamic culture•    Innovative technology and a reputation for outstanding products•    95% customer renewal rate •    Consistent 20%+ average of year over year growth •    Outstanding sales and product training programs•    Excellent career growth opportunities•    High compensation with uncapped commissions and an outstanding annual Presidents Club trip •    Exceptional benefit plan including an employee discounted stock purchase planBe part of a team of sales professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. But don't just take our word for it -- see why our team chose to work at and stay at CoStar Group: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CVbJRnJ2sX0We welcome all qualified candidates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the United States to apply.  However, please note that CoStar is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position.<br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing
