name: Field Research Photographer - Charleston, SC
job_info: Field Research Photographer - Charleston, SC<br>Job Description<br>OVERVIEWCoStar Group is the world’s leading provider of information and marketing solutions for the Commercial Real Estate industry.  We are a NASDAQ listed company with a market cap of over US$30B and sit alongside other notable names such as Amazon, Facebook, Google and Apple.As a technology company, we are the trusted partner for all commercial real estate professionals empowering many of the most well-respected landlords, development companies, brokerage firms, banks, lenders, investors and government agencies.We do this by actively researching the commercial real estate markets and providing data, analytics, innovative tools and powerful marketing platforms in the U.S. and Internationally to help our clients transact with one another. CoStar continues to win multiple awards including one of Forbes most innovative companies (2017) and Fortune’s fastest growing companies (2018).The Research team is the heart of CoStar, capturing market-critical information that enables our commercial real estate clients to make informed, high impact business decisions daily. CoStar Group’s research contributes to the most important segment of our economy, helping businesses open offices, retail stores, warehouses, and manufacturing facilities. CoStar Group is seeking a Field Photographer to join our growing research organization.As a CoStar Field Photographer, you will be at the foundation to the company’s media and data collection efforts and play an integral part of our Marketing Research ecosystem. The collection of accurate and timely data and professional photography are essential to CoStar Group customers and the goals we are eager to meet. Use your invention, imagination, creative expertise and talent to produce original professional quality photography and video on assigned commercial properties.RESPONSIBILITIESSupport our customer’s marketing efforts on our industry-leading marketplaces by capturing beautiful exterior and interior photography, 3-D virtual tours, and videography of their propertiesUse Photoshop, Lightroom, and non-linear editing tools (Premiere, Final Cut Pro X) to edit captured mediaOwn the market! Navigate one-mile square grids to ensure complete coverage and that all critical database fields are collected and properties photographedWith the company vehicle as your office, identify among dozens of key data points such as new inventory, “for lease” and “for sale” availabilities, commercial building occupancy, and moreLeverage optimized field research mobile and web software as you explore buildings inside and outProfessionally communicate with customers, sales, Marketing Research partners, and management to strategically evaluate priorities, initiatives, and tasksAbide by CoStar safety standardsMaintain company vehicle and equipmentRepresent the Company at occasional trade functions, conferences, and eventsBASIC QUALIFICATIONSHigh School Diploma required1+ year experience with digital photography using DSLR or Mirrorless camera1+ year experience with image post-processing tools including Photoshop and/or Lightroom1+ year video post-processing experience with tools such as Premiere, Final Cut Pro XArchitectural and/or Real Estate photography and videography experienceCandidates are required to submit portfolio of work supporting above listed experienceA current and valid driver’s license (or the ability to obtain a driver’s license prior to start date) is requiredSatisfactory completion of a Motor Vehicle Record (MVR) check prior to start.  Driving history must reflect responsible driving behavior and compliance with traffic lawsAbility to pass FAA Part 107 certification to commercial fly drones in first three months of employment (fees paid by Company). Willing and able to participate in three-day drone training in Atlanta, GARepetitive and frequent standing, seeing, sitting, walking, and driving up to eight hours per dayHolding five pounds in one hand for five minutes (photography and videography)Repetitive hand and arm movements needed to type and writeOccasional bending, stooping, squatting, lifting, twisting and carrying are necessary to perform job functionsMust be able to work on computer and or mobile devices from vehicle throughout work dayWill be exposed to both vehicle noise and possible car exhaustAbility to conduct job duties outside in various weather conditions each dayPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS Bachelor’s degreeExperience functioning autonomously in the field while achieving key performance and quality indicatorsPossess excellent oral and written communication, as well as organizational skillsDrone flight experienceOVERVIEW OF COMPANYFounded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availability. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; LoopNet, the most heavily trafficked mobile and online real estate marketplace; Apartments.com, the premier rental home resource for renters, property managers and owners; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry; BizBuySell, the largest online marketplace for businesses-for-sales; and Lands of America, the leading operator of online marketplaces for rural real estate.Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of over 4,300 worldwide.WHATS IN IT FOR YOUWorking at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. In addition to generous compensation and performance-based incentives, you'll be supported in both your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program.Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to):Company vehicle provided for business useCompany-paid and insured photography kit including computer, camera, lenses, tripod, drone, and moreComprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription DrugLife, legal, and supplementary insuranceCommuter and parking benefits401(K) retirement plan with matching contributionsEmployee stock purchase planPaid time offTuition reimbursementBe part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. But don't just take our word for it -- see why our team chose to work at and stay at CoStar Group: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CVbJRnJ2sX0We welcome all qualified candidates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the United States to apply.  However, please note that CoStar is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position.CAREER WEBSITE DISCLAIMERCoStar Group seeks information for job applications from candidates in the Canada through only the following channels:The CoStar Group websiteVia email to/from addresses using only the CoStar domain of “@costar.com”Screening and interaction by telephone and through the Microsoft Teams or Zoom platformsBe aware that:CoStar does not use Wire, Google Hangouts, or any other platform for any recruitment related activitiesDisregard any solicitation or request for information related to job applications with CoStar via any other means and/or using email addresses with any other domainCoStar will never ask candidates to make any type of personal financial investment related to gaining employment with the company<br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

name: Quality Assurance Analyst
job_info: Quality Assurance Analyst<br>Job Description<br>OVERVIEWCoStar delivers real-time, verified commercial real estate data that enables our commercial real estate clients to make informed, high impact decisions ahead of competitors. By combining the power of CoStar’s independent research organization – the industry’s largest – with global data delivery, software, and application solutions, clients can act on opportunities with confidence.CoStar is seeking a Quality Assurance Analyst to join our growing analytics organization. The QA Analyst will assist in developing testing solutions to meet CoStar’s primary goal of continual improvement of our testing process and architecture. The role is critical to the quality and success of our products and includes the design, development and execution of tests of our products. The ideal candidate will possess a broad range of experience and quantitative skills to undertake the responsibilities outlined below and will be eager to join a best-in-class team that performs an integral function within the CoStar Group. The position can sit in any major US city.RESPONSIBILITIESDesign and execute formal plans, procedures and scenarios for manual and automated comprehensive tests based on product requirements and specificationsPlan tests, write test cases and scripts, and automate test casesPerform an appropriate level of testing to ensure that applications are tested effectively prior to implementationInvestigate, document and escalate (as appropriate) the defects and other quality metrics identified during testingWork with the development team to analyze programs requirements so as to expand test coverageDevelop and implement quality standards and best practices, contributing ideas and effort toward continuous improvement QUALIFICATIONSBS degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field Three or more years of relevant experience as a software quality assurance analystUnderstanding of quality assurance testing methodologies and the software development life cycleExperience reporting, regressing, and reproducing software inadequacies and defectsExperience testing relational database applications and web-based enterprise systemsProficiency in SQL, writing queries and reporting from relational databases, and experience with SQL Server Management Studio, including experience testing relational database-backed applicationsExperience in an agile development environmentDetailed-oriented, with strong organizational and communication skills OVERVIEW OF COMPANY:Founded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availability. name: Data Analyst
job_info: Data Analyst<br>Job Description<br>Sr. Data Analyst, Online Security Position Overview:Seeking an experienced data analyst to deliver insights to inform fraud detection and risk mitigation strategies for the Apartments.com platform. This position relies on sound judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Individual problem-solving and analytical skills are used to authenticate customers, review patterns, and perform exploratory analyses on emerging trends. Additionally, this position will drive the automation strategy for the team, taking a risk-based approach to protect our products and customers.  In this role, analysts have the opportunity to drive roadmaps, develop key metrics, and influence policy across our business. Candidates will regularly engage with management, data analysts, developers, product teams, and vendors in order to develop strategy, drive roadmaps, and supervise projects to completion.  We're looking for candidates that demonstrate initiative and a growth mindset and have a strong aptitude for problem solving. Job Responsibilities:Distill data using SQL to design and implement analyses that drive actionable insights Effectively present and communicate analyses to management and other stakeholders in order to drive business decisions Occasionally create ETLs for data management Develop metrics and create dashboards to understand trends and track progress against goals Perform ad hoc analyses to identify trends, enhance fraud rules, and improve automation Diagnose problems and develop compelling, data-driven recommendations, policies and processes with the goal of minimizing loss and/or driving growth Work under very limited supervision Requirements:Basic: Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Math, Engineering, Economics, Business, or related field plus 2-5 years relevant work experience Experience in risk, trust & safety, payments, security, or spam prevention High caliber analytical skills, including the ability to pull and manipulate large datasets using SQL and other tools, recognize complex patterns, and present sound analyses to stakeholders as demonstrated through real-world application Experience using analytical reporting software and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker, etc.) Ability to take ownership of projects and make decisions in a fast-paced environment with minimal oversight, while balancing customer experience with risk mitigation Develop and implement databases that optimize statistical efficiency and quality  Preferred: Project management experience Familiarity with scripting and data analysis programming languages (e.g. Python, R, etc) Knowledge of payments industry practices (e.g., disputes processes, fraud types, and network rules) Experience building predictive models Key Competencies:Ability to communicate with diverse technical and non-technical groups, spanning all organizational levels Detail oriented Strong problem solving capabilities with an analytical mindset <br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

name: Fraud Operations Analyst
job_info: Fraud Operations Analyst<br>Job Description<br>Analyst, Fraud Operations   Position Overview: Seeking a highly motivated Fraud Analyst to mitigate transactional and listing fraud across our Apartments network. Analysts will monitor a variety of payments (card and ACH)  via real time queues. They use their analytical ability to conduct a detailed investigation of high risk behaviors to identify unauthorized transactions and account activity. They may be required to communicate with our clients in cases where additional information is needed to make a decision. Additionally, team members are expected to collaborate cross functionally, surfacing anomalies and process improvements to internal and external operations teams, data analysts, and product representatives.   We're looking for candidates with a strong sense of curiosity, that demonstrate initiative and a growth mindset, and have a strong aptitude for problem solving. All candidates should be flexible with their schedule. There may be a need to work non-traditional shifts and some holidays. Essential functions:Use in depth fraud knowledge to assess financial risk and legitimacy of transactions, accounts, and listings Monitor numerous queues, review high risk behavior, and make real time decisions  Contact customers to verify information or activity Maintain or exceed established service level agreements (SLAs) for timely resolution of queued cases to minimize potential losses Interact with other teams to develop fraud prevention strategy and process Understand our systems and tools; automation programs to include design, testing, configuration, reporting, and advanced administration.RESPONSIBILITIESAdminister the marketing automation platform and serve in a CoE consultative role name: Analyst I, STR- Hendersonville, TN
job_info: Analyst I, STR- Hendersonville, TN<br>Job Description<br>OVERVIEW Founded in 1985, STR provides premium data benchmarking, analytics and marketplace insights for global hospitality sectors. We are a benchmarking company, and the trusted partner for all market participants including many of the most well-respected hotel brands, individual owners, brokers, lenders, institutional investors, government agencies and service providers. We do this by providing research, data, analytics, innovative tools, and powerful marketing platforms in the US and internationally. STR was acquired in October 2019 as a division of CoStar Group, Inc. (NASDAQ: CSGP).The Analyst Team provides analytical and business intelligence support to STR’s enterprise around the world, delivering best-in-class data insights that inform smarter decision-making within the hotel industry. The Analyst Team supports ongoing delivery of products to clients, defines methodologies, investigates new opportunities and helps find answers to questions and/or challenges. The mission of the Analyst role is to support these efforts by analyzing, interpreting and reporting on data. The Analyst is a data steward, establishing validation and testing protocols that maintain STR’s strict standards of data integrity, accuracy and confidentiality. The role maintains ongoing data delivery and delivers ad-hoc data requests across various initiatives, developing, running and preparing statistical analyses and reports based on internal (and external) data sources. Candidates should be energetic and appreciate an organization that requires and rewards leadership, productivity, creativity and careful attention to detail.RESPONSIBILITIES Delivers data analysis:Proactively analyze business data, providing assessments of trends, identifying and explaining variances.Design, implements and maintains business intelligence dashboards and reports to facilitate data review and analysis.Champion process improvements, best practices and knowledge sharing within the organization as it pertains to business intelligence, analytics and data integration capabilities.Create and distribute both routine and complex ad-hoc reports.Data Integrity, Standards and Quality:Maintain high levels of data quality and accuracy by applying and maintaining process and robust review. Investigate anomalies and potential errors in data to understand the root cause and find resolution.Ensure data is appropriately and accurately represented visually in Product.Adhere to STR’s and CoStar’s standards and guidelines for data confidentiality.Maintain databases, cleansing and validating data as needed.Develop database logic to extract required information for reporting – set up template reporting.SME for Business Intelligence Tool.Review business data methodologies and recommend enhancements.Contribute to thought leadership:Identify opportunities for industry articles, white papers and data presentations. Generate and analyze data to support effort.Draft commentary that communicates key findings from data for a variety of audiences.Contribute to own team/closely related teams through quality and accuracy of own output.Evaluate the way our data is presented and seek to find new ways of doing so to make it meaningful and useful to our staff/clients.Keep up to date with and utilize new technologies to enhance the visualization of data.Convert complex data and findings into understandable tables, graphs and reports.Update and maintain data presentation templates and select marketing collateral as needed.BASIC QUALIFICATIONS1-3 years of professional experience in research, data analytics, operations.Background in Hospitality or Commercial Real Estate industries.Bachelor’s degree; course of study in Hospitality, Information Systems, MIS, computer science, or other related technical field is a plus.Strong analytical skills.Ability to manipulate big data sets; work with disparate data sets.Advanced experience with Excel.Strong written and verbal communication skills.Attention to detail.Ability to work independently and as part of a team.Ability to adapt quickly to new assignments.Intense curiosity and desire to learn.PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS  Ability to create compelling, actionable data visualizations via Excel, Tableau or PowerPoint.Ability to communicate effectively and establish strong working relationships with executive management, internal clients, team members and other departments.Working knowledge of hotel industry/travel/tourismOVERVIEW OF COMPANY:Founded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. name: Office Manager - Bethesda, MD
job_info: Office Manager - Bethesda, MD<br>Job Description<br>The Office Manager based in Bethesda, MD is responsible for creating an exceptional working environment for the office.  The candidate will also assist the Facilities Operations team in supporting the operational needs of 50+ offices serving 4,000 US based employees.  The Office Manager will ensure our offices are best-in-class, safe and present an outstanding work environment.  We are looking for an energetic candidate who will lead the office’s workplace solutions and is equipped to work effectively with many different teams of people including senior management.   Moreover, the Office Manager needs to be able to attend to multiple concerns, events and projects requiring advanced organizational ability and prioritization skills.  Responsibilities:  Responsible for day-to-day office management of the Bethesda, MD and support of smaller satellite offices  Provide excellent customer services to our staff related to office and facilities needs.  Oversee supplies, company-supplied food, internal office moves, guest management, parking allocations, switchboard.  Liaison with landlords on day-to-day operations and landlord provided services such as cleaning, building engineering, security and other services.  Manage service contractors for the office:  scheduled and/or equipment maintenance & minor renovation and handyman projects.  Oversee purchasing for the office and monitor costs, create purchase orders, review and approve invoices.  Coordinate all in-office functions, such as space planning; seating chart; sustainability efforts; shipping/receiving & mail services; office-wide & special events; catering.  Participate in the wellness/life/safety functions by scheduling required events:  such as fire drills, floors wardens, CPR/AED training, Covid-safety.  Manage office security, including badging, access control and system upkeep.  Utilize & Manage day-to-day Integrated Work Management/Experience System (IWMS)  Supervise on-site office services coordinator.  Basic Qualifications:  5 + years of facilities management experience including 2+ years in similar role managing a large office (250 staff/40,000 sf).  Experience and proficiency using IWMS software  Experience with facilities operations project planning and management.  Preferred Qualifications  Effective analytical and problem-solving skills, as well as high attention to detail and organizational skills.  Aptitude for collaboration and leadership. Bachelor’s Degree in business/ facilities administration or a related field.  Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office suite including Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint, etc.   Candidates must pass proficiency test.  Excellent communication skills.  Candidate must pass proficiency test.  Job Information  Location:  Bethesda, MD –Office Based  Remote Work:  Not Eligible  Hours:  8:00am – 5:00pm, Monday - Friday  Job Function: Facility Operations & Workplace Management  Job Type: Full-Time  Min Education: BA/BS/Undergraduate  Required Travel: Up to 10% travel  OVERVIEW OF COMPANY:  Founded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availability. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; LoopNet, the most heavily trafficked mobile and online real estate marketplace; Apartments.com, the premier rental home resource for renters, property managers and owners; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry; BizBuySell, the largest online marketplace for businesses-for-sales; and Lands of America, the leading operator of online marketplaces for rural real estate.  Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of over 4,300 worldwide.  WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?  Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. In addition to generous compensation and performance-based incentives, you'll be supported in both your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program.  Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to):  Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription Drug  Life, legal, and supplementary insurance  Commuter and parking benefits  401(K) retirement plan with matching contributions  Employee stock purchase plan  Paid time off  Tuition reimbursement  On-site fitness center and/or reimbursed fitness center membership costs (location dependent), with yoga studio, Pelotons, personal training, group exercise classes, as well as Segway’s and bikes available for use during the day  Complimentary gourmet coffee, tea, hot chocolate, prepared foods, fresh fruit, and other healthy snacks  Be part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. name: Senior Technical Project Manager
job_info: Senior Technical Project Manager<br>Job Description<br>CoStar Real Estate Manager is leading Software as a Service Provider, (SaaS), to the Real Estate and Accounting Industry. Our firm has been in business since 1999 and has developed a client base of some of the largest corporations in the world. CoStar Real Estate Manager is a part of the CoStar Group, Inc. (Nasdaq:CSGP), who is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics and online marketplaces. Founded in 1987, CoStar conducts expansive, ongoing research to produce and maintain the largest and most comprehensive database of commercial real estate information.CoStar Real Estate Manager is currently seeking exceptional Senior Technical Project Manager to oversee the delivery of multiple software implementations simultaneously for our customers. This is a high visibility role with significant responsibilities related to delivering customer implementations. A successful candidate will have software implementation project management experience, (SaaS preferred), will be a self-starter and will have managed the full life cycle of software implementation projects. The Technical Project Manager will work with solution design consultants, implementation consultants, business analysis and developers throughout the life of the project to ensure on time and on budget delivery. This role will report to the Director of Project Management Organization (PMO). The Senior Technical Project Manager will lead the analysis and creativity required to solve unique/complex technical and business problems on behalf of the customer and COSTAR for the program/project.  Demonstrates initiative and uses sound judgment in choosing actions that are consistent with the customer’s and COSTAR’s objectives, goals and values.  Makes decisions and contributions that have a direct impact on the success of major projects.  Understands and demonstrates decision making balancing customer budget and COSTAR contract expectations – on-time / on-budget along with delivering on margin / contribution.Delivers conceptual insight to the Project Team regarding the life cycle of the products to be developed and or integrated to achieve program/project success.  Has the background and expertise in software development life cycle development that aligns with COSTAR’s product and implementation methodologies supported by repeated experience in successfully managing and delivering on multi-project enterprise efforts for large scale corporations.Plans and coordinates all aspects of internal information system-specific projects from initiation to delivery. Projects often involve network, server, or software implementation and upgrades, PC deployment and the like. Coordinates work performed by IT staff and internal customers/partners by defining project requirements, performing feasibility and needs/impact assessments. Develops detailed project plans and manages all implementation processes including resource allocation, progress tracking, monitoring change control process, testing, documentation, training and on-time delivery within budget constraints. Projects may vary in number, size and complexity.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Interfaces with all departments including Sales, Consulting, Development, Client Services, and Accounting to ensure an on-time and on-budget delivery of our SaaS solutions.A successful candidate will be responsible for managing the project through all project phases that include Project Initiation, Design, Development, UAT, Go-Live and Transition to Client Services Support.Program/project issues are owned, addressed, and effectively resolved in the timely manner.Continually escalates to COSTAR or customer management where progress is blocked or when budget/schedule can be impacted.Expected Results and Measures: Customer confidence in the Program/project Manager.Customer requests for consultation on matters beyond the scope of the program/project.Sales of additional work into the customer organization.Customer referrals to other organizations for COSTAR.OBTAIN AND MANAGE PROJECT RESOURCES:Provides input regarding key project staff – competency, fit, capability, and performance with recommendations for improvement to their management.Coordinating project staffing with Consulting Services leadership and via the resource planning process.Ensuring staff / team readiness and identify any training/informational needs and address.KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:Demonstrated ability to delegate, multitask and manage multiple concurrent IT projects.Expertly direct the work of a multi-disciplinary client team, which includes IT, Real Estate and Accounting experts.Work successfully with limited direct supervision while embodying all standards expected.Organized thinker and communicator.Care about the success of teammates and customers.Meticulous about documentation and record-keeping.Advanced user of MS Project and MS Office applications (Word, Excel, Visio, and PowerPoint).EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:Bachelor's degree or higher.10+ years of technical project management experience, particularly in external, customer facing roles.Experience managing enterprise-scale software product implementations for Fortune 1000 name: Senior Marketing Manager
job_info: Senior Marketing Manager<br>Job Description<br>COSTAR GROUP – SENIOR MARKETING MANAGER - LONDON OVERVIEWCoStar delivers real-time, verified commercial real estate data that helps clients confidently spot great opportunities and make smart choices ahead of competitors. By combining the power of CoStar’s independent research organization – the industry’s largest – with global data delivery, software, and application solutions, clients can act on opportunities with confidence.Realla.co.uk is the number 1 dedicated commercial property marketplace in the UK, connecting millions of tenants and investors with Offices, Shops, Industrial and other commercial spaces for sale and for rent. Realla was started 6 years ago and acquired by CoStar Group in 2018. We retain our entrepreneurial culture, whilst being owned and supported by the world’s leader in commercial property information, analytics and marketplaces. CoStar is a $35bn market cap business with strong growth and probability and provides tremendous financial backing to fuel our growth.We are looking for an incredibly organised, energetic and dynamic Senior Marketing Manager, who will be responsible for running our B2B and B2C marketing efforts at Realla, to both build our brand presence and increase our lead generation, particularly in B2B channels, with the ultimate aim of driving revenue growth.You will report to the CEO and co-founder of Realla, and manage external providers (content, hubspot, design, video etc.) as well an internal direct report. This is an amazing opportunity for an experienced marketing leader within a fast-growing entrepreneurial division of a highly successful and profitable American technology company.This is a role that will require you to get your hands dirty in the day-to-day as well as stepping back to refine the strategy.RESPONSIBILITIESOrganise and run the B2C and B2B marketing efforts at Realla to drive both usage of Realla (B2C) and revenue generation (B2B)B2B will involve:Regular email marketing cadence to key customers groups (commercial property agents, property owners including fund managers, REITS, propcos and private individuals)Regular social cadenceRunning the events programRunning our BlogSales support including ownership of sales presentations, ownership and delivery of inbound leads, provision of data / updates on performance, maintenance and creation of a bank of successful client case studiesPossible wider forms of brand advertising as we grow e.g. Tube, Financial Times, Bloomberg, other business titlesB2C will involve:Support the CTO and Design/Product team by inputting into the look/feel of our website, particularly the languageRun the content engine for our blog (an external provider creates 15+ pieces a month)Contribute to SEM, although we have a dedicated person to do this, and our CTO is a world-class expert at SEO and SEM having co-founded and sold 2 marketplace start ups. We run an SEM budget of £120,000+ per month.Manage external providersBalance being a self-starter with the ability to leverage the wider group resources (e.g. the knowledge of other marketing leaders in the group)Create a dynamic “high standards” reputation, that reflects well on our brand both in the external market and internallyBASIC QUALIFICATIONSEducated to degree level in business or marketing and ideally CIM qualifiedSignificant demonstrable experience as a marketing manager in a relevant B2B role OR within a marketplace businessWide experience of cross-channel marketing, particularly social, paid and content marketingClear evidence of building lead generation machines, including experience building a funnelComplete command of either Hubspot or Pardot & confidence using Excel to present and manipulate dataSEM experienceExperience building a brandExperience managing external suppliers. Experience managing budgets and working with finance teams on the same PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS Outstanding communication and presentation skills are a given, including excellent writing abilityThe ability to think on your feet, problem-solve and make decisions. This is a small team; we are not spoon fed. You will not be micro-managedManagement experience of internal people and/or external suppliersExperience in marketplacesA knowledge of commercial real estate or asset management is advantageous. If not, you will have a desire to learn and a genuine interest in the trends and market backdrop.Experience of large, long-term enterprise sales contracts worth £25,000+ per annumWHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. As well as having an outstanding working environment based in the Shard, other perks include full private medical cover and member rewards, 25 days annual leave (with the option to ‘buy’ 3 days more), a competitive pension, season ticket loans, birthday lunches and much more! Take a look at our Instagram Page @CoStarSocial to find out more!  At CoStar, we recognise the positive value of diversity and promote equality. We aim at all times to recruit the person who is most suited to the job and welcome applications from people of all backgrounds – men and women, people of all ages, sexual orientations, nationalities, religions and beliefs. However, we particularly encourage applications from women, disabled and Black, Asian and Minority Ethnic (BAME) candidates, as these groups are underrepresented throughout the commercial real estate industry. We welcome all qualified candidates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the United Kingdom to apply.  However, please note that CoStar is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position COMPANY OVERVIEW Founded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availability. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; Realla, the UK’s leading online commercial real estate marketplace; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry. Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of over 4,300 worldwide. <br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

name: Senior Office Manager - Washington, DC
job_info: Senior Office Manager - Washington, DC<br>Job Description<br>Workplace Services Manager - Washington, DCDescriptionThe Workplace Services Manager based in Washington, DC is responsible for creating an exceptional working environment for 600+ staff in the DC office and supporting the operational needs of 50+ offices serving 4,000 US based employees and ensuring our regional offices allow for an efficient, safe and outstanding work environment.  We are looking for an energetic candidate who will lead the office’s workplace solutions and is equipped to work effectively with many different teams of people including senior management. Moreover, the Workplace Services Manager needs to be able to attend to multiple concerns and manage outside vendors, contractors, requiring good organizational ability and prioritization skills.Responsibilities:Responsible for day-to-day office management of the Washington, DC and smaller satellite officesParticipate in the leadership of the facility departments across the region by assisting in the creation of SOP’s, supervising, mentoring and supporting the team.Assist in managing the relationship with landlords and outsourced real estate service providers to ensure compliance with agreements, adherence to policies and standards and maximization of cost savings opportunities.Demonstrated operational success in managing maintenance operations and vendor services.Oversee purchasing and monitor costs and expenses against budgets.Oversee, review, improve, and implement plans and procedures for facility operations and maintenance, preventative maintenance, and renovation projects, as needed.Coordinate all in-office functions, such as office management, space planning, seating chart, shipping/receiving mail, and conference rooms.Contribute to sustainability efforts: implement measures to reduce energy use and waste, ensuring operations are as green and sustainable as possible.Develop and maintain security and fire protection protocols that reflect current standards and best practices, including evacuation plans, security operation manuals, accident and incident reports, fire and natural disaster plans, and related materials.Ensure compliance with health and safety regulations.Ensure Business Continuity Procedures are actioned, and reasonable security measures exist.Responsible for managing office services by ensuring office operations and procedures are organized, correspondences are controlled, supply requisitions are reviewed and approved.Manage day-to-day Integrated Work Management/Experience System (IWMS)Ensure office efficiency is maintained by carrying out planning and execution of equipment procurement, layouts, and office systems.Requirements:7-10 years of facilities management2+ years experience in a supervisory or management capacity.Intimate familiarity with office management, IT, and security needs.Expertise with facilities operations, project planning, space planning, and management.Effective analytical and problem-solving skills, as well as high attention to detail and organizational skills.Aptitude for collaboration and leadership. Bachelor’s Degree in business/ facilities administration or a related field.Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office suite including Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint, etc.   Candidates must pass proficiency test.Job Information:Location:  Washington, DC –Office Based.Job Function: Facility Operations & Workplace ManagementJob Type: Full-TimeMin Education: BA/BS/UndergraduateRequired Travel: 10-20% travelRemote Work:  Not Eligible<br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

name: Accounts Receivable Collections Specialist II
job_info: Accounts Receivable Collections Specialist II<br>Job Description<br>OVERVIEW CoStar delivers real-time, verified commercial real estate data that helps clients confidently spot great opportunities and make smart choices ahead of competitors. By combining the power of CoStar’s independent research organization – the industry’s largest – with global data delivery, software, and application solutions, clients can act on opportunities with confidence.At CoStar Group, our finance group centralizes transaction processes, providing accurate reporting, financial resolutions, and proper forecasting analysis. Joining the team offers access to financial specializations, including accounts payable, accounts receivable, cash and asset management, client contracts and billing, and revenue recognition.We are currently seeking an experienced Accounts Receivable/Collections Analyst to join our team in our Washington D.C locations.RESPONSIBILITIES Resolve customer issues related to slow pay or non-payment of invoices through pro-active communication with clients and the sales team.Drive high customer satisfaction and retention levels through relationship building, professional and courteous communication.Become proficient in understanding of company A/R-Collection’s life cycle within a 6-month time frame.Escalate slow or non-pay situations at 60-days resulting in development of alternative payment methods or payment plans.BASIC QUALIFICATIONSBA/BS degree required with 4 years of consumer and/or commercial collection experience.Preference for 1 to 4 years of related customer service experienceAble to work within time deadlines by prioritizing workload and understanding the priority business outcomes.Strong EXCEL skills requiredExcellent oral and written communication skills requiredPREFERRED QUALIFCATIONS AND SKILLS Great Plains Collections experience is highly preferredAbility to prioritize tasks and deliver expectations in a timely mannerAbility to work across multiple departmentsStrong focus and attention to detailPositive attitude and flexible, especially in the period of month/quarter/year-end closingOVERVIEW OF COMPANY:Founded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availability. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; LoopNet, the most heavily trafficked mobile and online real estate marketplace; Apartments.com, the premier rental home resource for renters, property managers and owners; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry; BizBuySell, the largest online marketplace for businesses-for-sales; and Lands of America, the leading operator of online marketplaces for rural real estate.Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of over 4,300 worldwide.WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU:Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. In addition to generous compensation and performance-based incentives, you'll be supported in both your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program.Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to):Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription DrugLife, legal, and supplementary insuranceCommuter and parking benefits401(K) retirement plan with matching contributionsEmployee stock purchase planPaid time offTuition reimbursementOn-site fitness center and/or reimbursed fitness center membership costs (location dependent), with yoga studio, Pelotons, personal training, group exercise classes, as well as Segways and bikes available for use during the dayComplimentary gourmet coffee, tea, hot chocolate, prepared foods, fresh fruit, and other healthy snacksBe part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. name: Billing Operations Specialist
job_info: Billing Operations Specialist<br>Job Description<br>OVERVIEW We are searching for an energetic, highly motivated Billing Operations Specialist to join the growing Finance team at our state-of-the-art headquarters in Washington, DC. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment, can balance multiple priorities, and drive towards results, this is a great opportunity to join one of the fastest growing companies in the technology space!The Billing Operations Specialist performs critical business processes related to billing and contracts daily. The key objectives of the position are to ensure high throughput and accuracy in our operations and to contribute to process improvement. This role requires critical thinking, balancing of multiple priorities, and the ability to communicate effectively with both technical and customer support teams. The Billing Operations Specialist will work both independently and in collaboration with a variety of CoStar departments including Finance, Sales, Financial Customer Service, Accounts Receivable, and Cash Applications.RESPONSIBILITIES New customers and subscription setup and maintain customer billing cycles that generate over 22,000 invoices per year for over 8,000 active customers for our hotel industry product line.Develop an in-depth understanding of service environment, including an in-house Enterprise solution, Great Plains and Salesforce, and internal portals.General accounting and customer/client service duties (phone, answer emails). Inquiry and post invoices in Great Plains, apply credit memos and support customer inquiries.Track and measure critical data; review systems and reports for inconsistencies.Effectively balance small-scale projects and day-to-day operations.Partner with colleagues in Shared Services, Technology, and Sales teams to resolve issues and improve processes. Drive communication and change in a world-class organization!Contribute to and support the eventual integration of business processes into Oracle Fusion.Maintain compliance with SOX regulations.BASIC QUALIFICATIONSBachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Accounting or Finance.At least 2 years of billing operations or related experience in a large and dynamic corporate environment.Working knowledge of MS Office suite with advanced MS Excel skills.Superb attention to detail.Strong skills in Mathematics and Communication. Knowledge of accounting best practices.PREFERRED QUALIFCATIONS AND SKILLS Demonstrated ability to gather and analyze large data sets, tell its story, and present recommendations based on that analysis.An aptitude for learning new programs and technologies.Experience working with large ERP systems in an international corporate environment.OVERVIEW OF COMPANY:Founded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. name: Facilities Coordinator
job_info: Facilities Coordinator<br>Job Description<br>Workplace Services Coordinator     Washington, DC    Description  The Workplace Services Coordinator based in Washington, DC is responsible for creating an exceptional working environment for our Headquarters office.  The Workplace Services Coordinator will ensure our office is best-in-class, safe and present an outstanding work environment.  We are looking for an energetic candidate who will work with the larger team providing workplace solutions and is equipped to work effectively with many different teams of people including senior management.  The candidate will also assist the Facilities Operations team in supporting the operational needs of our US based offices.    Moreover, the Workplace Services Coordinator needs to be able to attend to multiple concerns, events and projects requiring advanced organizational ability and prioritization skills.   Responsibilities:   Assists in day-to-day office management of the Washington, DC and support of smaller satellite offices  Provide excellent customer services to our staff related to office and facilities needs.  Oversee supplies, company-supplied food, internal office moves, guest management, parking allocations, switchboard.  Liaison with landlord and property management on day-to-day operations and landlord provided services such as cleaning, building engineering, security and other services.  Assist in managing service contractors for the office:  scheduled and/or equipment maintenance & minor renovation and handyman projects. Oversee purchasing for the office and monitor costs, create purchase orders, review and approve invoices.  Coordinate all in-office functions, such as space planning; seating chart; sustainability efforts; shipping/receiving & mail services; office-wide & special events; catering.  Participate in the wellness/life/safety functions by scheduling required events:  such as fire drills, floors wardens, CPR/AED training, Covid-safety.  Assist in managing the corporate switchboard, guest management and other visitor and guest hospitality services.   Manage office security, including badging, access control and system upkeep.  Utilize & Manage day-to-day Integrated Work Management/Experience System (IWMS)  Report to the Sr Office Manger.    Requirements  2+ years of facilities management experience including experience in similar role managing a large office (100+ people)  Experience and proficiency using IWMS software  Experience with facilities operations   Effective analytical and problem-solving skills, as well as high attention to detail and organizational skills.  Aptitude for collaboration and leadership. Bachelor’s Degree in business/ facilities administration or a related field.  Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office suite including Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint, etc.   Candidates must pass proficiency test.  Excellent communication skills.  Candidate must pass proficiency test for written communication.    Job Information  Location:  Washington, DC:  Office-Based  Remote Work:  Not Eligible  Hours:  8:00am – 5:00pm, Monday - Friday  Job Function: Facility Operations & Workplace Management  Job Type: Full-Time  Min Education: BA/BS/Undergraduate  Required Travel: Up to 10% travel  <br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

name: Senior .NET Developer

name: Data Analyst
job_info: Data Analyst<br>Job Description<br>OVERVIEWCoStar Group is the world’s leading provider of information and marketing solutions for the Commercial Real Estate industry.  We are a NASDAQ listed company with a market cap of over US$30B and sit alongside other notable names such as Amazon, Facebook, Google and Apple.As a technology company, we are the trusted partner for all commercial real estate professionals empowering many of the most well-respected landlords, development companies, brokerage firms, banks, lenders, investors, and government agencies.We do this by actively researching the commercial real estate markets and providing data, analytics, innovative tools, and powerful marketing platforms in the U.S. and Internationally to help our clients transact with one another. name: Bilingual Client Relationship Consultant
job_info: Bilingual Client Relationship Consultant<br>Job Description<br>CONSULTANT.E EN RELATIONS CLIENTSAPERÇUCoStar Group, Inc. est le chef de file en information et en solutions de marketing pour l’industrie de l’immobilier commercial. Notre entreprise, comparable à Amazon, Facebook, Google et Apple, est inscrite au NASDAQ avec une capitalisation boursière de plus de 30 milliards de dollars américains.En tant que firme de technologie, nous agissons comme fidèle partenaire des professionnels de l’immobilier commercial en outillant plusieurs des propriétaires les plus respectés, promoteurs immobiliers, agences de courtage, banques, bailleurs, investisseurs et agences gouvernementales.Nous y arrivons en faisant une recherche active des marchés de l’immobilier commercial et en fournissant des données, de l’analytique, des outils innovants et de puissantes plateformes de marketing aux États-Unis et globalement afin d’aider nos clients à effectuer des transactions entre eux. CoStar continue de gagner plusieurs prix, dont notamment un prix Forbes pour les compagnies les plus innovantes (2017) et un prix Fortune pour les compagnies à la croissance a plus rapide (2018).L’équipe de recherche est au cœur de CoStar et capture des informations essentielles concernant le marché, ce qui permet à nos clients de prendre quotidiennement des décisions d’affaires informées et à forte incidence. La recherche du Groupe CoStar contribue au segment le plus important de notre économie en assistant des entreprises à ouvrir leurs bureaux, magasins, entrepôts et installations manufacturières. Le Groupe CoStar est à la recherche d’une ou d’un consultant.e en relations clients pour se joindre à notre organisation croissante de recherche.En tant que consultant.e en relations clients, vous tisserez des liens avec preneurs de décisions clés représentant des espaces commerciaux disponibles à louer ou à vendre. À partir de ces entrevues, vous organiserez et améliorerez leurs inscriptions pour vous assurez qu’elles obtiendront le plus de visibilité possible sur notre plateforme. En plus, vous capturerez des informations de marché cruciales pour permettre à nos clients de prendre des décisions d’affaires informées et à haute incidence.RESPONSABILITÉSContribuer à la croissance d’une base de données immobilières complète et exacteEffectuer appels quotidiens (entrants et sortants) avec des courtiers immobiliers, promoteurs, investisseurs et autres professionnels de l’immobilier afin d’obtenir de l’information en temps réel sur des propriétés et des transactionsEnquêter sur de nouvelles inscriptions d’espaces, des transactions récentes de vente et de location, tout en répertoriant de l’information sur la construction et les propriétaires dans un marchéÉtablir et entretenir des relations mutuellement bénéfiques avec des clientsS’associer avec nos clients afin de mieux positionner leurs propriétés sur tous les sites Web de CoStarFaire la dissection de tendances et collaborer avec des équipes régionales pour vérifier les données trimestrielles et assister à l’élaboration d’une thématique sur un marché entierFournir un service à la clientèle exceptionnel à tous nos clients en mettant l’accent sur l’attention personnelleEXIGENCES DE CanadaAucune restriction pour voyager immédiatement aux États-Unis et y entrer pour affairesQUALIFICATIONS ET APTITUDES ADDITIONNELLES SOUHAITÉESÊtre de nature curieuse et démontrer une habilité à effectuer de la recherche approfondieSuccès éprouvé à performer avec des métriques et des indicateurs clés de performanceExpérience de communication avec des partenaires d’affaires internes et externes au téléphoneHabileté à gérer des responsabilités variables et exceller dans un environnement dynamiqueCapacité à tisser et faire croître des relations avec les clients en effectuant des entrevues effectives avec des professionnels de l’immobilier commercial ayant comme objectif la mise à jour de la base de donnéesApproche axée sur le client quant il en vient aux tâches, ce qui inclut un désir de faire partenariat avec les clientsHabilité à travailler dans un environnement d’équipe et comme contributeur individuelExpérience ou connaissance éprouvée de l’industrie de l’immobilier commercialExpérience et compétence démontrées avec Excel pour manipuler des données, utiliser des filtres et développer des formules simples.Capacité à capturer des données exactesDémontrer de la souplesse d’esprit et être en mesure de s’adapter à des situations changeantes dans une compagnie à croissance élevée.APERÇU DE LA COMPAGNIEFondé en 1987, CoStar Group, Inc. (Nasdaq:CSGP) est le fournisseur principal d’information en immobilier commercial, en analytique et en marchés virtuels. Afin de produire et de maintenir la plus grande et la plus complète base de données sur l’immobilier commercial, CoStar mène des activités de recherche détaillées et continues. Notre gamme de services en ligne permet à nos clients d’analyser, d’interpréter et d’acquérir une connaissance incomparable des valeurs immobilières, des conditions du marché et des disponibilités. Derrière quelques-unes des marques les plus reconnues de l’industrie, le Groupe CoStar comprend CoStar, le plus grand fournisseur de recherche en immobilier commercial et en données en temps réel; LoopNet, le marché virtuel et mobile ayant le plus de trafic de l’industrie; Apartments.com, la ressource première en location résidentielle pour les locataires, gestionnaires de propriété et les propriétaires; STR, le chef de file en étalonnage de performance et d’analytique comparative de l’industrie hôtelière; BizBuySell, le plus grand marché virtuel d’entreprises à vendre; et Lands of America, le plus grand opérateur de marchés virtuels d’immobilier rural. Ayant son siège social à Washington, DC, CoStar possède des bureaux à travers les États-Unis, en Europe, en Asie et au Canada.Avec une équipe mondiale d’environ 4,300 employés, CoStar est la plus grande organisation de recherche professionnelle de l’industrie.AVANTAGESTravailler à CoStar signifie que vous joindrez une culture de collaboration et d’innovation qui attire les meilleurs et les plus brillants candidats de plusieurs disciplines. En plus d’une compensation généreuse et d’incitatifs à la performance, vous serez soutenu(e) dans votre croissance académique avec de la formation interne, un programme de remboursement de frais de scolarité et un programme d’échange inter-bureaux.Nos avantages sociaux incluent notamment (cette liste n’est pas exhaustive) :Prestations généreuses pour soins de santé étendus (hospitalisation, médicaments, vision et couverture internationale), soins dentaires, assurance vie et invaliditéRemboursement des dépenses reliées au transport en communRégime enregistré d’épargne-retraite (REÉR) collectif avec programme de cotisation égale grâce à un régime de participation différée aux bénéficesProgrammes de vacances payéesRemboursement de frais de scolaritéCafé gourmet, thé, chocolat chaud, fruits frais et autres collations santé offerts gratuitementFaites partie d’une équipe de professionnels qui apprécient l’opportunité d’apprendre, d’agir et de croître dans une atmosphère gratifiante. Mais ne nous croyez pas sur parole – voyez par vous-mêmes pourquoi note équipe a choisi de travailler et de rester chez CoStar : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CVbJRnJ2sX0Nous encourageons tous les candidats qualifiés qui sont éligibles à travailler au Canada à appliquer. Cependant, prière de prendre note que CoStar n’est pas en mesure de parrainer une demande de visa pour cette position.OVERVIEW CoStar Group is the world’s leading provider of information and marketing solutions for the Commercial Real Estate industry.  We are a NASDAQ listed company with a market cap of over US$30B and sit alongside other notable names such as Amazon, Facebook, Google and Apple.As a technology company, we are the trusted partner for all commercial real estate professionals empowering many of the most well-respected landlords, development companies, brokerage firms, banks, lenders, investors and government agencies.We do this by actively researching the commercial real estate markets and providing data, analytics, innovative tools and powerful marketing platforms in the U.S. and Internationally to help our clients transact with one another. CoStar continues to win multiple awards including one of Forbes most innovative companies (2017) and Fortune’s fastest growing companies (2018).The Research team is the heart of CoStar, capturing market-critical information that enables our commercial real estate clients to make informed, high impact business decisions daily. CoStar Group’s research contributes to the most important segment of our economy, helping businesses open offices, retail stores, warehouses, and manufacturing facilities. CoStar Group is seeking a Client Relationship Consultant to join our growing research organization.As a Client Relationship Consultant, you will build relationships with key decision makers representing various commercial real estate spaces available for sale and/or for lease. Through these interviews, you will curate their listings, ensuring they are getting the most visibility on our platform. In addition, you will capture market-critical information that enables our clients to make informed high impact business decisions.RESPONSIBILITIESContribute to the growth of an accurate and complete database of commercial real estate inventoryConduct daily outbound and inbound phone calls with brokers, developers, property owners and other real estate professionals to obtain real-time property name: Senior Manager, Functional Oracle Cloud ERP
job_info: Senior Manager, Functional Oracle Cloud ERP<br>Job Description<br>DESCRIPTIONThe Senior Manager, Functional Oracle Cloud ERP is responsible for the Oracle Cloud ERP (Fusion) system and integrations. This is a hands-on techno-functional position responsible for the design, configuration, and deployment of additional functionality for Order to Cash. The role leads a small high-performance team, and works with 3rd parties as needed, contributing to the company’s strategic and regulatory objectives on a global scale.RESPONSIBILITIES· Lead the Functional Workstream of Oracle Order-to-Cash (OTC) implementation projects as a part of the larger implementation team· Understand all existing Oracle Cloud ERP Fusion services/capabilities/configurations – to include G/L, Procurement, A/P, Fixed Assets, Cash Management, and Financials· Support the Oracle Cloud ERP Technical Workstream Lead as it related to integrations and other CEMLI objects· Supervise a small team of professional staff dedicated to implementation of Oracle ERP· Recommend best practices in leveraging Oracle ERP technology to meet day-to-day business needs as well as scaling and automating for volume and growth.· Provide significant input/guidance into the planning and leadership in the implementation of Oracle Order-to-Cash (OTC) including A/R and Advanced Collections· Lead project team members as well as share your individual subject matter expertise· Perform a wide array of tasks, which can include leading strategic meetings with project stakeholders through very tactical implementation tasks· Participate and provide guidance as needed in general project efforts such as business analysis, system design, business process re-engineering, quality assurance and change managementSKILLS/QUALIFICATIONS· Ten (10) years of experience minimum leading finance and management related technology solutions in a global company· Seven (7) years minimum direct hands-on experience implementing Oracle ERP (Fusion) –A/R, Advanced Collections, Cash Management, G/L, Procurement, A/P, Fixed Assets, on a global scale· Prior implementation experience (prefer two cycles) of Oracle Cloud ERP (Fusion) OTC· Experience implementing and supporting Oracle Integration Cloud Service (OIC)· Experience with Financial Reporting Studio and BI Publisher· Experience testing ERP application instances to successfully validate application setups, including input to test plans, test scenarios, and test scripts· Experience with data conversions and ERP integrations (such as Workday, Concur, legacy AP or AR systems) to Oracle applications· Strong finance business process experience and acumen· Relevant Oracle specialist certifications strongly preferred· Experience operating in an IT Controls / SOX environment· A process-oriented individual, with strong project management skills, who has the flexibility to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic organization.· An ability to articulate and clearly communicate complex problems and solutions in a simple, logical and impactful manner.· Must be flexible and adaptable to changing business models.· The ability to develop creative and breakthrough solutions.· BS in Computer Science or Information Systems or Accounting· MBA preferredADDITIONAL INFORMATION You have strong knowledge and experience addressing a broad range of accounting matters, ensuring it is processed in compliance with established internal controls. You possess analytical skills needed to correctly grasp and communicate data and analyze and reconcile accounts; ability to handle confidential and sensitive information with the appropriate discretion; and handle multiple deadlines. You are a self-starter, work well as a team player, but can work independently when appropriate. You possess the ability to analyze problems and actively strategize to resolve them, pay attention to detail, and have excellent organization and communication skills. You are results oriented. You can juggle multiple tasks, work cross-functionally and at all levels of the organization, whether internally or externally. You are flexible and comfortable in a dynamic, fast-paced environment and can prioritize to focus on the important, not just the urgent.<br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

name: Quantitative Analyst
job_info: Quantitative Analyst<br>Job Description<br>Are you looking for a role where you can combine passion for quantitative research and analysis to better understand and forecast investment performance within the commercial real estate space? If so this maybe the role for you!CoStar Risk Analytics (http://www.costar.com/products/costar-risk-analytics) is currently in need of a Senior Quantitative Analyst to join the growing Boston based team. The mission of the Senior Quantitative Analyst is to develop credit risk models for commercial real estate whole loans and CMBS securitized loans and participating in building lender platform to assist lender clients in their loan surveillance and risk management processes. In addition, the Senior Quantitative Analyst performs research regarding mortgage risk, pricing, structured products, portfolio risk management, and related topics.CoStar Risk Analytics, located in Boston, MA, provides unparalleled tools and information clients need to effectively measure risk, design meaningful analytics, comply with regulatory requirements, manage portfolios and make informed decisions. Leveraging CoStar Groups unparalleled CRE data, the Quantitative Analyst is able to provide the transparency necessary to communicate key drivers of CRE performance in markets across North America and Europe. Clients predominantly include commercial banks, insurance companies, CMBS investors, government agencies and regulators.Responsibilities:Conduct independent and creative quantitative research applied towards evaluation of CRE mortgage default risk, prepayment risk, recoveries, pricing, and capital adequacyPerform econometric-based forecasting, economic reasoning, and quantitative analysisDetermine the need for changes to existing models and strategiesUpdate model calibration and conduct model validationDocument models and analytic products/tools for external client & internal analyst usageImplement data mining techniques to leverage databases for use in a variety of products/toolsAssist with CoStar Risk Analytic clients’ requests and analytical projects:Running CoStar Risk Analytics commercial real estate credit default model, including scenario modeling of client and industry/research portfoliosWork with IT developers on model de-bugging and Beta testing of prototype model versions, program development, and enhancement projectsQuality assurance functions on model enhancements and periodic forecast updatesTesting and cleaning of client supplied or industry/research dataAssistance with primary analyses of the CMBS, life insurance, banking, or agency loan universe; development of appropriate indices that track relevant industry data, characteristics, or performanceAssist clients with CoStar Risk Analytics training, model execution, error de-bugging, and interpretative analysis regarding Compass loan or portfolio resultsAssist sales team where appropriate with:Demonstrations of CoStar Risk Analytics model and other related products;Preparation of presentations regarding Capital Market research, market views, and investment strategyBasic Qualifications:Bachelor's Degree in relevant field, requiredMaster’s degree in Economics/Statistics/Real Estate/Finance/Financial Engineering, strongly preferred2+ years of relevant work experience in a research-oriented environment and/or in financial services including banking, insurance, investment management, commercial real estate (CRE), or accountingA deep background in econometrics, quantitative methodologies, applied statistical analysis, model buildingExcellent programming skills in SQL, Python, SAS, Stata, R, or other languages and the ability to conduct data mining in large datasetExperienced user of common market analytical tools, such as Bloomberg, Intex, Trepp, Derivative Solutions, etc.Familiarity with regulatory framework including CECL, CCAR/DFAST and Basel III is a plusFamiliarity with industry trends in with investment, technology, and lending such as AI/machine learning, climate risk, and ESG is a plusAccuracy and attention to detailFounded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces.
