name: Director, UI/UX Design
job_info: Director, UI/UX Design<br>Job Description<br>DIRECTOR, UX/UI DESIGN – APARTMENTS.COM – ATLANTA, GA OVERVIEW:Are you a passionate, experienced design leader seeking to guide and develop a talented, driven team of UX/UI designers and researchers and advance the user experience for best-in-class brand? As Director, UX/UI Design, you’ll champion a forward-thinking design philosophy and create a highly engaging, inclusive, and usable product for Apartments.com. As a valued leader in our product organization, you’ll collaborate across business units to find opportunities for new products and features, validate assumptions through research and testing, and build compelling experiences that customers return to time and time again. Together you and your team will drive the overall quality of design and user experience, make a substantial impact to the Apartments.com business, and improve the way the rental industry works.  ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES:You’ll partner with product leadership to execute product vision and strategy, thinking strategically to build true end-to-end experiences. You’ll set the direction for design thinking and evolve our design system to ensure design principles and methods are consistently applied across every product and experience. You’ll manage, mentor, and develop a team of highly productive, collaborative, and effective user experience designers and researchers. You’ll create a culture where team members can iterate and experiment collaboratively to challenge the status quo, drive new thinking, and create innovative experiences. You’ll manage multiple strategic and tactical design projects throughout all stages, from concept through to production and then iterate. You’ll advance our user research capabilities to deeply understand customers, assess the effectiveness of designs, and make informed design decisions. You’ll frame goals, define metrics, and track the outcomes of your and your team’s work and use data to inform plans and changes to those plans. You’ll lead by example as sometimes a leader must do the work to show the way.  BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:Bachelor’s degree in Design, Communications, Fine Arts, Business, or related field 8+ years of experience leading or managing team of UX/UI designers  Experience creating wireframes, mockups, and designs  Experience designing and delivering website product features for consumers  Experience collaborating with product and engineering teams to launch features  Experience conducting user research and testing throughout the product lifecycle Experience developing and evolving design systems Excellent visual and interaction design skills with a strong portfolio  Excellent verbal and written skills communicating ideas, concepts, and designs Expertise with Sketch, InVision, Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, PowerPoint Familiarity with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and other front-end web programing languages  PREFERRED QUALIFCATIONS AND SKILLS  Experience working with enterprise websites and online marketplaces Experience working in an agile/scrum software development process Experience hiring, developing, and scaling a user experience team Experience creating data visualizations  ABOUT COSTAR GROUP CoStar Group is the world’s leading provider of information and marketing solutions for the commercial real estate industry. We are a publicly traded company (NASDAQ:CSGP) with a market cap of over US$30B and sit alongside other notable names such as Amazon, Facebook, Google, and Apple. We've been living and breathing the world of commercial real estate information and marketplaces for over 30 years, giving us the perspective to create truly unique and valuable offerings. We’re working to build a world where people can reach their real estate goals more efficiently and effectively with the best tools and information available. That’s why we created CoStar Group, and that vision keeps us moving forward every day. We do this by actively researching the commercial real estate markets and providing data, analytics, innovative tools, and powerful marketing platforms in the U.S. and Internationally to help our clients transact with one another. CoStar Group continues to win multiple awards including one of Forbes most innovative companies (2014, 2017) and Fortune’s fastest growing companies (2016, 2018, 2020). Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of approximately 4,900 worldwide, including the industry’s largest professional research organization. WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU? Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. In addition to generous compensation and performance-based incentives, you'll be supported in both your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program. Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to): Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription Drug Life, legal, and supplementary insurance Commuter and parking benefits 401(K) retirement plan with matching contributions Employee stock purchase plan Paid time off Tuition reimbursement Complimentary gourmet coffee, tea, prepared foods, fresh fruit, and other healthy snacks Be part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. But don't just take our word for it -- see why our team chose to work at and stay at CoStar Group: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CVbJRnJ2sX0  We welcome all qualified candidates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the United States to apply.  However, please note that CoStar is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position. CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing. <br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

name: Tenant Researcher
job_info: Tenant Researcher<br>Job Description<br>COSTAR GROUP – TENANT RESEARCHER - LONDONOVERVIEWCoStar delivers real-time, verified commercial real estate data that helps clients confidently spot great opportunities and make smart choices ahead of competitors. By combining the power of CoStar’s independent research organization – the industry’s largest – with global data delivery, software, and application solutions, clients can act on opportunities with confidence.The Marketing Research team is the heart of CoStar, capturing market-critical information that enables our commercial real estate clients to make informed, high impact business decisions daily. CoStar Group’s research contributes to the most important segment of our economy, helping businesses open offices, retail stores, warehouses, and manufacturing facilities.CoStar Group is seeking a Tenant Researcher to join our growing research organization.As a Tenant Researcher, you will be investigating and profiling companies to help owners, brokers and real estate professionals identify which companies are best suited for their buildings.  RESPONSIBILITIES Investigate and profile commercial tenant through phone interviews with the tenants, owners and real estate professionalCross-checking Land Registry database with the CoStar platform to ensure accuracy of informationDownload and review lease documents, extracting data points and entering into CoStar platform Conduct web research to create comprehensive profiles on commercial tenants and business decision makersDocument tenant movement within a MarketMaintain complete and accurate Tenant rosters for Commercial buildingsInvestigate new property and tenant leadsDocument and profile corporation structuresBASIC QUALIFICATIONSEducated to degree level essentialHave experience providing a high level of customer service The ability to connect with people quickly and professionallyPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS Be curious by nature, and demonstrate the ability through investigative researchBe persistent in the pursuit of informationAccurately capture large dataManage multiple responsibilities and excel in a fast-paced environmentBe goal-oriented, competitive and motivated by successCOMPANY OVERVIEW Founded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availability. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; Realla, the UK’s newest online commercial real estate marketplace; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry.Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of over 4,300 worldwide.WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. As well as having an outstanding working environment based in the Shard, other perks include full private medical cover and member rewards, 25 days annual leave, a competitive pension, season ticket loans, birthday lunches and much more! name: Customer Success Manager
job_info: Customer Success Manager<br>Job Description<br>OVERVIEW CoStar Group is the world’s leading provider of information and marketing solutions for the Commercial Real Estate industry.  We are a NASDAQ listed company with a market cap of over US$30B and sit alongside other notable names such as Amazon, Facebook, Google and Apple.CoStar Real Estate Manager, a division of CoStar Group, provides cloud-based lease accounting and lease administration applications to the commercial real estate industry. CoStar Real Estate Manager helps corporations, retailers, landlords, and commercial real estate service providers build world-class real estate operations by providing integrated solutions that eliminate information "silos" and consolidate information across business units.The Customer Success Manager is a trusted advisor responsible for ensuring customer success. name: Front End Software Engineer
job_info: Front End Software Engineer<br>Job Description<br>OVERVIEWFounded in 1985, STR provides premium data benchmarking, analytics and marketplace insights for global hospitality sectors. STR was acquired in October 2019 as a division of CoStar Group, Inc., the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics and online marketplaces.  STR is in the process of combining the commercial real estate industries largest and most up to date properties database with STR’s global hospitality performance data to give both real estate and hospitality customers a unique and powerful combined view of their local markets.The Applications Services team works with the CoStar Analytics team to develop customer-facing Hospitality benchmarking products.  We think big; creating innovative data-intensive applications that take the vast amount of data collected from STR clients and by the CoStar Research teams to create a fast, reliable and intuitive analytics platform for customers.  We are a collaborative group with a mix of big data, API/platform and front-end skills, and we are growing rapidly to help invent the future of Hospitality benchmarking and analytics. We are searching for an experienced Front-End Developer to join our Hendersonville, TN team and drive the full-lifecycle development of these critical products.RESPONSIBILITIESDesigning, building, testing and deploying scalable, reusable and maintainable applications that handle large amounts of data with a good understanding of design patterns, and modern architectural trends.Taking ownership of your work, from development and testing, to eventual deployment and support in production.Collaborating with other engineers, product owners, designers, and leadership using agile development practices.Becoming a trusted team member in matters of technical architecture, design, and code.Advocating for evolution and improvement - both technical and non-technical - within our teams.  Includes new tech, tools and best practices.Gain a deep understanding of the CoStar and STR company business rules and methodology.BASIC QUALIFICATIONSBachelor’s degree, preferably in Computer Science/Engineering.3+ years of professional software development experience.Deep knowledge of modern JavaScript.Deep knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, and CSS preprocessors.Expertise with software development best practices, including standards, code reviews, source control, builds, testing and operations.Strong analytical and problem solving abilities.PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLSExpertise with Source Control, such as Git or TFS.Expertise with Cloud platforms such as AWS or Azure is a plus.Experience with React, TypeScript, Webpack, and NodeJS a big plusExperience with testing frameworks such as Jest, Mocha, and ChaiOVERVIEW OF COMPANY:Founded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availability. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; LoopNet, the most heavily trafficked mobile and online real estate marketplace; Apartments.com, the premier rental home resource for renters, property managers and owners; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry; BizBuySell, the largest online marketplace for businesses-for-sales; and Lands of America, the leading operator of online marketplaces for rural real estate.Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of over 4,300 worldwide.WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU:Working at STR and CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. In addition to generous compensation and performance-based incentives, you'll be supported in both your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program.Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to):Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription DrugLife, legal, and supplementary insurance401(K) retirement plan with matching contributionsEmployee stock purchase planPaid time offTuition reimbursementBe part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. name: Regional Director, Apartments.com - Phoenix, AZ
job_info: Regional Director, Apartments.com - Phoenix, AZ<br>Job Description<br>OVERVIEWApartments.com is the leading online apartment rental listing website, offering property, commuter, and neighborhood information for more than 1,000,000 available units nationwide. A CoStar Group subsidiary, the Apartments.com network includes Apartments.com, ForRent.com, ApartmentFinder.com, Apartamentos.com, ApartmentHomeLiving.com, ForRentUniversity.com, After55.com, CorporateHousing.com and WestsideRentals.com. Reaching millions of renters worldwide, enabling both qualified traffic and highly engaged renters, Apartments.com is the fastest growing site within the residential rental industry.As an Apartments.com Regional Director (RD) you will be responsible for ensuring the development and successful delivery of growth objectives for Multi-Family marketing and Apartments.com Market Analytics in their region/team. The RD is responsible for growing and developing the region’s revenues by selling new advertising and info subscriptions to new customers, growing existing customer revenues by up/crossing selling additional/other costar services and ensuring high levels of customer service and high renewal rates.The RD will manage Sales Associates who are focused on growing new & existing customer business, driving product usage/adoption, preventing reversals, managing accounts and providing outstanding customer service. Team members include Multi-Family Sales Executives and Multi-Family Client Relationship Managers.RESPONSIBILITIESAttract, hire, develop, motivate and develop high impact sales people capable of meeting/exceeding sales quotaSpend 3-4 days per week in the field on sales calls with their sales people and provide coaching and training as necessary to enhance their sales effectiveness by meeting and exceeding sales quotasManage the identification, prioritization and winning of new client relationships as well as the retention and growth of our current clients while getting to know all of the major accounts in the marketMonitor sales performance and hold sales people accountable to the required level of sales activity and client relationships to ensure the achievement of business performance targets and standardsActive management of team member’s weekly activities is essential including weekly attendance to the Monday Morning Sales Meeting, weekly CoStar office attendance and prompt use of Enterprise/GoSell CRM systems which captures sales activities, sales pipelines and account assignmentsEstablish individual and team performance targets that align with overall business goals.  Monitor performance and take action, as necessary, to ensure timely resolution of performance issues and personnel changes required to ensure targets are achievedDevelop and mentor all team membersEnsure CoStar culture and values are adopted my team membersBASIC QUALIFICATIONSFive or more years of progressive experience in a front line sales leadership roleThree or more years of experience directly managing a team of 3-5 reps, executives/sales staff, including the ability to attract, hire, train and develop a high performing sales teamExperience being responsible for a book of business in excess of $1 million in annual revenueExperience managing sales efforts in a highly transactional, consultative sales oriented, fast-paced organization with a short cycle-time sales model.Bachelor’s DegreePREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLSPreferred industries include:  commercial real estate, information services, financial services, Software & SAAS salesDemonstrated track record of rapidly growing a sales territory or market through organic growth via a combination of new client acquisition and existing account growth and consistently exceeding sales performance targets over multiple years.Demonstrated ability to build long-term and sustainable relationships and business partnerships with clients at all levelsEffective internal relationship building skills (superiors, peers, teams, company-wide) and externally (sales channels, customers, etc.)Demonstrated ability to retain proven sales producers and remove non-producersWHY COSTAR?Industry leader with an name: Sales Associate, Ten-X - Richmond, VA
job_info: Sales Associate, Ten-X - Richmond, VA<br>Job Description<br>SALES ASSOCIATE – TEN-X – SALES – Richmond, VA OVERVIEW CoStar Group is the world’s leading provider of information and marketing solutions for the Commercial Real Estate industry.  We are a NASDAQ listed company with a market cap of over US$30B and sit alongside other notable names such as Amazon, Facebook, Google and Apple.  As a technology company, we are the trusted partner for all commercial real estate professionals empowering many of the most well-respected landlords, development companies, brokerage firms, banks, lenders, investors and government agencies. Ten-X, now a member of the CoStar family, powers 90% of all online commercial real estate transactions.  Our auction platform empowers brokers, sellers and buyers with data-driven technology and comprehensive marketing tools to expand market visibility and decrease time to close. As a Ten-X Sales Associate you will prospect and engage potential clients – brokers, sellers and buyers - educating them on the tools and services available to them through the Ten-X auction platform and process. You will partner with your clients from start to close to deliver flawless execution while collaborating with CoStar and LoopNet sales teams on joint marketing and sales opportunities.   At CoStar you will receive a world class onboarding experience that includes a robust training program designed to ensure Sales Associates have a deep understanding of the Ten-X platform, the Commercial Real Estate industry, and the broader CoStar business and how our products and platforms provide value to our clients.   RESPONSIBILITIES Gain a thorough understanding of your clients and their needs while building strong lasting relationships with key decision makers Become an expert in the Ten-X end-to-end transaction platform and marketing solutions  Complete ownership of the full sales cycle including: prospecting, pitching, marketing and closing Conduct client and prospect presentations of our products and services Underwrite and valuate prospect and client’s assets  Manage relationships with commercial real estate brokers, sellers and buyers before during and after the auction process Represent Ten-X by hosting and attending industry events and networking with commercial real estate professionals in your market Team – asset manager OUR BEST PERFORMERS ARE Passionate, hard-working and ambitious – As an innovator, we are fast paced and creative and expect our Sales Associates to move quickly to seize opportunity. Fast to learn new concepts and apply them - CoStar clients and prospects are diverse and demanding. With a constantly evolving suite of products, successful Sales Associates are skilled at understanding a clients need and recommending the appropriate CoStar product. Curious - Our best salespeople ask intelligent questions, demonstrate strong listening skills and learn from customers and colleagues Excellent communicators - our broad-ranging solutions require clear, concise communication tailored to the relevant audience. Committed to Customer Service – Successful Sales Associate’s at CoStar provide valuable insights and take ownership of their client’s requests, managing them to a successful outcome. Flawless Execution – Our clients trust us with their most valuable assets and our sales team takes extreme care in executing transactions flawlessly so that we can keep and build on that trust.   BASIC QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS Three or more years of successful outside sales and account management experience in a business to business environment selling financial securities, financial technology, business intelligence or data and analytics. Or equivalent sales experience within the Commercial Real Estate industry.  Proven ability to meet and exceed sales quotas Passion for building relationships and leveraging your network to find and approach decision makers Strong multitasking and organizational skills Bachelor’s degree  WHY COSTAR? The industry leader with an energetic and fast paced dynamic culture Innovative technology and a reputation for outstanding products 95% customer renewal rate  Consistent 20%+ average of year over year growth  Outstanding sales and product training programs Excellent career growth opportunities High compensation with uncapped commissions and an outstanding annual Presidents Club trip  Exceptional benefit plan including an employee discounted stock purchase plan  Be part of a team of sales professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. But don't just take our word for it -- see why our team chose to work at and stay at CoStar Group: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CVbJRnJ2sX0 We welcome all qualified candidates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the United States to apply.  However, please note that CoStar is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position   CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing#LI-DH1<br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

name: Field Research Photographer- Inland Empire
job_info: Field Research Photographer- Inland Empire<br>Job Description<br>OVERVIEWCoStar Group is the world’s leading provider of information and marketing solutions for the Commercial Real Estate industry.  We are a NASDAQ listed company with a market cap of over US$30B and sit alongside other notable names such as Amazon, Facebook, Google and Apple.As a technology company, we are the trusted partner for all commercial real estate professionals empowering many of the most well-respected landlords, development companies, brokerage firms, banks, lenders, investors and government agencies.We do this by actively researching the commercial real estate markets and providing data, analytics, innovative tools and powerful marketing platforms in the U.S. and Internationally to help our clients transact with one another. CoStar continues to win multiple awards including one of Forbes most innovative companies (2017) and Fortune’s fastest growing companies (2018).The Research team is the heart of CoStar, capturing market-critical information that enables our commercial real estate clients to make informed, high impact business decisions daily. CoStar Group’s research contributes to the most important segment of our economy, helping businesses open offices, retail stores, warehouses, and manufacturing facilities. CoStar Group is seeking a Field Photographer to join our growing research organization.As a CoStar Field Photographer, you will be at the foundation to the company’s media and data collection efforts and play an integral part of our Marketing Research ecosystem. The collection of accurate and timely data and professional photography are essential to CoStar Group customers and the goals we are eager to meet. Use your invention, imagination, creative expertise and talent to produce original professional quality photography and video on assigned commercial properties.RESPONSIBILITIESSupport our customer’s marketing efforts on our industry-leading marketplaces by capturing beautiful exterior and interior photography, 3-D virtual tours, and videography of their propertiesUse Photoshop, Lightroom, and non-linear editing tools (Premiere, Final Cut Pro X) to edit captured mediaOwn the market! Navigate one-mile square grids to ensure complete coverage and that all critical database fields are collected and properties photographedWith the company vehicle as your office, identify among dozens of key data points such as new inventory, “for lease” and “for sale” availabilities, commercial building occupancy, and moreLeverage optimized field research mobile and web software as you explore buildings inside and outProfessionally communicate with customers, sales, Marketing Research partners, and management to strategically evaluate priorities, initiatives, and tasksAbide by CoStar safety standardsMaintain company vehicle and equipmentRepresent the Company at occasional trade functions, conferences, and eventsBASIC QUALIFICATIONSHigh School Diploma required1+ year experience with digital photography using DSLR or Mirrorless camera1+ year experience with image post-processing tools including Photoshop and/or Lightroom1+ year video post-processing experience with tools such as Premiere, Final Cut Pro XArchitectural and/or Real Estate photography and videography experienceCandidates are required to submit portfolio of work supporting above listed experienceA current and valid driver’s license (or the ability to obtain a driver’s license prior to start date) is requiredSatisfactory completion of a Motor Vehicle Record (MVR) check prior to start.  Driving history must reflect responsible driving behavior and compliance with traffic lawsAbility to pass FAA Part 107 certification to commercial fly drones in first three months of employment (fees paid by Company). Willing and able to participate in three-day drone training in Atlanta, GARepetitive and frequent standing, seeing, sitting, walking, and driving up to eight hours per dayHolding five pounds in one hand for five minutes (photography and videography)Repetitive hand and arm movements needed to type and writeOccasional bending, stooping, squatting, lifting, twisting and carrying are necessary to perform job functionsMust be able to work on computer and or mobile devices from vehicle throughout work dayWill be exposed to both vehicle noise and possible car exhaustAbility to conduct job duties outside in various weather conditions each dayPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS Bachelor’s degreeExperience functioning autonomously in the field while achieving key performance and quality indicatorsPossess excellent oral and written communication, as well as organizational skillsDrone flight experienceOVERVIEW OF COMPANYFounded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availability. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; LoopNet, the most heavily trafficked mobile and online real estate marketplace; Apartments.com, the premier rental home resource for renters, property managers and owners; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry; BizBuySell, the largest online marketplace for businesses-for-sales; and Lands of America, the leading operator of online marketplaces for rural real estate.Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of over 4,300 worldwide.WHATS IN IT FOR YOUWorking at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. In addition to generous compensation and performance-based incentives, you'll be supported in both your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program.Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to):Company vehicle provided for business useCompany-paid and insured photography kit including computer, camera, lenses, tripod, drone, and moreComprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription DrugLife, legal, and supplementary insuranceCommuter and parking benefits401(K) retirement plan with matching contributionsEmployee stock purchase planPaid time offTuition reimbursementBe part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. But don't just take our word for it -- see why our team chose to work at and stay at CoStar Group: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CVbJRnJ2sX0We welcome all qualified candidates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the United States to apply.  However, please note that CoStar is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position.CAREER WEBSITE DISCLAIMERCoStar Group seeks information for job applications from candidates in the Canada through only the following channels:The CoStar Group websiteVia email to/from addresses using only the CoStar domain of “@costar.com”Screening and interaction by telephone and through the Microsoft Teams or Zoom platformsBe aware that:CoStar does not use Wire, Google Hangouts, or any other platform for any recruitment related activitiesDisregard any solicitation or request for information related to job applications with CoStar via any other means and/or using email addresses with any other domainCoStar will never ask candidates to make any type of personal financial investment related to gaining employment with the company<br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

name: Technical Business Analyst
job_info: Technical Business Analyst<br>Job Description<br>Technical Business Analyst – Analytics  OVERVIEW: CoStar delivers real-time, verified commercial real estate data that helps clients confidently spot great opportunities and make smart choices ahead of competitors. By combining the power of CoStar’s independent research organization – the industry’s largest – with global data delivery, software, and application solutions, clients can act on opportunities with confidence.  Technical BA will be supporting a team that build products that facilitate 86% of commercial real estate transactions in the United States. These transactions range from a small business owner leasing their first office space to a large multi-national buying a new headquarters campus. On any given day our developers are building products that manage nearly a trillion dollars of potential real estate transactions.We think big, creating innovative data-intensive applications that take the vast amount of data collected by our CoStar Research teams to create a fast, reliable and intuitive analytics platform for our customers.  We are a collaborative group with a many roles and skills, and we are growing rapidly to help invent the future of Real Estate Analytics.    We are searching for an experienced Technical Business Analyst who can gather important company data and compile it into specifications that our teams can use to build world-class Analytic products. Should have the ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously and translate business data into digestible information that will be consumed by various development teams. Candidates should be able to analyze and solve issues that arise from customers and internal users regarding all aspects of CoStar Analytics.  RESPONSIBILITIES: Understanding the CoStar business, the goals of our products, and collaborating with Product Development and Design in the creation of those products Writing acceptance criteria for user stories that contain key information for the development team to do their work  Maintain direct channels of communication with software developers, management, and Product Design to accomplish team goals Responding to analytic specific issues that are raised by internal and external groups Identifying and document business trends utilizing real data that will support new features and applications Holding regular stakeholder/grooming meetings to keep all interested parties updated in project progress Documenting user requirements and business rules to be used in application development Understanding End-To-End test cases at the application and multi-application levelsWorking directly with QA Staff to ensure comprehensive testing for all areas and provide input as to how to test new features  BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in related field 3+ years of related work experience Some experience with technical writingSome experience with Microsoft Office and Project Management Tools (e.g., Team Foundation Server, JIRA) Some experience in user testing and project management  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLSBasic SQL database knowledgeExperience with Agile Development process Analytical and problem-solving abilities Commercial Real Estate knowledge a plus   OVERVIEW OF COMPANY: Founded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availability. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; LoopNet, the most heavily trafficked mobile and online real estate marketplace; Apartments.com, the premier rental home resource for renters, property managers and owners; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry; BizBuySell, the largest online marketplace for businesses-for-sales; and Lands of America, the leading operator of online marketplaces for rural real estate.  Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of over 4,300 worldwide.  WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU:  Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. name: Recruitment Specialist
job_info: Recruitment Specialist<br>Job Description<br>OVERVIEWCoStar delivers real-time, verified commercial real estate data that helps clients confidently spot great opportunities and make smart choices ahead of competitors. By combining the power of CoStar’s independent research organization – the industry’s largest – with global data delivery, software, and application solutions, clients can act on opportunities with confidence. We have achieved a leading position in the UK since the launch of our new data and software product, CoStar Suite, in January 2013. We are a team of engaged and enthusiastic people who put client service and product excellence first, combined with total integrity. Joining the human resources team at CoStar Group, you will contribute to the creation of a highly successful and engaging environment. Supporting both current and future employees, human resources contributes to companywide staffing, formation of competitive compensation and benefit packages, and organizational training and development. As a Recruitment Specialist, you will work the business in identifying, engaging and attracting talent internally and externally as well as providing a great candidate experience. You will partner with hiring managers and improve candidate attraction activities through employer branding tactics. RESPONSIBILITIES: Deliver a timely and responsive end-to-end recruitment process for UK and Europe: creating hire briefs and job specs with managers for high volume or specialist roles; sourcing; benchmarking; interviewing; making offers; onboarding. Manage applicant tracking system and building candidate pipelines and talent pools Planning for critical recruitment points in the year Manage agency and supplier relationshipsProactively develop and maintain relationships with candidates and ensure positive candidate experience throughout process.Ensure that diversity and inclusion is a key part of the recruitment and people strategyAssist with graduate recruitment strategy for our Research department, maintaining relationships with universities, organising and attending Careers Fairs. Manage recruitment administration BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor’s degree in relevant field requiredDemonstrable work experience in end-to-end recruitment role – internal or agencyExperience recruiting in Europe outside of UKLanguage skills: French, German or Spanish  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: Positive ‘can do’ attitude and able to hit the ground runningStrong organisational and administrative skillsStrong understanding of confidentiality and discretion Knowledge of commercial real estate sector Excellent communication skills both written and oralIdeally CIPD qualifiedAbility to prioritize and complete projects within deadlineCOMPANY OVERVIEW Founded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availability. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; Realla, the UK’s newest online commercial real estate marketplace; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry.Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of over 4,300 worldwide. WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. As well as having an outstanding working environment based in the Shard, other perks include full private medical cover and member rewards, 25 days annual leave, a competitive pension, season ticket loans, birthday lunches and much more! Take a look at our Instagram Page @CoStarSocial to find out more! At CoStar, we recognise the positive value of diversity and promote equality. We aim at all times to recruit the person who is most suited to the job and welcome applications from people of all backgrounds – men and women, people of all ages, sexual orientations, nationalities, religions and beliefs.However, we particularly encourage applications from women, disabled and Black, Asian and Minority Ethnic (BAME) candidates, as these groups are underrepresented throughout the commercial real estate industry.<br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

name: Marketing Data Analyst, LoopNet DC
job_info: Marketing Data Analyst, LoopNet DC<br>Job Description<br>Marketing Data Analyst  Job Description  LoopNet, the commercial real estate industry’s leading advertising network, is searching for a highly-qualified marketing analyst to join our fast-paced team. You will help shape marketing strategy by uncovering opportunities for growth through data and analysis. The scale and scope of our marketing activities (from industry defining ad campaigns to large-scale CRM efforts) means you will attack complex, interesting, and impactful questions. You will be responsible for the entire program including data flow, in-depth analysis, ad-hoc reporting, and self-serve dashboard creation. Additionally, you will provide subject matter expertise and leadership to ensure programs and initiatives are well-planned, well-communicated, and well-executed. You will work closely with marketing, design, product management, and sales teams to share insights that define the broader business strategy.  Job Responsibilities: Partner across the business to support marketing programs and growth goals, report on performance, determine measurement approaches, create insights and set strategy for new challenges Build and expand existing dashboards to surface insights and democratize data that empowers marketers and product teams to make decisions Perform exploratory analyses on large volumes of data; extract, package and present recommendations to inform decisions Establish success metrics and measurement plans that explain the incremental impact of marketing campaigns. Translate business questions into appropriate analytical projects that will inform strategic and tactical business decisions. Conduct end-to-end analysis autonomously and communicate insights effectively. Identify and communicate insights to management and cross-functional stakeholders for better decision making. Act as a business partner to teams within marketing to understand, analyze, and provide quantitative insight into their business.  Qualifications: 5+ years’ experience in a Marketing Analytics, Business Analytics, Data Science or relevant data-driven role Mastery of SQL, experience with Python, BI reporting and databases (dimensional and relational), including data ingestion and transformation. Experience with Google Data Studio or similar data visualization tools Experience developing analytical frameworks, metrics to measure ongoing performance and understand performance drivers Ability to transform data into a digestible and presentable story based on different audiences Strong verbal and written communication skills  Proactive, resourceful, and gritty, when you have a goal, you find a way to meet it A team player with project management skills and high attention to detail  An analytical and growth-oriented mindset Comfortable operating in a fast-paced environment Sense of humor a plus   OVERVIEW OF COMPANY: Founded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availability. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; LoopNet, the most heavily trafficked mobile and online real estate marketplace; Apartments.com, the premier rental home resource for renters, property managers and owners; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry; BizBuySell, the largest online marketplace for businesses-for-sales; and Lands of America, the leading operator of online marketplaces for rural real estate. Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of over 4,300 worldwide.   WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU: Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. In addition to generous compensation and performance-based incentives, you'll be supported in both your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program.   Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to): Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription Drug Life, legal, and supplementary insurance Commuter and parking benefits 401(K) retirement plan with matching contributions Employee stock purchase plan Paid time off Tuition reimbursement On-site fitness center and/or reimbursed fitness center membership costs (location dependent), with yoga studio, Pelotons, personal training, group exercise classes, as well as Segways and bikes available for use during the day Complimentary gourmet coffee, tea, hot chocolate, prepared foods, fresh fruit, and other healthy snacks  Be part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. But don't just take our word for it -- see why our team chose to work at and stay at CoStar Group: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CVbJRnJ2sX0  #LI-SB1 <br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

both technical and non-technical - within our teams.  Includes new tech, tools and best practices. Gaining a deep understanding of the CoStar business, including the Analytic products.  BASIC QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Computer Science/Engineering. 5+ years of professional software development experience. Deep knowledge of modern JavaScript / TypeScript Experience building front end frameworks using modern bundlers Experience with testing frameworks such as Jest, Mocha, and Chai Deep knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, and CSS preprocessors Expertise with software development best practices, including standards, code reviews, source control, builds, testing and operations.  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS Expertise with React ecosystem backed with Apollo GraphQL and/or Redux Expertise configuring, maintaining, and optimizing Webpack, RollupJS, and/or Lerna Monorepo configurations Expertise building common/shared Javascript module packages Expertise with D3, RXJS, and/or GoogleMaps API Experience with Amazon Web Services  OVERVIEW OF COMPANY Founded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availability. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; LoopNet, the most heavily trafficked mobile and online real estate marketplace; Apartments.com, the premier rental home resource for renters, property managers and owners; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry; BizBuySell, the largest online marketplace for businesses-for-sales; and Lands of America, the leading operator of online marketplaces for rural real estate. Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of over 4,300 worldwide.  WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. In addition to generous compensation and performance-based incentives, you'll be supported in both your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program.  Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to): Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription Drug Life, legal, and supplementary insurance Commuter and parking benefits 401(K) retirement plan with matching contributions Employee stock purchase plan Paid time off Tuition reimbursement Complimentary gourmet coffee, tea, hot chocolate, prepared foods, fresh fruit, and other healthy snacks Be part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. But don't just take our word for it -- see why our team chose to work at and stay at CoStar Group: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CVbJRnJ2sX0 We welcome all qualified candidates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the United States to apply.  However, please note that CoStar is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position.  #LI-VP1<br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

name: Inside Sales Associate, CoStar-Washington, DC
job_info: Inside Sales Associate, CoStar-Washington, DC<br>Job Description<br>OVERVIEWCoStar Group is the world’s leading provider of information and marketing solutions for the Commercial Real Estate industry.  We are a NASDAQ listed company with a market cap of over US$30B and sit alongside other notable names such as Amazon, Facebook, Google and Apple. As a technology company, we are the trusted partner for all commercial real estate professionals empowering many of the most well-respected landlords, development companies, brokerage firms, banks, lenders, investors and government agencies. We do this by actively researching the commercial real estate markets and providing data, analytics, innovative tools and powerful marketing platforms in the U.S. and Internationally to help our clients transact with one another. CoStar continues to win multiple awards including one of Forbes most innovative companies (2017) and Fortune’s fastest growing companies (2018).As a CoStar Inside Sales Associate you will be responsible for managing an ever-growing book of business working with existing clients to broaden their use of our products.  You will have your own book of business, an endless supply of well qualified leads to develop, excellent products to sell, an excellent career development path. RESPONSIBILITIESDevelop and execute a business plan to manage and grow your existing customer baseProspect and develop a customer pipeline with sales calls, new business sales demonstrations, ensuring successful customer integrationManage client relationships and deliver outstanding customer serviceCreate and manage a well-qualified and consistent sales pipelineREQUIRED QUALIFICATIONSOne or more years of B2B sales experience, or equivalent experience within the Commercial Real Estate industryA strong record of providing outstanding customer serviceBachelor’s degreeWHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?Industry leader with an energetic and fast paced dynamic culture95% customer renewal rate and a Net Promoter Score (High Customer Satisfaction) of 9.2 out of 1020%+ average of year overgrowth and aggressive plans to become a $3 billion dollar company in the next few yearsOutstanding sales and product training programsBe part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. job_info: Product Manager, Mobile Apps<br>Job Description<br>Product Manager, LoopNet (Mobile Apps)– LoopNet – Washington, DCOVERVIEW LoopNet is the leading online real estate marketplace, connecting tenants and investors to commercial real estate available for sale and lease.As the Product Manager for LoopNet, you will be responsible for building and continuously improving this market leading website that introduces prospective tenants and investors to top quality spaces and buildings that meet their needs. The successful candidate will work easily with marketing, research and other business stakeholders to define the overall product vision and strategy, and will work especially well with the design and engineering teams to make that vision a reality.  You will be responsible for all elements of Product Management.The Product Manager will work closely with the UI/UX design team to shepherd new products and features from initial concept through wireframe and high-fidelity mockups, to final delivery by engineering. This includes defining and documenting user stories, writing and reviewing acceptance criteria, and managing and scheduling development resources. You will also be responsible for connecting with clients to understand their needs, employing focus groups and user testing to gain further insights, and translating these findings into an excellent customer experience that accurately displays their listings to our audience of prospective tenants and investors. You will work with our Marketing team to develop collateral and other materials for product launches and execute on thoughtful roll-out strategies. This position is an exciting opportunity for the right person looking to join a great team serving an exciting, evolving industry as part of a leading global organization.RESPONSIBILITIES  Shape and manage the product roadmap for the LoopNet digital products you manage.Drive product releases in a fast-paced Agile software development environment. job_info: Sales Associate, CoStar - San Antonio, TX<br>Job Description<br>CoStar Group is the world’s leading provider of information and marketing solutions for the Commercial Real Estate industry.  We are a NASDAQ listed company with a market cap of over $30B.+As a technology company, we are the trusted partner for all commercial real estate professionals empowering many of the most well-respected landlords, development companies, brokerage firms, banks, lenders, investors and government agencies.We do this by actively researching the commercial real estate markets and providing data, analytics, innovative tools and powerful marketing platforms in the U.S. and Internationally to help our clients transact with one another. You will have your own book of business, an endless supply of well qualified leads to develop, excellent products to sell, an excellent career development path. RESPONSIBILITIESGain a thorough understanding of your clients and their needsBecome an expert in CoStar’s critical information and marketing solutions including LoopNet, the leading online commercial real estate marketplaceComplete ownership of the full sales cycle including: prospecting, demoing, closing, onboarding, training and renewingConduct a high level of in person client and prospect product demonstrationsProvide valuable insight to all participants in the commercial property market, including Brokers, Owners, Investors, Lenders, Appraisers and Service ProvidersRepresent CoStar by hosting and attending industry events and networking with commercial real estate professionals in your marketBASIC QUALIFICATIONSBachelor’s degree requiredClient facing experience in the Commercial Real Estate industry strongly preferredTwo or more years of successful outside sales experience in a B2B environment selling Data, Research and Analytic platforms or tools, commercial real estate, financial services, business intelligence, marketing or information providers.Proven track record exceeding sales targets and quotas in a consultative sales environmentTwo or more years of experience training clients on how to use a solution post saleOUR BEST PERFORMERS AREPassionate, hard-working and ambitious – As an innovator, we are fast paced and creative and expect our Sales Associates to move quickly to seize opportunity.Fast to learn new concepts and apply them - CoStar clients and prospects are diverse and demanding. With a constantly evolving suite of products, successful Sales Associates are skilled at introducing them to their clients.Curious - Our best salespeople ask intelligent questions, demonstrate strong listening skills and learn from customers and colleaguesExcellent communicators - our broad-ranging solutions require clear, concise communication tailored to the relevant audience.Committed to Customer Service – Successful Sales Associate’s at CoStar provide valuable insights and take ownership of their client’s requests, managing them to a successful outcome.WHY COSTAR?The industry leader with an energetic and fast paced dynamic cultureInnovative technology and a reputation for outstanding products95% customer renewal rateConsistent 20%+ average of year over year growthOutstanding sales and product training programsExcellent career growth opportunitiesHigh compensation with uncapped commissions and an outstanding annual Presidents Club tripExceptional benefit plan including an employee discounted stock purchase planBe part of a team of sales professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. name: Sr. Manager - Analytics and Data Science
job_info: Sr. Manager - Analytics and Data Science<br>Job Description<br>CoStar Group is hiring a Senior Manager of Analytics in our San Francisco office to drive improvements in customer growth and engagement by analyzing, measuring, and recommending solutions through data. This exciting opportunity will propel the growth of CoStar Group’s business for sale brands including BizBuySell.com, BizQuest.com, and FindaFranchise.com.In this role you will manage existing data resources, implement new technologies and tooling to further enable the analytics function, and develop and deploy scalable data sharing practices. You will bring significant experience in analytics, product KPIs, goal setting, experimentation, and reporting, and split your time between hands on development and managerial activities. You will own data environments and oversee the development of new processes that support teams across the business for sale marketplace.  You will collaborate with other product, engineering, and data leaders to improve the business by leveraging data modeling, testing platforms and data visualization.We are counting on you to bring a genuine curiosity about how entrepreneurs navigate through the business ownership lifecycle, and pair that with a strong technical aptitude and ability to analyze large datasets, uncover trends and insights, then turn those findings into actionable recommendations.  The ideal candidate will have outstanding communication skills, proven data infrastructure design and implementation capabilities, strong business acumen, and an innate drive to deliver results. He/she will be a self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity and will enjoy working in a dynamic environment.Responsibilities:Develop analytical solutions that help achieve business objectives, and identify and report on the KPI’s that will determine success.Perform proactive exploratory data analysis to uncover trends, insights and develop strategies.Collaborate cross-functionally across internal teams (marketing, product, technology, sales, etc.) to evaluate opportunities that deliver business goals via data analysis, predictive models, and machine learning.Share results and conclusions you draw to derive meaning from the data, and what business actions you think should be taken as a result of the analysis.Improve upon data collection and upkeep of our datasets.  Own the architecture and integrity of our data tracking and reporting systems.Create and maintain shareable standardized reporting using data visualization tools for the KPIs needed by the business.Design and analyze A/B and Multivariate tests.Coordinate across departments and with our analytics providers to establish best practices and adhere to common design patterns, and work through your plans with others to troubleshoot potential issues upfront.Manage a team of 2-3 analysts, coach, and mentor them to achieve their full potential.Skills and Qualifications:Bachelor or Master's Degree required in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Business Analytics, Data Analytics, or Data Science, or related field7+ years of relevant work experience including 3+ years managing analytics and data science teams.Exceptional data analysis skills and the ability to identify actionable insights from large datasetsAdvanced Excel and modelling skillsDeep experience with distilling complex analyses into clear findings for relevant stakeholders and providing applicable business insights and recommendations.Proficient in SQL, writing queries, and reporting from relational databases.  Experience with SQL Server Management Studio.Advanced understanding with web analytics and tag management (i.e. Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, FullStory, Google Tag Manager, and more)Experience with data warehousing systems like Amazon Redshift, Snowflake, BigQueryStrong scripting and programming skills with Python, R, etc. with hands-on experience, preferably in Microsoft related technologies.Good, applied statistics skills, such as distribution analysis, probability theory, statistical testing, regression, etc.Expertise in running exploratory data analysis, statistical modeling and data mining.Experience with designing and analyzing experiments (A/B tests and Multivariate tests).Experience with data visualization tools, such as PowerBI and Tableau.Impeccable attention to details and never compromising attitude for data accuracy.Ability to run automated jobs to manipulate and store data from APIs and various cloud providers.Join the CoStar TeamJoin the team that creates CoStar’s winning technology. If you’re a data science enthusiast, you have an incredible opportunity at CoStar – named one of Forbes’ Most Innovative Growth Companies for four consecutive years. We’re always looking for talent to help build the tools and analytics that harvest our big data and power our research operations and shape the marketplaces that serve tens of millions of people each month. Our culture of innovation and excellence attracts and encourages the best and brightest in a broad range of disciplines, which makes CoStar a fun and supportive place to work.What We OfferYou work hard to connect with our customers and website users every day. As part of your total rewards package, CoStar is committed to offering you valuable health, wellness and financial benefits to support you and your family, both now and in the future. At CoStar, we help our clients succeed by providing the most cutting-edge, reliable information and tools in the business. And we want our employees to succeed too. We strive to hire the best talent and reward you with top-notch, market-leading pay, benefits and career opportunities. As an example of our commitment to excellence, CoStar ranks in the 90th percentile of employers who offer competitive and affordable medical plans.CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testingWe welcome all qualified candidates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the Unites States to apply.  However, please note that CoStar is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position.Company OverviewCoStar Group, Inc. (NASDAQ: CSGP) is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics and online marketplaces. Founded in 1987, CoStar conducts expansive, ongoing research to produce and maintain the largest and most comprehensive database of commercial real estate information. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availabilities. LoopNet is the most heavily trafficked commercial real estate marketplace online. Realla is the UK's most comprehensive commercial property digital marketplace. BizBuySell is the most heavily trafficked business for sale marketplace online with over 3 million visits across our network.  Apartments.com, ApartmentFinder.com, ForRent.com, ApartmentHomeLiving.com, Westside Rentals, AFTER55.com, CorporateHousing.com, ForRentUniversity.com, Cozy and Apartamentos.com form the premier online apartment resource for renters seeking great apartment homes and provide property managers and owners a proven platform for marketing their properties. CoStar Group's websites attracted an average of approximately 50 million unique monthly visitors in aggregate in the third quarter of 2018. job_info: Technical Project Manager<br>Job Description<br>CoStar Real Estate Manager is leading Software as a Service Provider, (SaaS), to the Real Estate and Accounting Industry. (Nasdaq:CSGP), who is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics and online marketplaces. The Technical Project Manager will work with solution design consultants, implementation consultants, business analysists and developers throughout the life of the project to ensure on time and on budget delivery. You’ll also be responsible for hiring and developing talent within our organization. name: Bilingual Tenant Research Associate
job_info: Bilingual Tenant Research Associate<br>Job Description<br>ASSOCIÉ.E EN RECHERCHE SUR LES LOCATAIRESAPERÇUCoStar Group, Inc. est le chef de file en information et en solutions de marketing pour l’industrie de l’immobilier commercial. Notre entreprise, comparable à Amazon, Facebook, Google et Apple, est inscrite au NASDAQ avec une capitalisation boursière de plus de 30 milliards de dollars américains.En tant que firme de technologie, nous agissons comme fidèle partenaire des professionnels de l’immobilier commercial en outillant plusieurs des propriétaires les plus respectés, promoteurs immobiliers, agences de courtage, banques, bailleurs, investisseurs et agences gouvernementales.Nous y arrivons en faisant une recherche active des marchés de l’immobilier commercial et en fournissant des données, de l’analytique, des outils innovants et de puissantes plateformes de marketing aux États-Unis et globalement afin d’aider nos clients à effectuer des transactions entre eux. CoStar contine de gagner plusieurs prix, dont notamment un prix Forbes pour les compagnies les plus innovantes (2017) et un prix Fortune pour les compagnies à la croissance a plus rapide (2018).L’équipe de recherche est au cœur de CoStar et capture des informations essentielles concernant le marché, ce qui permet à nos clients de prendre quotidiennement des décisions d’affaires informées et à forte incidence. La recherche du Groupe CoStar contribue au segment le plus important de notre économie en assistant des entreprises à ouvrir leurs bureaux, magasins, entrepôts et installations manufacturières.En tant qu’associé.e à la recherche aux locataires, vous enquêterez et créerez les profils de compagnies afin d’aider propriétaires, courtiers immobiliers et professionnels de l’immobilier à identifier les compagnies les mieux adaptées à leurs immeubles.RESPONSABILITÉSEnquêter et créer les profils de locataires commerciaux à l’aide d’entrevues téléphoniques avec des locataires, des propriétaires et des professionnels de l’immobilierEffectuer plus de deux heures d’entrevues téléphoniques chaque jour auprès de locataires, de propriétaires et de professionnels de l’immobilier occupant ou gérant des espaces commerciauxEffectuer de la recherche sur le Web pour créer des profils complets sur les locataires commerciaux et leurs preneurs de décisionsDocumenter les mouvements de locataires à l’intérieur d’un marchéMaintenir et compléter des listes exactes de locataires d’immeubles commerciauxEnquêter sur des prospects de nouvelles propriétés et locatairesDocumenter et créer des profils de structures organisationnellesEXIGENCES DE BASEDiplôme post-secondaire requis8+ mois d’expérience dans un environnement de service à la clientèleMaîtrise du français et de l’anglais autant à l’oral qu’à l’écritAutorisation permanente de travailler au CanadaAucune restriction pour voyager immédiatement aux États-Unis et y entrer pour affairesQUALIFICATIONS ET APTITUDES ADDITIONNELLES SOUHAITÉESBaccalauréat complétéCapacité à tisser des liens avec les gens, rapidement et professionnellementSuccès éprouvé à performer avec des métriques et des indicateurs clés de performanceÊtre de nature curieuse et démontrer une habilité à effectuer de la recherche approfondieExpérience et compétence démontrée avec Excel pour manipuler des données, utiliser des filtres et développer des formules simples. Tous les candidats qualifiés seront soumis à une évaluation pour déterminer leur niveau de confort avec Microsoft Excel 2016Capacité à capturer des données exactesHabileté à gérer des responsabilités variables et exceller dans un environnement dynamiqueÊtre axé.e sur les résultats, compétitif.ve et motivé.e par le succèsAPERÇU DE LA COMPAGNIEFondé en 1987, CoStar Group, Inc. (Nasdaq:CSGP) est le fournisseur principal d’information en immobilier commercial, en analytique et en marchés virtuels. Afin de produire et de maintenir la plus grande et la plus complète base de données sur l’immobilier commercial, CoStar mène des activités de recherche détaillées et continues. Notre gamme de services en ligne permet à nos clients d’analyser, d’interpréter et d’acquérir une connaissance incomparable des valeurs immobilières, des conditions du marché et des disponibilités. Derrière quelques-unes des marques les plus reconnues de l’industrie, le Groupe CoStar comprend CoStar, le plus grand fournisseur de recherche en immobilier commercial et en données en temps réel; LoopNet, le marché virtuel et mobile ayant le plus de trafic de l’industrie; Apartments.com, la ressource première en location résidentielle pour les locataires, gestionnaires de propriété et les propriétaires; STR, le chef de file en étalonnage de performance et d’analytique comparative de l’industrie hôtelière; BizBuySell, le plus grand marché virtuel d’entreprises à vendre; et Lands of America, le plus grand opérateur de marchés virtuels d’immobilier rural. Ayant son siège social à Washington, DC, CoStar possède des bureaux à travers les États-Unis, en Europe, en Asie et au Canada.Avec une équipe mondiale d’environ 4,300 employés, CoStar est la plus grande organisation de recherche professionnelle de l’industrie.AVANTAGESTravailler à CoStar signifie que vous joindrez une culture de collaboration et d’innovation qui attire les meilleurs et les plus brillants candidats de plusieurs disciplines. Cependant, prière de prendre note que CoStar n’est pas en mesure de parrainer une demande de visa pour cette position.OVERVIEW CoStar Group is the world’s leading provider of information and marketing solutions for the Commercial Real Estate industry.  We are a NASDAQ listed company with a market cap of over US$30B and sit alongside other notable names such as Amazon, Facebook, Google and Apple.As a technology company, we are the trusted partner for all commercial real estate professionals empowering many of the most well-respected landlords, development companies, brokerage firms, banks, lenders, investors and government agencies.We do this by actively researching the commercial real estate markets and providing data, analytics, innovative tools and powerful marketing platforms in the U.S. and Internationally to help our clients transact with one another. job_info: Senior Software Engineer in Test - Analytics<br>Job Description<br>OVERVIEW    CoStar delivers real-time, verified commercial real estate data that helps clients confidently spot great opportunities and make smart choices ahead of competitors. By combining the power of CoStar’s independent research organization – the industry’s largest – with global data delivery, software, and application solutions, clients can act on opportunities with confidence.   The Analytics team is responsible for the development of CoStar's customer-facing Real Estate Analytics products.  We think big, creating innovative data-intensive applications that take the vast amount of data collected by our CoStar Research teams to create a fast, reliable and intuitive analytics platform for our customers.  We are a collaborative group with a mix of big data, API/platform and front-end skills, and we are growing rapidly to help invent the future of Real Estate Analytics.     We are searching for an exceptional Senior Software Engineer in Test, who can develop test automation solutions within our agile product teams. This role is critical to the quality and success of our product and includes the design, development and execution of automated tests for products we’re developing, as well as continued improvement of our testing process and architecture.      RESPONSIBILITIES    Designing, developing, executing and maintaining automated tests based on product requirements and specifications  Investigating, logging and escalating as appropriate the defects identified during automated testing Working with the development team to analyze project requirements with the goal of increasing automated test coverage  Collaborating with other Software Engineers in Test on the continual improvement of our automated testing tools and strategies  Acting as an advocate for test automation and train and support other team members as appropriate  Coordinating automated testing for releases and participate as necessary  Gaining a deep understanding of the CoStar business, including the Analytic products     BASIC QUALIFICATIONS   BS degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field  3+ years of industry experience as a Software Engineer or Software Engineer in Test  Deep experience with test automation strategies and tools, such as Test Cafe, Selenium Web Driver, MS Test, or Test Complete  Understanding of quality assurance testing methodologies and the software development life cycle  Experience with Object Oriented Programming  Fluent in SQL and relational databases, including experience testing relational database-backed applications  Familiarity with modern front end (JavaScript, React, etc.) and/or back end (C#, .NET Framework, Web API, Node) languages and application frameworks  History of partnering and collaborating with software development teams      OVERVIEW OF COMPANY:   Founded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availability. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; LoopNet, the most heavily trafficked mobile and online real estate marketplace; Apartments.com, the premier rental home resource for renters, property managers and owners; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry; BizBuySell, the largest online marketplace for businesses-for-sales; and Lands of America, the leading operator of online marketplaces for rural real estate.  Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of over 4,300 worldwide.    WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU:   Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. In addition to generous compensation and performance-based incentives, you'll be supported in both your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program.   Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to):  Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription Drug  Life, legal, and supplementary insurance  Commuter and parking benefits  401(K) retirement plan with matching contributions  Employee stock purchase plan  Paid time off  Tuition reimbursement  On-site fitness center and/or reimbursed fitness center membership costs (location dependent), with yoga studio, Peletons, personal training, group exercise classes, as well as Segways and bikes available for use during the day  Complimentary gourmet coffee, tea, hot chocolate, prepared foods, fresh fruit, and other healthy snacks  Be part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. But don't just take our word for it -- see why our team chose to work at and stay at CoStar Group: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CVbJRnJ2sX0    We welcome all qualified candidates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the United States to apply.  However, please note that CoStar is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position.  #LI-VP1<br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing
