job_info: Lead Governance, Risk, & Compliance (GRC) Engineer<br>Job Description<br>Lead Governance, Risk, & Compliance (GRC) EngineerReporting to the Manager of Cybersecurity, the Lead Compliance Engineer will be responsible to establish and maintain the Governance, Risk and Compliance program including CCPA, GDPR, PCI-DSS, SOC1, SOC2 Type II, SOX, and any additional compliance requirements CoStar encounters. The Lead Compliance Engineer will work with our internal teams and various marketplaces to help formulate, test and measure control testing procedures. Specifically, the candidate will assist in the creation, maintenance, and enhancement of risk reduction initiatives and drive report output for key security and compliance threat vectors such as infrastructure and compliance risk, third-party suppliers, security incidents, data transfers, vulnerability assessments, system entitlements, etc. In addition to construction and management of the security controls testing lifecycle, this individual will be fundamental in interpreting the data as a subject matter expert adding value to CoStar’s overall compliance testing framework. The candidate will collaborate with key partners across the organization and distill information into management and executive-level reporting. The candidate will have a strong understanding of security and compliance related risks and controls, and effectively collaborate with multiple stakeholders.In this role, the Lead Compliance Engineer will develop Policies, Standards, Security baselines, risk framework & treatment strategy, maintenance of compliance framework, as well as build & measure KRI & KPI metrics for compliance. Additionally, the Lead Compliance Engineer will execute the planning and performance of risk assessments, while working directly with the technical and business stakeholders to identify appropriate risk factors, assess the adequacy of existing controls, assist and drive remediation of control weaknesses to ensure compliance requirements are maintained.What You’ll Be Doing:Lead the IT Compliance ProgramsContribute to the development, administration and regular enhancement of CoStar’s risk-based security controlsManage and track certification and audit work as it relates to PCI-DSS, SOX, SOC1, SOC2, ISO 27001, internal audits.Maintain strong subject matter expertise through learning and engagement in external programs and conferences and relevant benchmarking to provide sound advice and guidance to business partners regarding compliance policy, processes and issue management, and in the development of team.Establish a more efficient evidence gathering and reporting processYou should resolution within and beyond scope of responsibilityImplement a GRC to manage all compliance initiatives and activities more effectivelyRESPONSIBILITIES: Assist with day-today compliance reviews (third party vendor reviews, SaaS access reviews, data mapping, data privacy requests, RFPs, etc.)Develop and update standards, policies, and procedures as well as best practices documentation in line with compliance requirementsRespond to client intake requests related to data privacy and securitySupport development of processes and procedures to strengthen the security posture of the name: Account Manager - Realla
job_info: Account Manager - Realla<br>Job Description<br>COSTAR GROUP – REALLA ACCOUNT MANAGER - LONDON OVERVIEW Realla.co.uk is the number 1 dedicated commercial property market place in the UK, connecting millions of tenants and investors with Offices, Shops, Industrial and other commercial spaces for sale and for rent.We are the fastest growing business in this exciting segment, which is currently undergoing explosive growth. Realla was started 6 years ago and acquired by CoStar Group in 2018. We retain our entrepreneurial culture, whilst being owned and supported by the world’s leader in commercial property information, analytics and marketplaces. CoStar is a $35bn market cap business with strong growth and probability and affords tremendous financial backing to fuel our growth. As an Account Manager, you will be responsible for selling subscriptions and other online advertising products to our largest and most sophisticated customers, include global property fund managers, global brokerage businesses, hedge funds and private equity firms, real estate investment trusts and family offices. This is a top end enterprise sales job and you will be responsible for customers worth 6 figures from Day 1. You will learn consultative selling skills, as well as account management techniques to grow accounts over time.RESPONSIBILITIES Achieve monthly revenue goal through closing dealsWith medium and long-term mindset, build relationships and sell to some of the largest players in UK and global real estateBuild relationships with multiple senior people within these organisations in order to advance salesBe an expert on the market backdrop and competitor behaviour so you can engage in high value conservations with clients and work towards solutions for themEducate clients on the value of the product through virtual demonstrationsYour job will be London-centric with some travel and will involve hosting and attending industry eventsThis is not a rapid-fire, small ticket sales job with instant gratification.BASIC QUALIFICATIONS Significant experience in commercial real estate in a revenue generating role e.g. broker or years of enterprise sales experience in technology, particularly web, market places / listing servicesProven track record in large ticket enterprise sales OR leading large real estate transactionsComfort with sales cycles which can run 3-12 months+Demonstrate that you have maintained and grown clients over 2+ years, providing excellent service The confidence and patience to make £50k+ proposalsOutstanding communication, presentation and objection handling skills are a givenEducated to degree levelPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS A knowledge of commercial real estate or asset management is advantageous. If not, you will have a desire to learn and a genuine interest in the trends and market backdrop – this essential to converse with top fund managers and brokers. name: Sales Associate, CoStar -  Baltimore, MD
job_info: Sales Associate, CoStar -  Baltimore, MD<br>Job Description<br>CoStar Group is the world’s leading provider of information and marketing solutions for the Commercial Real Estate industry.  We are a NASDAQ listed company with a market cap of over $30B.+As a technology company, we are the trusted partner for all commercial real estate professionals empowering many of the most well-respected landlords, development companies, brokerage firms, banks, lenders, investors and government agencies.We do this by actively researching the commercial real estate markets and providing data, analytics, innovative tools and powerful marketing platforms in the U.S. and Internationally to help our clients transact with one another. CoStar continues to win multiple awards including one of Forbes most innovative companies (2017) and Fortune’s fastest growing companies (2020). As a CoStar Sales Associate you will prospect and engage potential clients while managing, nurturing, and growing our existing client base. name: Manager, Sales Operations
job_info: Manager, Sales Operations<br>Job Description<br>The Business Analyst generates ad hoc reports and regular data sets or report information for end-users using system tools and database or data warehouse queries and scripts. name: Market Manager
job_info: Market Manager<br>Job Description<br>OVERVIEWCoStar delivers real-time, verified commercial real estate data that helps clients confidently spot great opportunities and make smart choices ahead of competitors. By combining the power of CoStar’s independent research organization – the industry’s largest – with global data delivery, software, and application solutions, clients can act on opportunities with confidence.The Marketing Research team is the heart of CoStar, capturing market-critical information that enables our commercial real estate clients to make informed, high impact business decisions daily. CoStar Group’s research contributes to the most important segment of our economy, helping businesses open offices, retail stores, warehouses, and manufacturing facilities. Costar Group is seeking a Market Manager to join our growing research organization.As a Market Manager, you will be leading a team of Researchers who are responsible for investigating and profiling companies to help owners, brokers and real estate professionals identify which companies are best suited for their buildings. CoStar Group’s research contributes to the most important segment of our economy, helping businesses open offices, stores, and warehouse and manufacturing facilities. Every day our research is helping our clients make informed investment decisions. Because of the impact our research has on the economy, CoStar Group’s benefits and salaries lead the industry.RESPONSIBILITIES Lead a team of 8 plus Client Relationship Consultants dedicated to delivering comprehensive market coverage of accurate and complete commercial real estate information to CoStar clientsFoster a strong team culture and dynamic and provide regular coaching to the development of the teamEnsure continuous delivery of timely, comprehensive, and accurate information for the assigned markets/region whilst providing CoStar clients with the highest standard of customer serviceConduct regular call evaluations, training and mentoring sessions with your team. decisionsOversee the preparation of comprehensive market reports on a quarterly basisBASIC QUALIFICATIONSExternal applicants are expected to have the following education/experience experience within commercial real estateInternal applicants are expected to have the following education/experience combination:Bachelors’ degree required coupled with 2+ years Commercial Real Estate experienceLegally able to immediately travel to and enter the United State for business purposes1+ year of Microsoft Office experienceMicrosoft Excel 2016 experience is requiredFlexibility to work developmentAbility to work as part of a teamSuccess in building strong, cohesive teams by leading and motivating towards action/execution through influence and collaborationAbility to articulate and execute corporate strategy, well-communicated with the ability to influenceExperience and demonstrated proficiency with Excel that includes the ability to manipulate data, filter, and develop basic formulasCreative problem solving, attention to detail, objectivity and the ability to think strategicallyAnalytical approach with the ability to interpret information and trends, adapting quicklyAbility to interact at all levels and establish rapport with both internal and external stakeholdersOVERVIEW OF COMPANYFounded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. name: UI/UX Designer II
job_info: UI/UX Designer II<br>Job Description<br>We are currently seeking a UX Designer to join our team in our Washington, DC headquarters. As a designer for CoStar you will collaborate with other UX designers, product managers and engineers you will discover customer needs, create design solutions and help us build our design system and design practices. This will include sketching, user research, prototyping, user testing, and mockups. RESPONSIBILITIES:Support customer research and testing (surveys, interviews, observations, data analysis, prototype testing, usability testing)Collaborate with Product to deliver design solutions using wireframes, flows, mockups, prototypes, etc.Partner with engineering to implement designs Use our emerging design system and practices. Provide feedback on how to improve itBASIC QUALIFICATIONS:Bachelor’s degree in design, certification or equivalent experienceMinimum of 1-3 years of experience with product design including mobile, human-computer interaction, usability and user interface design, and/or visual designStrong abilities in sketching, prototyping, and evaluating interaction designProficiency in design tools & prototyping tools such as Sketch and InVisionExcellent communication and interpersonal skills and the ability to interact with team members at all levels, including upper management, analysts, economists, data scientists, and sales forceStrong problem solving and critical thinking skillsExperience working in an agile environmentPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:Experience using a Design SystemExperience working on ecommerceAbility to multi-task in a fast-paced agile environmentPositive, energetic attitude and initiative, with strong work ethicEnjoy working with data, information and presentation concepts and working with other smart, data driven peopleAn interest in real estate a plusNOTE: This position requires that you present a portfolio of past projects as part of your application.OVERVIEW OF COMPANY:Founded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. name: Éditeur.trice - Writer/Editor
job_info: Éditeur.trice - Writer/Editor<br>Job Description<br>Éditeur.trice – LoopNet – QuébecAPERÇULoopNet, une division de CoStar Group, est à la recherche d’un éditeur ou d’une éditrice de contenus sur l’immobilier commercial, basé.e à Montréal.En tant qu’expert.e sur notre site, le leader du marché, LoopNet.com, vous serez responsable de la livraison de contenu, le meilleur de sa catégorie, pour desservir une audience d’investisseurs privés et individuels ainsi que de locataires-utilisateurs désireux d’en apprendre davantage sur l’immobilier commercial ou sur la location et aussi sur les concepts, les pratiques et l’information nécessaires pour réussir.La responsabilité première du poste implique la traduction d’articles publiés sur le site américain de LoopNet de l’anglais vers le français canadien.De plus, on attendra de vous que vous produisiez des articles originaux mettant l’accent sur le marché immobilier canadien. Tout article rédigé en français canadien devra aussi être traduit vers l’anglais pour publication sur le site américain de LoopNet.En tant que membre de l’équipe de contenu de LoopNet, vous devrez agir en tant que moteur d’expansion de notre bibliothèque croissante de ressources reliées à l’achat, la location et la possession d’immeubles commerciaux (ce qui inclut, sans toutefois se limiter aux immeubles à bureaux, aux immeubles de commerce de détail, aux immeubles industriels, aux hôtels et aux terrains).Il s’agit d’une excellente occasion pour un.e rédacteur.trice hautement organisé.e de se joindre à une équipe en croissance ayant pour responsabilité de livrer des ressources actionnables et des perspectives à notre grande audience de locataires et d’investisseurs situés partout en Amérique du Nord.De l’expérience en rédaction sur des sujets reliés à l’immobilier commercial est essentielle, en plus d’une connaissance de la terminologie de l’immobilier commercial et des dynamiques du marché.Le.la candidat.e choisi.e collaborera avec les équipes éditoriale et de produit de LoopNet, en plus de plusieurs parties prenantes pour exécuter la vision globale du contenu.RESPONSABILITÉS·       Prendre l’initiative en développant, créant, écrivant, traduisant et produisant du contenu en ligne original pour l’audience de LoopNet, composée de locataires et d’investisseurs en immobilier commercial.·       Traduire les articles publiés sur le site américain de LoopNet de l’anglais au français canadien.·       Traduire des articles écrits en français canadien vers l’anglais pour publication sur le site américain de LoopNet.·       Collaborer et coordonner la couverture avec des membres de l’équipe interne en plus de parties prenantes externes afin de développer des idées d’articles, de diversifier la couverture et de s’assurer de la livraison ponctuelle et de la couverture sur plusieurs marchés.·       Développer, gérer et interviewer un panel d’experts en la matière.·       Éditer et faire la correction d’articles écrits par d’autres membres de l’équipe de contenu de LoopNet, en plus de contributeurs externes.·       Solliciter et éditer des articles écrits par des contributeurs de tierces parties et par des experts pertinents.·       Être responsable de l’exactitude et de la véracité du contenu que vous écrivez et suivre les standards et l’éthique journalistiques généralement acceptés, en plus de s’engager à l’exactitude et à l’impartialité.·       Utiliser des données de trafic et sur les mots-clefs afin de dériver une meilleure compréhension de l’information à laquelle nos lecteurs sont le plus intéressés afin de diriger notre contenu et couverture futurs.EXIGENCES DE BASE·       Trois ans d’expérience en développement de contenu en ligne ou de contenu de marketing et un an d’expérience professionnelle et un diplôme d’études supérieures.·       Bilinguisme en français et en anglais, autant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit.·       Expérience d’écriture professionnelle démontrable.·       Esprit stratégique et aptitudes analytiques avec une habileté à dénicher et à développer des idées d’articles de sources internes et externes, notamment en utilisant l’information et les perspectives disponibles de par le service exclusif d’information de CoStar.·       Baccalauréat complété; diplôme d’études supérieurs un atoutQUALIFICATIONS ET APTITUDES ADDITIONNELLES SOUHAITÉES·       Être orienté.e par les résultat et être proactif.ve, avec une habileté prouvée à prioritiser, atteindre et accroître les résultats, en travaillant autant de manière indépendante qu’en collaboration avec d’autres.·       Expérience en immobilier, un atout.·       Habileté à respecter les dates de tombée.·       En plus d’avoir l’œil pour la pertinence et l’originalité de sujets, l’éditeur.trice devra avoir des standards de qualité élevés pour son travail, avec une attention supérieure pour les détails.APERÇU DE LA COMPAGNIEFondé en 1987, CoStar Group, Inc. est le fournisseur principal d’information en immobilier commercial, en analytique et en marchés virtuels. Afin de produire et de maintenir la plus grande et la plus complète base de données sur l’immobilier commercial, CoStar mène des activités de recherche détaillées et continues.Notre gamme de services en ligne permet à nos clients d’analyser, d’interpréter et d’acquérir une connaissance incomparable des valeurs immobilières, des conditions du marché et des disponibilités. Derrière quelques-unes des marques les plus reconnues de l’industrie, le Groupe CoStar comprend CoStar, le plus grand fournisseur de recherche en immobilier commercial et en données en temps réel; LoopNet, le marché virtuel et mobile ayant le plus de trafic de l’industrie; Apartments.com, la ressource première en location résidentielle pour les locataires, gestionnaires de propriété et les propriétaires; STR, le chef de file en étalonnage de performance et d’analytique comparative de l’industrie hôtelière; BizBuySell, le plus grand marché virtuel d’entreprises à vendre; et Lands of America, le plus grand opérateur de marchés virtuels d’immobilier rural.Ayant son siège social à Washington, DC, CoStar possède des bureaux à travers les États-Unis, en Europe, en Asie et au Canada. Avec une équipe mondiale d’environ 4 300 employés, CoStar est la plus grande organisation de recherche professionnelle de l’industrie.AVANTAGESTravailler à CoStar signifie que vous joindrez une culture de collaboration et d’innovation qui attire les meilleurs et les plus brillants candidats de plusieurs disciplines.En plus d’une compensation généreuse et d’incitatifs à la performance, vous serez soutenu(e) dans votre croissance académique avec de la formation interne, un programme de remboursement de frais de scolarité et un programme d’échange inter-bureaux.Nos avantages sociaux incluent notamment (cette liste n’est pas exhaustive) :·       Prestations généreuses pour soins de santé étendus (hospitalisation, médicaments, vision et couverture internationale) et soins dentaires·       Assurances (vie, juridique et additionnelle)·       Remboursement des dépenses reliées au transport en commun·       Régime enregistré d’épargne-retraite (REER) avec contributions avec cotisations égales de la compagnie·       Programmes de vacances payées·       Remboursement de frais de scolarité·       Abonnement à rabais à un centre de conditionnement physique et des cours d’exercice de groupe·       Café gourmet, thé, chocolat chaud, fruits frais et autres collations santé offerts gratuitementFaites partie d’une équipe de professionnels qui apprécient l’opportunité d’apprendre, d’agir et de croître dans une atmosphère gratifiante.Mais ne nous croyez pas sur parole – voyez par vous-mêmes pourquoi note équipe a choisi de travailler et de rester chez CoStar :https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CVbJRnJ2sX0Nous encourageons tous les candidats qualifiés qui sont éligibles à travailler au Canada à appliquer.Cependant, prière de prendre note que CoStar n’est pas en mesure de parrainer une demande de visa pour cette position.Job Description SummaryWrites, reports, translates, solicits, edits and enhances content published on LoopNet. Adheres to established tone and style requirements. Interfaces with product managers, graphic designers and other stakeholders to augment the LoopNet user experience as it relates to content. Seeks to add dimensions to LoopNet content and develop new and innovative content opportunities. Takes the lead in translating articles written in English to Canadian French, as well as translating Canadian French articles to English.JustificationTypically requires a minimum of three years of related writing experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or one year and a Master’s degree.Writer/Editor – LoopNet – Quebec OVERVIEW LoopNet, a division of the CoStar Group, is seeking an Editor, Commercial Real Estate based in Quebec. As a commercial real estate subject-matter expert for the market-leading website, LoopNet.com, you will be responsible for delivering best-in-class content to serve our audience of private, individual investors and tenants/users seeking to learn about commercial real estate investing or leasing and the concepts, practices and information they need to be successful.The primary responsibility of this position involves translating articles published on LoopNet’s U.S. site from English to Canadian French. In addition, you will be expected to produce original articles focused on the Canadian real estate market. Any articles authored in Canadian French will also need to be translated into English for publication on LoopNet’s U.S. site.As a member of LoopNet’s content team, you will help drive the expansion of our growing library of resources relating to buying, leasing and owning commercial real estate (including, but not limited to, office, multifamily, retail, industrial, hospitality and land).This is a great opportunity for a highly organized, proactive writer to join a growing team tasked with delivering actionable resources and insights for our large audience of tenants and investors throughout North America. Previous experience writing about topics relating to commercial real estate is essential, as well as knowledge of real estate terminology and market dynamics.The successful candidate will collaborate with LoopNet’s editorial and product teams, as well as other business stakeholders, to execute on the overall content vision.RESPONSIBILITIES  Take the lead in developing, creating, writing translating and producing original online content for LoopNet’s audience of commercial real estate tenants and investors.Translate articles published on LoopNet’s U.S. site from English to Canadian French.Translate articles authored in Canadian French to English for publication on LoopNet’s U.S. site.Collaborate and coordinate coverage with internal team members as well as external stakeholders to develop story ideas, diversify coverage and ensure timely delivery and coverage across markets.Develop, manage and interview a bench of other subject-matter experts.Edit and copyedit articles authored by other members of the LoopNet Content Team, as well as outside contributors.Solicit and edit articles authored by third-party contributors and relevant subject-matter experts.Be responsible for the accuracy and veracity of the content you write and follow generally accepted journalism ethics and standards, including a commitment to accuracy and impartiality.Use traffic and keyword data to gain a better understanding of the information in which our readers are most interested to help shape future content coverage.BASIC QUALIFICATIONSThree years’ experience in developing written online or marketing content or one year of professional experience and an advanced degree.Bilingual in English and Canadian French for both oral and written communications.  Demonstrable professional writing experience.Strategic mindset and analytical skills with ability to source and develop story ideas from internal and external data sources, including leveraging information and insights available via CoStar’s proprietary information service.Bachelor’s degree or higher required.PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLSResults oriented and proactive, with proven ability to prioritize, drive and achieve results working both independently and collaborating with others.Real estate industry experience is preferred.Ability to meet deadlines.In addition to having a sharp eye for topical relevancy and originality, the editor should have high standards for her/his work product, with superior attention to detail and accuracy.OVERVIEW OF COMPANY:Founded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availability. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; LoopNet, the most heavily trafficked mobile and online real estate marketplace; Apartments.com, the premier rental home resource for renters, property managers and owners; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry; BizBuySell, the largest online marketplace for businesses-for-sales; and Lands of America, the leading operator of online marketplaces for rural real estate.Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of over 4,300 worldwide.WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. In addition to generous compensation and performance-based incentives, you'll be supported in both your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program.Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to):Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription DrugLife, legal, and supplementary insuranceCommuter benefitsRRSP with matching contributionsPaid time offTuition reimbursementDiscounted fitness center membership costs (location dependent), and group exercise classes.Complimentary gourmet coffee, tea, hot chocolate, prepared foods, fresh fruit, and other healthy snacksBe part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. But don't just take our word for it -- see why our team chose to work at and stay at CoStar Group: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CVbJRnJ2sX0We welcome all qualified candidates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the United States to apply.  However, please note that CoStar is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position<br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

name: Junior HR, Business Partner
job_info: Junior HR, Business Partner<br>Job Description<br>OVERVIEWCoStar Group is the world’s leading provider of information and marketing solutions for the Commercial Real Estate industry.  We are searching for a Junior HR Business Partner to support teams across Business For Sale, Lands, CoStar and LoopNet. The primary objective of this role is to support and coordinate essential HR functions.  Areas of oversight and job focus will include administration of HR programs, data and analytics, and employee relations. In this role, he/she will be tasked with working on all facets of HR and people strategies that align with business objectives and goals and provide a unique and dynamic employee experience. RESPONSIBILITIES:Support and execute full lifecycle employee and HR processes including bonus program(s), promotions, performance review processes, year-end compensation, engagement survey roll-out, manager excellence, exits and other recurring people processes.Possess a keen understanding of the overarching strategy of the business with the ability to counsel leaders to enable growth of the business, drive retention and develop career strategies of our peopleAnalyze data and effectively organize and present findings to drive data-backed HR strategy. Draw analysis-based conclusions and collaborate on innovative solutions.  Predict, assess, and determine business needs in the areas of organizational design, staffing, performance management, succession planning, development, and communication plansDemonstrate a commitment to diversity and inclusionMonitor and resolve morale issues and leadership effectiveness that leads to the successful achievement of business goals and employee satisfactionPartner with other HR functions to identify, evaluate and drive forward key training and development courses that hone strong talent at all levels of the organization. Contribute to the strategy and development of a best-in-class HR organizationDevelop enhanced people related communication strategies that drive engagementParticipate in special projects to ensure effective delivery of HR initiatives and services.BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:Bachelor’s degree in relevant field requiredMinimum of 2 years HR experience required, Generalist/HRBP experience preferredExcellent data analysis, critical thinking, and problem-solving skillsStrong presentation, verbal and written communication skillsProficiency in excel and Office suite requiredExperience producing results in a dynamic and fast-paced environmentBasic understanding of California employment lawsExperience in California Leave AdministrationPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:Experience working within the Workday HRIS platformDemonstrated ability to succeed in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with multiple stakeholdersSelf-directed and able to balance multiple time-sensitive deliverables and effectively prioritize, organize, and manage time.Proactive and results-oriented with strong attention to detail and excellent follow throughCommitment to excellence and high level of integrity; ability to exercise strict confidentiality and sound judgementStrong client-service focus and ability to build and manage relationships across different levels and functionsOVERVIEW OF COMPANY:Founded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availability. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; LoopNet, the most heavily trafficked mobile and online real estate marketplace; Apartments.com, the premier rental home resource for renters, property managers and owners; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry; BizBuySell, the largest online marketplace for businesses-for-sales; and Lands of America, the leading operator of online marketplaces for rural real estate.Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of over 4,300 worldwide.WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU:Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. name: Client Relationship Consultant
job_info: Client Relationship Consultant<br>Job Description<br>CLIENT RELATIONSHIP CONSULTANT - LONDON - £40,000p.a.OVERVIEW CoStar delivers real-time, verified commercial real estate data that helps clients confidently spot great opportunities and make smart choices ahead of competitors. By combining the power of CoStar’s independent research organization – the industry’s largest – with global data delivery, software, and application solutions, clients can act on opportunities with confidence.Research is the heart of CoStar, capturing market-critical information that enables our commercial real estate clients to make informed, high impact business decisions daily. CoStar Group’s research contributes to the most important segment of our economy, helping businesses open offices, retail stores, warehouses, and manufacturing facilities. CoStar Group is seeking a Client Relationship Consultant to join our growing research organization.As a Client Relationship Consultant, you will be responsible for ensuring clients maximize CoStar Group’s marketing and information products – from helping brokers and owners increase the exposure of their listings on Realla, to training new clients to run effective searches in CoStar.  Through these interactions, you will curate their listings, ensuring they are getting the most visibility on our platform.  In addition, you will capture market-critical information that enables our clients to make informed high impact business decisions.  Paramount to a Client Relationship Consultants success will be delivering exceptional customer support and ensuring we maintain and procure high-quality data.RESPONSIBILITIES Contribute to the growth of an accurate and complete database of commercial real estate inventoryConduct daily inbound and outbound phone calls with brokers, developers, investors, and other real estate professionals to obtain real-time property and transaction dataInvestigate new space listings, recent sale and lease transactions, building ownership and construction in a marketMonitor client usage and engage clients to use CoStar products in new and effective waysBuild and maintain mutually beneficial relationships with clientsAct as a first point of contact for new clients and support early adoption of the productProvide on-going training and support to clients to increase product use and knowledgePartner with our clients to help them position and market their properties on the CoStar platform for the market/audiencePartner closely with CoStar sales organization to effectively on-board and resolve client inquiriesProvide exceptional service to all clients with a heavy emphasis on personal attentionBASIC QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCEBachelors’ degreeEight or more months of experience in a customer service environmentExcellent communication skills, ability to deal with people at all levels of seniority.Demonstrate a strong interest in the commercial real estate industry.Experience and demonstrated proficiency with Excel that includes the ability to manipulate data, filter and develop basic formulasPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONSNatural curiosity, persistence, and ability to conduct thorough investigative researchProven success performing to metrics or key performance indicators (KPI)Experience communicating with internal business partners and external clients by phoneBe goal-oriented and manage multiple responsibilities, adjust to changing priorities, and excel in a fast-paced environmentAbility to develop and grow client relationships by conducting effective interviews with commercial real estate professionals, resulting in database updatesCustomer-focused approach to tasks, including a  drive towards partnering with clientsAbility to work within a team environment as well as an individual contributorDemonstrated knowledge of and/or experience within the commercial real estate industryExperience and demonstrated proficiency with Excel that includes the ability to manipulate data, filter, and develop basic formulasCapability to accurately capture and enter dataAbility to be flexible and adapt to changing situations at a high growth companyWHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. As well as having an outstanding working environment based in the Shard, other perks include full private medical cover and member rewards, 25 days annual leave, a competitive pension, season ticket loans, birthday lunches and much more! name: Sales Associate, Costar - New York, NY
job_info: Sales Associate, Costar - New York, NY<br>Job Description<br>CoStar Group is the world’s leading provider of information and marketing solutions for the Commercial Real Estate industry.  We are a NASDAQ listed company with a market cap of over $30B.+As a technology company, we are the trusted partner for all commercial real estate professionals empowering many of the most well-respected landlords, development companies, brokerage firms, banks, lenders, investors and government agencies.We do this by actively researching the commercial real estate markets and providing data, analytics, innovative tools and powerful marketing platforms in the U.S. and Internationally to help our clients transact with one another. CoStar continues to win multiple awards including one of Forbes most innovative companies (2017) and Fortune’s fastest growing companies (2020). As a CoStar Sales Associate you will prospect and engage potential clients while managing, nurturing, and growing our existing client base. Promoting both CoStar and LoopNet products, you will have the opportunity to take an entrepreneurial approach to sell, train, and retain your book of business.  You will receive a first class onboarding and training experience where you will learn how the different players in Commercial Real Estate operate, what is important to them and what solutions we have that meet their needs. You will have your own book of business, an endless supply of well qualified leads to develop, excellent products to sell, an excellent career development path.  RESPONSIBILITIES•    Gain a thorough understanding of your clients and their needs•    Become an expert in CoStar’s critical information and marketing solutions including LoopNet, the leading online commercial real estate marketplace•    Complete ownership of the full sales cycle including: prospecting, demoing, closing, onboarding, training and renewing•    Conduct a high level of in person client and prospect product demonstrations•    Provide valuable insight to all participants in the commercial property market, including Brokers, Owners, Investors, Lenders, Appraisers and Service Providers•    Represent CoStar by hosting and attending industry events and networking with commercial real estate professionals in your marketBASIC QUALIFICATIONS•    Bachelor’s degree required•    Client facing experience in the Commercial Real Estate industry strongly preferred•    Two or more years of successful outside sales experience in a B2B environment selling data, research and analytic platforms or tools, commercial real estate, financial services or business intelligence. •    Proven track record exceeding sales targets and quotas in a consultative sales environment•    Two or more years of experience training clients on how to use a solution post sale•    Ability to travel within market for client meetings.  Employees who drive themselves for this purpose must have a current and valid driver’s license (or the ability to obtain a driver’s license prior to start date).OUR BEST PERFORMERS ARE•    Passionate, hard-working and ambitious – As an innovator, we are fast paced and creative and expect our Sales Associates to move quickly to seize opportunity.•    Fast to learn new concepts and apply them - CoStar clients and prospects are diverse and demanding. With a constantly evolving suite of products, successful Sales Associates are skilled at introducing them to their clients.•    Curious - Our best salespeople ask intelligent questions, demonstrate strong listening skills and learn from customers and colleagues•    Excellent communicators - our broad-ranging solutions require clear, concise communication tailored to the relevant audience.•    Committed to Customer Service – Successful Sales Associate’s at CoStar provide valuable insights and take ownership of their client’s requests, managing them to a successful outcome.WHY COSTAR?•    The industry leader with an energetic and fast paced dynamic culture•    Innovative technology and a reputation for outstanding products•    95% customer renewal rate •    Consistent 20%+ average of year over year growth •    Outstanding sales and product training programs•    Excellent career growth opportunities•    High compensation with uncapped commissions and an outstanding annual Presidents Club trip •    Exceptional benefit plan including an employee discounted stock purchase planBe part of a team of sales professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. But don't just take our word for it -- see why our team chose to work at and stay at CoStar Group: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CVbJRnJ2sX0We welcome all qualified candidates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the United States to apply.  However, please note that CoStar is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this positionPlease note:CoStar Group seeks information for job applications from candidates in the U.S. through only the following channels:•    The CoStar Group website and RecruitiFi. •    Via email to/from addresses using only the CoStar domain of “@Costar.com.” •    Screening and interaction by telephone and through the Microsoft Teams or Zoom platforms.Be aware that:•    CoStar does not use Wire, Google Hangouts, or any other platform for any recruitment-related activities.•    Disregard any solicitation or request for information related to job applications with CoStar via any other means and/or using email addresses with any other domain.•    CoStar will never ask candidates to make any type of personal financial investment related to gaining employment with the company.If you have any questions about CoStar Group and the application process, please contact us at recruiting@costar.com. <br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

name: Cloud Architect
job_info: Cloud Architect<br>Job Description<br>CoStar Group is the world’s leading provider of information and marketing solutions for the Commercial Real Estate industry.  We are a NASDAQ listed company with a market cap of over US$30B and sit alongside other notable names such as Amazon, Facebook, Google and Apple.CoStar Real Estate Manager, a division of CoStar Group, provides cloud-based lease accounting and lease administration applications to the commercial real estate industry. CoStar Real Estate Manager helps corporations, retailers, landlords, and commercial real estate service providers build world-class real estate operations by providing integrated solutions that eliminate information "silos" and consolidate information across business units.The Cloud Architect will provide technical leadership and architectural guidance for CoStar Real Estate Manager’s migration to the cloud. They will create the roadmap and designs to migrate the existing technology stack to the cloud and architect new features to be cloud native where applicable. The ideal candidate will have a successful track record of migrating on-prem infrastructure as well as building new services in the cloud. The Cloud Architect will visualize the evolution of the current state to the future state and create a detailed plan of execution. RESPONSIBILITIESResponsible for design and planning the migration of Real Estate Manager product to AWSLead brainstorming and design sessions to identify the order and scale of the migration effortCreate the technical roadmap to migrate from on-prem infrastructure to AWSAnalyze current stack, services, and IT tools to bake into the overall migration strategyAnalyze the existing technology landscape including DevOps and IT toolset and recommend cloud solutions for the sameCreate system architecture and design documents to illustrate current and future stateCollaborate with IT, Application Development, and Product Management to present architecture options and solicit buy-in on next stepsArchitect solutions to build new objectives by sourcing, assessing and on-boarding top talent.  Additionally, you will be responsible for developing relationships with external professionals for future talent pipelines.  Senior recruiters will operate as a partner for hiring managers and will consult with HR Business Partners and the Learning and Development team to ensure effective on-boarding to maximize new hires and grow talent networks. BASIC QUALIFICATIONSBachelor degree required At least 3+ years of experience in either a corporate or agency recruiting environment (a mix of both is preferred)You have name: Senior Editing and Writing Professional
job_info: Senior Editing and Writing Professional<br>Job Description<br>Senior Editing & Writing Professional – LoopNet – Washington, DCOVERVIEW LoopNet, a division of the CoStar Group, is seeking an Editor, Commercial Real Estate to work at its Washington, D.C. headquarters. Previous experience writing about topics relating to commercial real estate is essential, as well as knowledge of real estate terminology and market dynamics.The successful candidate will collaborate with LoopNet’s editorial and product teams, as well as other business stakeholders, to execute on the overall content vision.RESPONSIBILITIES  Take the lead in developing, creating, writing and producing original online educational content for LoopNet’s audience of commercial real estate tenants and investors.Collaborate and coordinate coverage with internal team members as well as external stakeholders to develop story ideas, diversify coverage and ensure timely delivery and coverage across markets.Develop, manage and interview a bench of other subject-matter experts.Edit and copyedit articles authored by other members of the LoopNet Content Team, as well as outside contributors.Solicit and edit articles authored by third-party contributors and relevant subject-matter experts.Be responsible for the accuracy and veracity of the content you write and follow generally accepted journalism ethics and standards, including a commitment to accuracy and impartiality.Use traffic and keyword data to gain a better understanding of the information in which our readers are most interested to help shape future content coverage.BASIC QUALIFICATIONSMinimum three years’ experience in Our Data, Research and News helps our clients to make informed investment decisions. name: Sales Associate, CoStar - Brooklyn, NY
job_info: Sales Associate, CoStar - Brooklyn, NY<br>Job Description<br>CoStar Group is the world’s leading provider of information and marketing solutions for the Commercial Real Estate industry.  We are a NASDAQ listed company with a market cap of over $30B.+As a technology company, we are the trusted partner for all commercial real estate professionals empowering many of the most well-respected landlords, development companies, brokerage firms, banks, lenders, investors and government agencies.We do this by actively researching the commercial real estate markets and providing data, analytics, innovative tools and powerful marketing platforms in the U.S. and Internationally to help our clients transact with one another. CoStar continues to win multiple awards including one of Forbes most innovative companies (2017) and Fortune’s fastest growing companies (2020). As a CoStar Sales Associate you will prospect and engage potential clients while managing, nurturing, and growing our existing client base. Promoting both CoStar and LoopNet products, you will have the opportunity to take an entrepreneurial approach to sell, train, and retain your book of business.  You will receive a first class onboarding and training experience where you will learn how the different players in Commercial Real Estate operate, what is important to them and what solutions we have that meet their needs. You will have your own book of business, an endless supply of well qualified leads to develop, excellent products to sell, an excellent career development path.  RESPONSIBILITIES•    Gain a thorough understanding of your clients and their needs•    Become an expert in CoStar’s critical information and marketing solutions including LoopNet, the leading online commercial real estate marketplace•    Complete ownership of the full sales cycle including: prospecting, demoing, closing, onboarding, training and renewing•    Conduct a high level of in person client and prospect product demonstrations•    Provide valuable insight to all participants in the commercial property market, including Brokers, Owners, Investors, Lenders, Appraisers and Service Providers•    Represent CoStar by hosting and attending industry events and networking with commercial real estate professionals in your marketBASIC QUALIFICATIONS•    Bachelor’s degree required•    Client facing experience in the Commercial Real Estate industry strongly preferred•    Two or more years of successful outside sales experience in a B2B environment selling Data, Research and Analytic platforms or tools, commercial real estate, financial services, business intelligence, marketing or information providers. •    Proven track record exceeding sales targets and quotas in a consultative sales environment•    Two or more years of experience training clients on how to use a solution post saleOUR BEST PERFORMERS ARE•    Passionate, hard-working and ambitious – As an innovator, we are fast paced and creative and expect our Sales Associates to move quickly to seize opportunity.•    Fast to learn new concepts and apply them - CoStar clients and prospects are diverse and demanding. With a constantly evolving suite of products, successful Sales Associates are skilled at introducing them to their clients.•    Curious - Our best salespeople ask intelligent questions, demonstrate strong listening skills and learn from customers and colleagues•    Excellent communicators - our broad-ranging solutions require clear, concise communication tailored to the relevant audience.•    Committed to Customer Service – Successful Sales Associate’s at CoStar provide valuable insights and take ownership of their client’s requests, managing them to a successful outcome.WHY COSTAR?•    The industry leader with an energetic and fast paced dynamic culture•    Innovative technology and a reputation for outstanding products•    95% customer renewal rate •    Consistent 20%+ average of year over year growth •    Outstanding sales and product training programs•    Excellent career growth opportunities•    High compensation with uncapped commissions and an outstanding annual Presidents Club trip •    Exceptional benefit plan including an employee discounted stock purchase planBe part of a team of sales professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. name: Site Reliability Engineer (SRE)
job_info: Site Reliability Engineer (SRE)<br>Job Description<br>OVERVIEW  CoStar Group is the world’s leading provider of information and marketing solutions for the Commercial Real Estate industry. We are a NASDAQ-listed company with a market cap of over US$30B and sit alongside other notable names such as Amazon, Facebook, Google, and Apple.As a technology company, we are the trusted partner for all commercial real estate professionals empowering many of the most well-respected landlords, development companies, brokerage firms, banks, lenders, investors, and government agencies.We do this by actively researching the commercial real estate markets and providing data, analytics, innovative tools, and powerful marketing platforms in the U.S. and Internationally to help our clients transact with one another. CoStar continues to win multiple awards including one of Forbes most innovative companies (2017) and Fortune’s fastest-growing companies (2018).LoopNet.com is the leading and most heavily trafficked online commercial real estate (CRE) marketplace listing website in U.S., with over 10 million monthly unique visitors, 70 million monthly property searches and 1 million Detail Page views per day.  A CoStar Group subsidiary, LoopNet marketplace includes LoopNet.com, Ten-X.com, CityFeet.com, Showcase.com, Realla.co.uk, and bellbex.comhttps://www.loopnet.com/solutions/A Site Reliability Engineer is responsible for improving the availability, performance, capacity, latency, and efficiency of the application through software engineering best practices.Your job is to make sure everything that goes into production is awesome. You will help set coding standards, perform code review, coach other team members on how to develop high-performing software, and spend time writing great code to solve complex problems. You will help with system design, architectural diagrams, and management of service dependencies. You will own the monitoring and logging systems and be responsible for the data recovery process and high availability mechanisms. You will have access to operational and analysis tools to help detect bottlenecks and performance issues throughout the enterprise.Site Reliability Engineers are involved in all aspects of the software development life cycle: Conceptual Design, Development, Testing, Deployment, and Production Ops. We have a flat hierarchy, and we spend much of our time writing code. We love agile, continuous integration, and continuous deployment.Our effectiveness will be measured as a function of mean time to recover (MTTR) and mean time to failure (MTTF). In other words, we must have our services up and running again as quickly as possible, and we must avoid any subsequent failure for as long as possible.ResponsibilitiesScale our infrastructure (on-premise & in the cloud) to support our growing ecosystemImprove system performance, reliability, and maintainabilityAdhere to industry standard security best practicesWrite automation, monitoring, diagnostic, and debugging toolsMinimum qualifications3 or more years of experience with some combination of .NET (Framework & Core), node.js, JavaScript/TypeScript.3 or more years of experience developing a high-performance web-based system.Ability to debug, profile, optimize code, and to automate routine tasks.Candidate must be self-motivated, systematic problem-solving, great communicator, have a sense of ownership and drive.Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or comparable experience in a related technical field.Preferred qualificationsExpertise in designing, analyzing, troubleshooting, and capacity planning large-scale distributed systems.Experience with the following: React/Angular, Node.js, SQL (any RDBS), Bash, PowerShell, TFS/Azure DevOps, & Git.Experience with operating systems (e.g., Windows/Linux Distros/Debian/Kali), administration (e.g., filesystems, system rpc calls, etc) and networking (e.g., TCP/IP, routing, network topologies and hardware, etc.).Experience in one or more of the following: AWS, GCP, Python, Serverless, Docker, Container Orchestration (ie Kubernetes).System load testing and baseline measurement.Nice-to-have qualificationsFamiliar with log management and analytics tools: OpenTelemetry, Jaeger, Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, Grafana, Prometheus, DataDog, SplunkWHATS IN IT FOR YOU:Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. name: Data Scientist - Marketing
job_info: Data Scientist - Marketing<br>Job Description<br>Data Scientist - Marketing Position Overview: As a Data Scientist on our analytics and data science team, you will leverage your deep experience in data analysis and machine learning to support our marketing organization in measuring and increasing the marketing effectiveness for the Apartments.com Network of rental brands including Apartments.com, ApartmentFinder.com, ApartmentHomeLiving.com, Apartamentos.com, WestsideRentals.com, ForRent.com, After55.com, ForRentUniversity.com, CorporateHousing.com and Cozy.co.We are counting on you to bring a genuine curiosity about how consumers search for information, and pair that with a strong technical aptitude and ability to analyze large datasets, uncover trends and insights, then turn those findings into actionable recommendations.You’ll be joining a best-in-class team that has relentlessly high standards, is never satisfied with the status quo, and thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Our industry-leading team is the driving force for our business and has exceeded our performance goals each year. Responsibilities:Evaluate the impact of our marketing campaigns across different channels and measure the end-to-end marketing funnel performance; Use Marketing mix modeling to optimize the marketing budgetPerform various exploratory data analysis on the clickstream data to understand customer behavior and uncover new insights and trends and develop strategies.Build propensity models for new customer acquisition, customer upgrade/downgrade and customer retention.Blend first, second- and third-party data for customer segmentation to identify customer personas and target the right audience for our marketing campaigns.Understanding business objectives and developing analytical solutions that help achieve them, along with metrics to track their progress.Leveraging generative approaches to understand user behavior and metrics of interest.Analyzing data and developing predictive models using machine learning and deep learning.Collaborate cross-functionally across internal teams (marketing, product, technology, research, etc.) to evaluate opportunities that deliver business goals via data analysis and machine learning.Develop and promote a data driven approach by proactively identifying new potential analysis projects and highlight key opportunities to drive our organization forward.Share results and conclusions you draw to derive meaning from the data, and what business actions you think should be taken as a result of the analysis.Identify learnings from your analysis for how we can improve the collection and upkeep of our datasets.Enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems.Coordinate across departments and with our analytics providers to establish best practices and adhere to common design patterns, and work through your plans with others to troubleshoot potential issues upfront.Act as a role model throughout our team, but also our organization by maintaining the highest professional standards, promoting data governance, data management, creative thinking and pushing us to always be our best.Skills and Qualifications:Master's Degree required in Computer Science, Business Analytics, Data Analytics, or Data Science, Machine Learning, or related field. Or Bachelor's Degree with 2+ years of professional work experience in data analysis and machine learning.Strong experience with communicating technical findings to relevant stakeholders and providing applicable business insights and recommendations.2 -3 years of experience working with marketing organizations, measuring marketing effectiveness and marketing optimization.Proficient in SQL, writing queries, and reporting.Excellent scripting and programming skills with Python, R, etc. with hands-on experience.Proficiency with Python-based common data science toolkits such as Jupyter Notebooks, Numpy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, MatplotLib, Seaborn, NLTK, etc.Ability to write clean, reproducible, robust, and scalable analysis code.Good applied statistics skills, such as distribution analysis, probability theory, statistical testing, regression, etc.Expertise in running exploratory data analysis, statistical modeling and data mining.Experience with designing and analyzing experiments (A/B tests and Multivariate tests).Excellent understanding of supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as Clustering, Topic Modeling, K-Means, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Neural Networks, Market Mix Modeling etc.Experience with data visualization tools, such as PowerBI and Tableau.Ability to run automated jobs to manipulate and store data from APIs and various cloud providers.Hands-on experience working with large data sets.Preferred Qualifications:Working experience with a deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or Keras.Understanding of special deep learning networks such as Convolutional Neural Networks, for computer vision.Experience developing recommendation engines using different techniques like collaborative filtering, content-based filtering, deep learning-based approaches, etc.Understanding of statistical decision theory.Join the CoStar TeamJoin the team that creates CoStar’s winning technology. If you’re a data scientist, you have an incredible opportunity at CoStar – named one of Forbes’ Most Innovative Growth Companies for four consecutive years. We’re always looking for talent to help build the tools and analytics that harvest our big data and power our research operations and shape the marketplaces that serve tens of millions of people each month. Our culture of innovation and excellence attracts and encourages the best and brightest in a broad range of disciplines, which makes CoStar a fun and supportive place to work.Company Overview:CoStar Group, Inc. (NASDAQ: CSGP) is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics and online marketplaces. Founded in 1987, CoStar conducts expansive, ongoing research to produce and maintain the largest and most comprehensive database of commercial real estate information. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availabilities. LoopNet is the most heavily trafficked commercial real estate marketplace online with approximately 5 million monthly unique visitors per month. Realla is the UK's most comprehensive commercial property digital marketplace. Apartments.com, ApartmentFinder.com, ForRent.com, ApartmentHomeLiving.com, Westside Rentals, AFTER55.com, CorporateHousing.com, ForRentUniversity.com, Cozy and Apartamentos.com form the premier online apartment resource for renters seeking great apartment homes and provide property managers and owners a proven platform for marketing their properties. CoStar Group's websites attracted an average of approximately 50 million unique monthly visitors in aggregate in the third quarter of 2018. Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe and Canada with a staff of over 3,600 worldwide, including the industry's largest professional research organization.<br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

By combining the power of CoStar’s independent research organization – the industry’s largest – with global data delivery, software, and application solutions, clients can act on opportunities with confidence.The Research team is the heart of CoStar, capturing market-critical information that enables our commercial real estate clients to make informed, high impact business decisions daily. CoStar Group’s research contributes to the most important segment of our economy, helping businesses open offices, retail stores, warehouses, and manufacturing facilities. CoStar Group is seeking an Architectural Photographer to join our growing research organization.As the Architectural Photographer Manager, you will lead, develop, and motivate a team of Architectural Photographers in their region. CoStar Architectural Photographers provide high-quality photography, drone video & images, 3D virtual tours, and walk-through videos on high-visibility commercial and multi-family properties. CoStar Group customers rely on our team to visually complete the marketing vision of their assets.RESPONSIBILITIES Train, mentor, and coach a growing team of 10+ professional, staff Architectural Photographers.Source and hire experienced, full-time team members in key geographies.Spend quality time with local and regional team members to demonstrate best practice with media collection, postproduction, process optimization, and customer service.Review incoming media to determine its quality relative to standards and guidelines.Provide constructive and actionable feedback to team members to meet both production and quality expectations.Professional and effective communication with clients and internal partners during all aspects of the media shoot including scheduling, set up and on site.Continued learning and development of your craft, including staying up to date on new techniques and technology.BASIC QUALIFICATIONSBachelor’s degree with 2+ years’ experience managing a team of photographersExperience capturing real estate or architectural photos and videosExperience with Adobe Creative Suite, IE: Photoshop, Lightroom, Premiere Pro, or similarPREFERRED QUALIFCATIONS AND SKILLS Be knowledgeable of MAC OS and MS OfficeExperience as a drone photographer with a FAA Part 107 License/CertificationExperience developing strong personal relationships with key contacts at assigned companiesExperience managing multiple responsibilities and changing priorities in a fast-paced environment without missing deadlinesOVERVIEW OF COMPANY:Founded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availability. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; LoopNet, the most heavily trafficked mobile and online real estate marketplace; Apartments.com, the premier rental home resource for renters, property managers and owners; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry; BizBuySell, the largest online marketplace for businesses-for-sales; and Lands of America, the leading operator of online marketplaces for rural real estate.Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of over 4,300 worldwide.WHATS IN IT FOR YOU:Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. In addition to generous compensation and performance-based incentives, you'll be supported in both your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program.Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to):Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription DrugLife, legal, and supplementary insuranceCommuter and parking benefits401(K) retirement plan with matching contributionsEmployee stock purchase planPaid time offTuition reimbursementBe part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. But don't just take our word for it -- see why our team chose to work at and stay at CoStar Group: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CVbJRnJ2sX0#LI-TS4<br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

name: Account Manager Sales (m/f/d) - THOMAS DAILY – Sales - Munich, Germany
job_info: Account Manager Sales (m/f/d) - THOMAS DAILY – Sales - Munich, Germany<br>Job Description<br>THOMAS DAILYHas been Germany's leading information provider in the commercial property sector for almost 30 years. Our information helps our customers to make well-founded decisions and ultimately to conclude successful transactions. Our clients include investors, asset managers, brokers, banks, project developers, valuers and consultants. For us as a team, customer service and product quality, combined with absolute integrity, are at the top of our list of values. As a member of the CoStar Group, we are part of a globally active information service provider.As Account Manager Sales (m/f/d) with THOMAS DAILY, your challenge will be to attract new customers and retain them over the long term through good relationship management.RESPONSABILITIESSupport of existing customers and acquisition of new customersEstablishing and maintaining long-term customer relationshipsAddressing leads at decision-maker levelImplementation of on-site and online demosPreparation of offers, negotiation of contractsRepresentative at fairs and eventsBuilding a networkContinuous analysis of the market situationServices & Advisory FunctionBASIC QUALIFICATIONSUniversity degree or equivalent qualificationSeveral years of experience in sales of products requiring explanation and/or experience in the real estate industryVery good written and spoken German at least at B2/C1 level and good written and spoken EnglishPREFERED QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS  You understand the needs of different market participants and can assess their strategies and goalsIndependent and organized working methodReadiness to travelProfessional and cultivated appearanceLast but not least: Joy of sale!OVERVIEWCoStar GroupCommercial real estate is one of the most important economic sectors. They are among the largest asset classes and almost everyone enters a commercial property every day to work, shop or for entertainment. The CoStar Group exists to provide information and insight to real estate professionals. We enthusiastically share our passion for comprehensive, objective and reliable information. In 2016, the Forbes list of the world's most innovative companies ranked CoStar Group eleventh worldwide.  In Great Britain, the CoStar Group is on a successful growth path. We have achieved a leading position since the launch of our revolutionary product CoStar Suite. We are a team of dedicated and enthusiastic people who have put customer service and product quality, combined with absolute integrity, at the top of our value list. Our customer-focused approach provides great technology for accessing the UK's largest database, commercial buildings and transactions, supported by powerful online analysis tools.WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?When you work for the CoStar Group (THOMAS DAILY brand in Germany), you enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and the brightest. In addition to competitive compensation and performance-based incentives, you will be supported in both your professional and academic development through internal training, tuition reimbursement and a cross-office exchange program. Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to)Modern offices in prime locationsFlexible working hoursFor the moments in between good coffee and fresh fruitHansefit MembershipCONTACTIf you would like to be part of an ambitious and dynamic team and value commitment and team spirit, we look forward to receiving your written application, stating your earliest possible starting date and salary expectations via: https://costar.wd1.myworkdayjobs.com/CoStarCareersEuropeMORE ABOUT WORKING AT COSTAR GROUP/ THOMAS DAILYhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BIvrahhLnPE&list=PL43vHDPAraDYtiqxOKcR17otBDudiYDPy&index=18&t=0s<br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

name: Sales Executive, CoStar - Inland Empire, CA
job_info: Sales Executive, CoStar - Inland Empire, CA<br>Job Description<br>CoStar Group is the world’s leading provider of information and marketing solutions for the Commercial Real Estate industry.  We are a NASDAQ listed company with a market cap of over $30B+.As a technology company, we are the trusted partner for all commercial real estate professionals empowering many of the most well-respected landlords, development companies, brokerage firms, banks, lenders, investors and government agencies.We do this by actively researching the commercial real estate markets and providing data, analytics, innovative tools and powerful marketing platforms in the U.S. and Internationally to help our clients transact with one another. CoStar continues to win multiple awards including one of Forbes most innovative companies (2017) and Fortune’s fastest growing companies (2020).As a CoStar Sales Executive you will prospect and engage potential clients while managing, nurturing, and growing our existing client base. Promoting both CoStar and LoopNet products, you will have the opportunity to take an entrepreneurial approach to sell, train, and retain your book of business. You will receive a first-class onboarding and training experience where you will learn how the different players in Commercial Real Estate operate, what is important to them and what solutions we have that meet their needs. You will have your own book of business, an endless supply of well qualified leads to develop, excellent products to sell, an excellent career development path. RESPONSIBILITIESGain a thorough understanding of your clients and their needsBecome an expert in CoStar’s critical information and marketing solutions including LoopNet, the leading online commercial real estate marketplaceComplete ownership of the full sales cycle including: prospecting, demoing, closing, onboarding, training and renewingConduct a high level of in person client and prospect product demonstrationsProvide valuable insight to all participants in the commercial property market, including Brokers, Owners, Investors, Lenders, Appraisers and Service ProvidersRepresent CoStar by hosting and attending industry events and networking with commercial real estate professionals in your marketBASIC QUALIFICATIONSBachelor’s degree requiredClient facing experience in the Commercial Real Estate industry strongly preferredFive or more years of successful outside sales experience in a B2B environment selling Data, Research and Analytic platforms or tools, commercial real estate, financial services, business intelligence, marketing or information providers.Proven track record exceeding sales targets and quotas in a consultative sales environmentThree or more years of experience training clients on how to use a solution post saleOUR BEST PERFORMERS AREPassionate, hard-working and ambitious – As an innovator, we are fast paced and creative and expect our Sales Executives to move quickly to seize opportunity.Fast to learn new concepts and apply them - CoStar clients and prospects are diverse and demanding. With a constantly evolving suite of products, successful Sales Executives are skilled at introducing them to their clients.Curious - Our best salespeople ask intelligent questions, demonstrate strong listening skills and learn from customers and colleaguesExcellent communicators - our broad-ranging solutions require clear, concise communication tailored to the relevant audience.Committed to Customer Service – Successful Sales Executives at CoStar provide valuable insights and take ownership of their client’s requests, managing them to a successful outcome.WHY COSTAR?The industry leader with an energetic and fast paced dynamic cultureInnovative technology and a reputation for outstanding products95% customer renewal rateConsistent 20%+ average of year over year growthOutstanding sales and product training programsExcellent career growth opportunitiesHigh compensation with uncapped commissions and an outstanding annual Presidents Club tripExceptional benefit plan including an employee discounted stock purchase planBe part of a team of sales professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. But don't just take our word for it -- see why our team chose to work at and stay at CoStar Group: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CVbJRnJ2sX0We welcome all qualified candidates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the United States to apply.  However, please note that CoStar is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this positionPlease noteCoStar Group seeks information for job applications from candidates in the U.S. through only the following channels:The CoStar Group website and RecruitiFi. Via email to/from addresses using only the CoStar domain of “@Costar.com.” Screening and interaction by telephone and through the Microsoft Teams or Zoom platforms.Be aware that:CoStar does not use Wire, Google Hangouts, or any other platform for any recruitment-related activities.Disregard any solicitation or request for information related to job applications with CoStar via any other means and/or using email addresses with any other domain.CoStar will never ask candidates to make any type of personal financial investment related to gaining employment with the company.If you have any questions about CoStar Group and the application process, please contact us at recruiting@costar.com.<br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing
