name: Software Engineer - Analytics
job_info: Software Engineer - Analytics<br>Job Description<br>OVERVIEW  CoStar delivers real-time, verified commercial real estate data that helps clients confidently spot great opportunities and make smart choices ahead of competitors. By combining the power of CoStar’s independent research organization – the industry’s largest – with global data delivery, software, and application solutions, clients can act on opportunities with confidence. The Analytics team is responsible for the development of CoStar's customer-facing Real Estate Analytics products.  We think big, creating innovative data-intensive applications that take the vast amount of data collected by our CoStar Research teams to create a fast, reliable and intuitive analytics platform for our customers.  We are a collaborative group with a mix of big data, API/platform and front-end skills, and we are growing rapidly to help invent the future of Real Estate Analytics.   We are searching for an experienced Lead Software Developer to join our team and drive the full-lifecycle development of this critical product.   RESPONSIBILITIES Designing, building, testing and deploying scalable, reusable and maintainable applications that handle large amounts of data. Taking full ownership of your work, developing solutions to complex problems from concept through delivery.  Participating in setting architectural best practices and standards for our team Providing high-quality technical guidance and mentoring to other team members Deep understanding of the design and architecture of our systems, including documentation and architectural diagrams Collaborating with other engineering leads (on your team and across the broader organization) on larger, shared system architectures Collaborating with other product team members - Engineers, QA, Product Owners, Designers, etc. Gaining a deep understanding of the CoStar business, including the Analytic products.  BASIC QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Computer Science/Engineering. 3+ years of professional software development experience. Solid understanding and experience with Object Oriented Programming Expert level knowledge of modern server-side languages and application frameworks (C#, .NET Framework, Web API, Node) Deep expertise with software development best practices, including standards, code reviews, source control, builds, testing and operations. Deep expertise with Source Control, such as Git or TFS. Expertise with relational database systems such as SQL Server  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS Expertise with Cloud platforms such as AWS or Azure  Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities. Experience with NoSQL (Redis, Neo4j, etc.) is a plus Knowledge of modern front end (JavaScript, React, etc.) languages and application frameworks is a plus  OVERVIEW OF COMPANY Founded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availability. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; LoopNet, the most heavily trafficked mobile and online real estate marketplace; Apartments.com, the premier rental home resource for renters, property managers and owners; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry; BizBuySell, the largest online marketplace for businesses-for-sales; and Lands of America, the leading operator of online marketplaces for rural real estate. Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of over 4,300 worldwide.  WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. In addition to generous compensation and performance-based incentives, you'll be supported in both your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program.  Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to): Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription Drug Life, legal, and supplementary insurance Commuter and parking benefits 401(K) retirement plan with matching contributions Employee stock purchase plan Paid time off Tuition reimbursement Complimentary gourmet coffee, tea, hot chocolate, prepared foods, fresh fruit, and other healthy snacks Be part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. But don't just take our word for it -- see why our team chose to work at and stay at CoStar Group: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CVbJRnJ2sX0  We welcome all qualified candidates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the United States to apply.  However, please note that CoStar is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position. #LI-IZ1<br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

name: Architectural Photographer - Atlanta
job_info: Architectural Photographer - Atlanta<br>Job Description<br>OVERVIEW CoStar Group is the world’s leading provider of information and marketing solutions for the Commercial Real Estate industry.  We are a NASDAQ listed company with a market cap of over US$30B and sit alongside other notable names such as Amazon, Facebook, Google and Apple.As a technology company, we are the trusted partner for all commercial real estate professionals empowering many of the most well-respected landlords, development companies, brokerage firms, banks, lenders, investors and government agencies.We do this by actively researching the commercial real estate markets and providing data, analytics, innovative tools and powerful marketing platforms in the U.S. and Internationally to help our clients transact with one another. CoStar continues to win multiple awards including one of Forbes most innovative companies (2017) and Fortune’s fastest growing companies (2018).As an Architectural Photographer, you will utilize your invention, imagination and creative expertise to scope and provide professional quality photographs, drone videos/still images and videos on the most important commercial buildings in your region.  Owners, brokers and developers rely on our marketplaces, LoopNet, Apartments.com, and Ten-X, to provide high quality media to best market their properties to Tenants and Investors.  As an Architectural Photographer, you will be at the heart of the commercial real estate industry, creating high quality photographic images and videos that enable our clients to make informed high impact business decisions.  With 24 million people visiting CoStar’s websites each month, every day your images will help our clients best market their properties. CORE RESPONSIBILITIES Use your invention, imagination, creative expertise and talent to produce original professional quality photography and video on assigned commercial properties in your assigned region and to produce original interior professional quality photography using existing light sources as well as lighting systems when necessary.  In doing so you are to create images in any manner you deem appropriate to highlight the real estate.Utilize time of day, time of season, location, and your expertise in photography to determine when and how to best photograph the exterior of commercial buildings.Create visually appealing and technically sound video with Drones, sliders, and other tools.Edit all photography and video in a timely fashion resulting in a completed project.Professional and effective communication with clients during all aspects of the media shoot including scheduling, set up and on site.Continued learning and development of your talent, including staying up-to-date on new techniques and technology.Successful Architectural Photography candidates will:Have a full understanding of best practices for Architectural Photography, demonstrating artistic vision and creativityCapture and edit beautiful interior and exterior property photos and videosCapture Drone imagery  Repetitive and frequent standing, seeing, sitting, walking, and driving up to eight hours per dayHolding five pounds in one hand for five minutes (photography and videography)Repetitive hand and arm movements needed to type and writeOccasional bending, stooping, squatting, lifting, twisting and carrying are necessary to perform job functionsMust be able to work on computer and or mobile devices from vehicle throughout workdayWill be exposed to both vehicle noise and possible car exhaustAbility to conduct job duties outside in various weather conditions each dayAbility to travel up to one week per monthREQUIRED QUALIFICATIONSA minimum of a High School Diploma coupled with 4+ years real estate photography and videography experience.Experience taking commercial real estate drone images (FAA Part 107 License/Certification required prior to hire)Experience with the Adobe Creative Suite:, IE: Photoshop, Lightroom, Bridge, and Premiere Pro or similarCandidates are required to submit portfolio of work supporting above listed experienceA current and valid driver’s license (or the ability to obtain a driver’s license prior to start date) is requiredPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS Be knowledgeable of MAC OS and MS OfficeEnjoy challenges of photographing commercial buildings in cityscapes, understand the challenges and work to find creative solutionsBe able to develop strong personal relationships with key contacts at assigned companiesManage multiple responsibilities, changing priorities, and excel in a fast-paced environment without missing deadlinesDemonstrate an interest in the commercial real estate industryWHY COSTAR?Kit including computer, camera, lenses, tripod, drone, gimbal and moreThe industry leader with an energetic and fast paced dynamic cultureInnovative technology and a reputation for outstanding products95% customer renewal rateConsistent 20%+ average of year over year growthExcellent Commercial Real Estate training opportunitiesExcellent career growth opportunitiesExceptional benefit plan (dental, vision, medical and prescription coverage) including an employee discounted stock purchase plan401k plan with company matchCompany vehicle provided for business useBe part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and name: Senior Director of Market Analytics, Washington, DC
job_info: Senior Director of Market Analytics, Washington, DC<br>Job Description<br>Senior Director of Market Analytics, Washington, DCJob DescriptionOVERVIEW:CoStar delivers real-time, verified commercial real estate data that enables our commercial real estate clients to make informed, high impact decisions ahead of competitors. By combining the power of CoStar’s independent research organization – the industry’s largest – with global data delivery, software, and application solutions, clients can act on opportunities with confidence.CoStar is seeking a Senior Director of Market Analytics to join our growing analytics organization. The Senior Director of Market Analytics is responsible for all analytic content (listed below) for markets including, but not limited to, those in the Greater Washington, DC area. The Senior Director of Market Analytics will play a key role as a client- and industry-facing representative of CoStar and is responsible for delivering CoStar’s view of the market and the outlook.RESPONSIBILITIES:Produce meaningful, relevant, and insightful analysis of real estate market conditions for inclusion in CoStar’s product offeringContent will take various forms, including, but not limited to: (1) written narratives in CoStar’s market and sub-market reports; (2) video content; (3) presentations to clients and at industry events; and (4) written and visual content for CoStar’s news platformEngage in interactions and discussions with CoStar customersTranslate analysis and insights into meaningful content to deliver to the marketDeliver in person and video market updates to CoStar clients and industry groups, focusing on economic and commercial real estate trends in the marketRegularly review and monitor CoStar data for accuracy, timeliness, and quality, and ensuring errors and outliers are corrected in a timely manner.BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:Bachelor’s degree requiredSeven or more years of work experience in commercial real estate, with experience in the Washington, DC marketHigh level of understanding of commercial real estate fundamentals, as well as economic theory and principles applied to the real estate industryStrong analytical and writing skillsDemonstrated writing skills; ability to write effectively and maintain a high volume of written contentExperience in using MS Office; proficient with MS ExcelFamiliarity with markets in the DC area, as either a resident or a real estate professionalStrong work ethic and ability to work in a team environmentPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:Master’s or other graduate degree in a related fieldPolished presentation skills and communication skillsExperience speaking and presenting data related to market conditions to others in both large groups and in small executive-level settingsClient orientation and commitment to help clients succeedSQL experienceOVERVIEW OF COMPANY:Founded in 1987, we are a NASDAQ listed company with a market cap of over US$30B and sit alongside other notable names such as Amazon, Facebook, Google and Apple. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; LoopNet, the most heavily trafficked mobile and online real estate marketplace; Apartments.com, the premier rental home resource for renters, property managers and owners; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry; BizBuySell, the largest online marketplace for businesses-for-sales; and Lands of America, the leading operator of online marketplaces for rural real estate.As a technology company, we are the trusted partner for all commercial real estate professionals empowering many of the most well-respected landlords, development companies, brokerage firms, banks, lenders, investors and government agencies with our data products and leading marketplaces. We do this by actively researching the commercial real estate markets and providing data, analytics, innovative tools and powerful marketing platforms in the U.S. and Internationally to help our clients transact with one another. CoStar continues to win multiple awards including one of Forbes most innovative companies (2017) and Fortune’s fastest growing companies (2018). Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of over 4,300 worldwide.WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU:Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. In addition to generous compensation and performance-based incentives, you'll be supported in both your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program.Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to):Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription DrugsLife, legal, and supplementary insuranceCommuter and parking benefits401(K) retirement plans, with matching contributionsEmployee stock purchase planPaid time offTuition reimbursementComplimentary gourmet coffee, tea, hot chocolate, prepared foods, fresh fruit, and other healthy snacks.Become part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. name: Senior Market Analyst
job_info: Senior Market Analyst<br>Job Description<br>Senior Market AnalystJob DescriptionSenior Market Analyst – Boston, MAJob DescriptionOVERVIEWCoStar delivers real-time, verified commercial real estate data that helps clients confidently spot great opportunities and make smart choices ahead of competitors. By combining the power of CoStar’s independent research organization – the industry’s largest – with global data delivery, software, and application solutions, clients can act on opportunities with confidence.The Marketing Research team is the heart of CoStar, capturing market-critical information that enables our commercial real estate clients to make informed, high impact business decisions daily. CoStar Group’s research contributes to the most important segment of our economy, helping businesses open offices, retail stores, warehouses, and manufacturing facilities. CoStar Group is seeking a Senior Market Analyst to join our growing research organization.As CoStar SENIOR MARKET ANALYST, you will compile comprehensive information and data about specific markets. Responsible for the creation of graphics utilizing both Excel and PowerPoint to showcase market trends and analysis for internal and external presentations and reports. Communicate findings regarding the state of their markets. Work side by side with the Researchers, Pipeline Analysts and Research Managers within their markets to share influential market analysis and trends.RESPONSIBILITIESResponsible for producing meaningful, relevant, and insightful analysis of real estate market conditions for inclusion in CoStar’s product offerings.Content will take various forms, including 1) written narratives in CoStar’s market and sub-market reports; 2) visual content included in presentations about the market; 3) verbal discussions about the market with CoStar customers; and 4) written and visual content sent to the media.Works to compile comprehensive information and data about specific markets utilizing that information and personal market knowledge to develop an informed opinion of overall market conditions and peculiarities.Prepares edited market reports that identify trends and data inconsistencies.Uses multiple software platforms to develop/create graphics to showcase market trends and analysis for internal and external presentations and reports.Responsible for analyzing market data and draw insightful conclusions.Responsible for utilizing all the data available at CoStar and to manipulate, aggregate and organize this data to uncover trends, patterns and other insights of interest to the commercial real estate industry.Maintain well-written, timely CRE market and sub-market reports for analysis and commentary on sub-markets and markets covered by CoStar.Commentary should be relevant, insightful, interesting and thought provoking to CoStar clients.Regularly review CoStar data for accuracy, timeliness and quality and ensuring errors and outliers are corrected in a timely manner.Translate analysis and insights into meaningful presentations and deliver them to the market.Deliver in person and video market updates to CoStar clients and industry groups, focusing on economic and CRE trends in the market.Other products containing commentary and analysis may be added as the MA team develops strategies to inform Costar clients and disseminate expert market knowledge.Manages multiple projects simultaneously.BASIC QUALIFICATIONSBachelor's degree, preferably in economics, finance, urban planning or real estate; graduate degree preferred.5+ years of work experience in commercial real estate with familiarity of the local market.PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLSFirm understanding of economic theory and principles and their application to the real estate industry.Demonstrated writing skills; ability to write effectively and in large volumes.Strong data and analysis skills, in particular using MS Office.Good communication skills.Polished presentation skills.Strong work ethic and ability to work in a team environment.Must be legally authorized to work in the US.OVERVIEW OF COMPANY:Founded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availability. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; LoopNet, the most heavily trafficked mobile and online real estate marketplace; Apartments.com, the premier rental home resource for renters, property managers and owners; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry; BizBuySell, the largest online marketplace for businesses-for-sales; and Lands of America, the leading operator of online marketplaces for rural real estate.Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of over 4,300 worldwide.WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU:Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. In addition to generous compensation and performance-based incentives, you'll be supported in both your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program.Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to):Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription DrugLife, legal, and supplementary insuranceCommuter and parking benefits401(K) retirement plan with matching contributionsEmployee stock purchase planPaid time offTuition reimbursementOn-site fitness center and/or reimbursed fitness center membership costs (location dependent), with yoga studio, Pelotons, personal training, group exercise classes, as well as Segways and bikes available for use during the dayComplimentary gourmet coffee, tea, hot chocolate, prepared foods, fresh fruit, and other healthy snacksBe part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. name: Manager, Data Science
job_info: Manager, Data Science<br>Job Description<br>As a Manager, Data Science on our analytics and data science team, you will leverage your deep experience in data analysis and machine learning to drive significant traffic, user engagement growth and grow the rental management solutions topline for the Apartments.com Network of rental brands including Apartments.com, ApartmentFinder.com, ApartmentHomeLiving.com, Apartamentos.com, WestsideRentals.com, ForRent.com, After55.com, ForRentUniversity.com, CorporateHousing.com and Cozy.co.We are counting on you to bring a genuine curiosity about how consumers navigate through their rental lifecycle, and pair that with a strong technical aptitude and ability to analyze large datasets, uncover trends and insights, then turn those findings into actionable recommendations.You’ll be joining a best-in-class team that has relentlessly high standards, is never satisfied with the status quo, and thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Our industry-leading team is the driving force for our business and has exceeded our performance goals each year. Responsibilities:Understanding business objectives and developing analytical solutions that help achieve them, along with metrics to track their progress.Performing various exploratory data analysis to uncover trends, insights and develop strategies.Leveraging generative approaches to understand user behavior and metrics of interest.Designing and analyzing A/B tests and Multivariate tests.Analyzing data and developing predictive models using machine learning and deep learning.Collaborate cross-functionally across internal teams (marketing, product, technology, research, etc.) to evaluate opportunities that deliver business goals via data analysis and machine learning.Develop and promote a data driven approach by proactively identifying new potential analysis projects and highlight key opportunities to drive our organization forward.Share results and conclusions you draw to derive meaning from the data, and what business actions you think should be taken as a result of the analysis.Identify learnings from your analysis for how we can improve the collection and upkeep of our datasets.Enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems.Coordinate across departments and with our analytics providers to establish best practices and adhere to common design patterns, and work through your plans with others to troubleshoot potential issues upfront.Act as a role model throughout our team, but also our organization by maintaining the highest professional standards, promoting data governance, data management, creative thinking and pushing us to be always be our best.Manage a team of 3 to 4 data scientists, coach, and mentor them to achieve their full potential.Skills and Qualifications:Master's Degree required in Computer Science, Business Analytics, Data Analytics, or Data Science, Machine Learning, or related field with 3+ years Or Bachelor's Degree with 5+ years of professional work experience in data analysis and machine learning.2+ years of experience managing analytics and data science teamsStrong experience with communicating technical findings to relevant stakeholders and providing applicable business insights and recommendations.Proficient in SQL, writing queries, and reporting.Excellent scripting and programming skills with Python, R, etc. with hands-on experience.Proficiency with Python-based common data science toolkits such as Jupyter Notebooks, Numpy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, MatplotLib, Seaborn, NLTK, etc.Ability to write clean, reproducible, robust, and scalable analysis code.Good, applied statistics skills, such as distribution analysis, probability theory, statistical testing, regression, etc.Expertise in running exploratory data analysis, statistical modeling and data mining.Experience with designing and analyzing experiments (A/B tests and Multivariate tests).Excellent understanding of supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as Clustering, Topic Modeling, K-Means, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Neural Networks, etc.Experience with data visualization tools, such as PowerBI and Tableau.Ability to run automated jobs to manipulate and store data from APIs and various cloud providers.Hands-on experience working with large data sets.Preferred Qualifications:Working experience with a deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or Keras.Understanding of special deep learning networks such as Convolutional Neural Networks, for computer vision.Experience developing recommendation engines using different techniques like collaborative filtering, content-based filtering, deep learning-based approaches, etc.Understanding of statistical decision theory.<br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

name: Motion Graphics Video Animator
job_info: Motion Graphics Video Animator<br>Job Description<br>OVERVIEWCoStar Group is the global leader in technology, data, and analytics for the commercial real estate industry. We are growing our in-house video content team in order to support key marketing efforts across the organization. The mission of this role is to provide high quality motion graphics and/or animations for the video content we produce for CoStar Group and its brands.BACKGROUNDThe Motion Graphics Animator will work with the in-house video content team to conceptualize, design, and bring to life cutting-edge, beautifully crafted, and engaging visuals. The position requires someone with extensive animation and motion graphic skills to create content that will push the boundaries of visual storytelling across all of CoStar Group and its brands. Being highly adaptable to last minute changes or requests is important to be successful in this role.ROLE RESPONSIBILITIESConceptualizes, designs, and animates 2D and 3D motion graphics for video content across digital and social platforms.Collaborates closely with Director of Video Production and in-house producers.Develops storyboards for initial stages of production.Design new approaches to visually feature stats, data, graphs, and charts within video content.Occasionally helps with static digital design overflow.Assists in the field and on production sets as needed.Maintains brand guidelines and understands brand objectives while pushing creative and visual boundaries.Maintains a reliable file system to facilitate streamlined collaboration and creativity.Stays abreast of industry news and trends as well as trends in technology, news, and entertainment.Works independently as well as with internal teams to manage complex projects and meet deadlines, often with quick turnaround.QUALIFICATIONSMinimum 7+ years’ experience as a motion designer or animator at a cable network, brand, or agency.Extensive experience with Adobe After Effects, Premiere Pro, Animate, Photoshop, Illustrator, and Cinema4D a must. Knowledge of HTML5 and Scratch a plus.Strong understanding of color correction, sound design and mixing audio for video.Capable of meeting tight deadlines and quickly turning around high-end video content.Excellent organizational skills and meticulous attention to detail in design and preparation of final deliverables.Experienced using video equipment such as cameras, lighting, sound, etc.Self-motivated, resourceful, and detail-oriented.Excellent communicator that can clearly explain projects needs to internal stakeholders and vendors.Ability to work after hours if needed.Ambitious, willing to take creative risks, and experiment.Must submit portfolio of work including summary of role on each project.OVERVIEW OF COMPANY: Founded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availability. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; LoopNet, the most heavily trafficked mobile and online real estate marketplace; Apartments.com, the premier rental home resource for renters, property managers and owners; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry; BizBuySell, the largest online marketplace for businesses-for-sales; and Lands of America, the leading operator of online marketplaces for rural real estate.Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of over 4,300 worldwide.WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. In addition to generous compensation and performance-based incentives, you'll be supported in both your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program. Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to):•    Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription Drug•    Life, legal, and supplementary insurance•    Commuter and parking benefits•    401(K) retirement plan with matching contributions•    Employee stock purchase plan•    Paid time off•    Tuition reimbursement•    On-site fitness center and/or reimbursed fitness center membership costs (location dependent), with yoga studio, Pelotons, personal training, group exercise classes, as well as Segways and bikes available for use during the day•    Complimentary gourmet coffee, tea, hot chocolate, prepared foods, fresh fruit, and other healthy snacksBe part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. job_info: Senior Market Analyst<br>Job Description<br>Senior Market Analyst – Jacksonville, FLJob DescriptionOVERVIEWCoStar delivers real-time, verified commercial real estate data that helps clients confidently spot great opportunities and make smart choices ahead of competitors. By combining the power of CoStar’s independent research organization – the industry’s largest – with global data delivery, software, and application solutions, clients can act on opportunities with confidence.The Marketing Research team is the heart of CoStar, capturing market-critical information that enables our commercial real estate clients to make informed, high impact business decisions daily. CoStar Group’s research contributes to the most important segment of our economy, helping businesses open offices, retail stores, warehouses, and manufacturing facilities. CoStar Group is seeking a Senior Market Analyst to join our growing research organization.As CoStar SENIOR MARKET ANALYST, you will compile comprehensive information and data about specific markets. Responsible for the creation of graphics utilizing both Excel and PowerPoint to showcase market trends and analysis for internal and external presentations and reports. Communicate findings regarding the state of their markets. Work side by side with the Researchers, Pipeline Analysts and Research Managers within their markets to share influential market analysis and trends.RESPONSIBILITIESResponsible for producing meaningful, relevant, and insightful analysis of real estate market conditions for inclusion in CoStar’s product offerings.Content will take various forms, including 1) written narratives in CoStar’s market and sub-market reports; 2) visual content included in presentations about the market; 3) verbal discussions about the market with CoStar customers; and 4) written and visual content sent to the media.Works to compile comprehensive information and data about specific markets utilizing that information and personal market knowledge to develop an informed opinion of overall market conditions and peculiarities.Prepares edited market reports that identify trends and data inconsistencies.Uses multiple software platforms to develop/create graphics to showcase market trends and analysis for internal and external presentations and reports.Responsible for analyzing market data and draw insightful conclusions.Responsible for utilizing all the data available at CoStar and to manipulate, aggregate and organize this data to uncover trends, patterns and other insights of interest to the commercial real estate industry.Maintain well-written, timely CRE market and sub-market reports for analysis and commentary on sub-markets and markets covered by CoStar.Commentary should be relevant, insightful, interesting and thought provoking to CoStar clients.Regularly review CoStar data for accuracy, timeliness and quality and ensuring errors and outliers are corrected in a timely manner.Translate analysis and insights into meaningful presentations and deliver them to the market.Deliver in person and video market updates to CoStar clients and industry groups, focusing on economic and CRE trends in the market.Other products containing commentary and analysis may be added as the MA team develops strategies to inform Costar clients and disseminate expert market knowledge.Manages multiple projects simultaneously.BASIC QUALIFICATIONSBachelor's degree, preferably in economics, finance, urban planning or real estate; graduate degree preferred.5+ years of work experience in commercial real estate with familiarity of the local market.PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLSFirm understanding of economic theory and principles and their application to the real estate industry.Demonstrated writing skills; name: Senior Site Reliability Engineer - Analytics
job_info: Senior Site Reliability Engineer - Analytics<br>Job Description<br>OVERVIEW  CoStar delivers real-time, verified commercial real estate data that helps clients confidently spot great opportunities and make smart choices ahead of competitors. By combining the power of CoStar’s independent research organization – the industry’s largest – with global data delivery, software, and application solutions, clients can act on opportunities with confidence. The Analytics team is responsible for the development of CoStar's customer-facing Real Estate Analytics products. We think big, creating innovative data-intensive applications that take the vast amount of data collected by our CoStar Research teams to create a fast, reliable and intuitive analytics platform for our customers.  We are a collaborative group with a mix of big data, API/platform and front-end skills, and we are growing rapidly to help invent the future of Real Estate Analytics.   We are searching for an experienced Site Reliability Engineer to join our team and be the bridge between development and operations. This person will apply a software engineering mindset to system administration topics such as availability, performance, monitoring, alerting, emergency response, and capacity planning for our customer-facing Analytics platform at CoStar. We have the industry’s largest set of Commercial Real Estate property data, which lets us create innovative products that must be stable, reliable and high-performing.    RESPONSIBILITIES Monitor the availability and performance of our mission-critical applications and services. Design and develop real time monitoring and alerting solutions that provide clarity into application health and performance. Understand the architecture of our applications and services and ensure that we have the necessary monitoring, alerting, etc. in place.  And in those cases where it’s lacking, collaborate with other technical stakeholders on a plan to implement. Clearly communicate scope and impact of any incidents to teammates and stakeholders, following through to closure as necessary. Troubleshoot sometimes complex issues, using your knowledge of application architectures and our monitoring tools, and work with other team members as necessary to get issues fixed and deployed. Effectively manage your time to multi-task between monitoring, occasional incident response and longer term project goals. Participate in service capacity planning, load testing, performance analysis and system tuning. Continually look to improve our performance, stability, tooling, processes, etc. as our applications evolve. Develop effective documentation for processes and tooling that you implement, so that other team members can use the tools and processes you put in place.  BASIC QUALIFICATIONS 3-5 years of experience with operational ownership of large scale application architectures.  Expertise with monitoring tools such as DataDog, Kibana, etc. Experience with architectures that use REST APIs or Microservices Infrastructure as code using Cloudformation, Terraform or similar platforms Experience with AWS services such as S3, Lambda, DynamoDB, SageMaker, etc. Experience with SQL and No SQL databases Understanding of the Software Development Life Cycle including CI and CD pipeline architecture Experience working with container technologies such as Kubernetes and Docker Strong interpersonal and communications skills  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS Programming languages / some developer background with either C#, NodeJS Server-less architecture methodologies Agile methodologies and working within sprint cycles  OVERVIEW OF COMPANY Founded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availability. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; LoopNet, the most heavily trafficked mobile and online real estate marketplace; Apartments.com, the premier rental home resource for renters, property managers and owners; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry; BizBuySell, the largest online marketplace for businesses-for-sales; and Lands of America, the leading operator of online marketplaces for rural real estate. Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of over 4,300 worldwide.  WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. In addition to generous compensation and performance-based incentives, you'll be supported in both your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program.  Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to): Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription Drug Life, legal, and supplementary insurance Commuter and parking benefits 401(K) retirement plan with matching contributions Employee stock purchase plan Paid time off Tuition reimbursement Complimentary gourmet coffee, tea, hot chocolate, prepared foods, fresh fruit, and other healthy snacks Be part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. But don't just take our word for it -- see why our team chose to work at and stay at CoStar Group: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CVbJRnJ2sX0  We welcome all qualified candidates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the United States to apply.  However, please note that CoStar is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position. <br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

Prepares edited market reports that identify trends and data inconsistencies. Uses multiple software platforms to develop/create graphics to showcase market trends and analysis for internal and external presentations and reports. job_info: Sales Associate, CoStar - Atlanta, GA<br>Job Description<br>CoStar Group is the world’s leading provider of information and marketing solutions for the Commercial Real Estate industry.  We are a NASDAQ listed company with a market cap of over $30B.+As a technology company, we are the trusted partner for all commercial real estate professionals empowering many of the most well-respected landlords, development companies, brokerage firms, banks, lenders, investors and government agencies.We do this by actively researching the commercial real estate markets and providing data, analytics, innovative tools and powerful marketing platforms in the U.S. and Internationally to help our clients transact with one another. CoStar continues to win multiple awards including one of Forbes most innovative companies (2017) and Fortune’s fastest growing companies (2020). As a CoStar Sales Associate you will prospect and engage potential clients while managing, nurturing, and growing our existing client base. Promoting both CoStar and LoopNet products, you will have the opportunity to take an entrepreneurial approach to sell, train, and retain your book of business.  You will receive a first class onboarding and training experience where you will learn how the different players in Commercial Real Estate operate, what is important to them and what solutions we have that meet their needs. You will have your own book of business, an endless supply of well qualified leads to develop, excellent products to sell, an excellent career development path.  RESPONSIBILITIES•    Gain a thorough understanding of your clients and their needs•    Become an expert in CoStar’s critical information and marketing solutions including LoopNet, the leading online commercial real estate marketplace•    Complete ownership of the full sales cycle including: prospecting, demoing, closing, onboarding, training and renewing•    Conduct a high level of in person client and prospect product demonstrations•    Provide valuable insight to all participants in the commercial property market, including Brokers, Owners, Investors, Lenders, Appraisers and Service Providers•    Represent CoStar by hosting and attending industry events and networking with commercial real estate professionals in your marketBASIC QUALIFICATIONS•    Bachelor’s degree required•    Client facing experience in the Commercial Real Estate industry strongly preferred•    Two or more years of successful outside sales experience in a B2B environment selling data, research and analytic platforms or tools, commercial real estate, financial services or business intelligence. •    Proven track record exceeding sales targets and quotas in a consultative sales environment•    Two or more years of experience training clients on how to use a solution post sale•    Ability to travel within market for client meetings.  Employees who drive themselves for this purpose must have a current and valid driver’s license (or the ability to obtain a driver’s license prior to start date).OUR BEST PERFORMERS ARE•    Passionate, hard-working and ambitious – As an innovator, we are fast paced and creative and expect our Sales Associates to move quickly to seize opportunity.•    Fast to learn new concepts and apply them - CoStar clients and prospects are diverse and demanding. With a constantly evolving suite of products, successful Sales Associates are skilled at introducing them to their clients.•    Curious - Our best salespeople ask intelligent questions, demonstrate strong listening skills and learn from customers and colleagues•    Excellent communicators - our broad-ranging solutions require clear, concise communication tailored to the relevant audience.•    Committed to Customer Service – Successful Sales Associate’s at CoStar provide valuable insights and take ownership of their client’s requests, managing them to a successful outcome.WHY COSTAR?•    The industry leader with an energetic and fast paced dynamic culture•    Innovative technology and a reputation for outstanding products•    95% customer renewal rate •    Consistent 20%+ average of year over year growth •    Outstanding sales and product training programs•    Excellent career growth opportunities•    High compensation with uncapped commissions and an outstanding annual Presidents Club trip •    Exceptional benefit plan including an employee discounted stock purchase planBe part of a team of sales professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. name: Senior Data Engineer
job_info: Senior Data Engineer<br>Job Description<br>CoStar delivers real-time, verified commercial real estate data that helps clients confidently spot great opportunities and make smart choices ahead of competitors. By combining the power of CoStar’s independent research organization – the industry’s largest – with global data delivery, software, and application solutions, clients can act on opportunities with confidence. CoStar’s software developers build products that facilitate 86% of commercial real estate transactions in the United States. These transactions range from a small business owner leasing their first office space to a large multi-national buying a new headquarters campus. On any given day our developers are building products that manage nearly a trillion dollars of potential real estate transactions. As a member of the Global Research Development Team, you will be working on the Enterprise applications our employees use every day. ResponsibilitiesKnow:  Deeply understand what drives the business for which you are building software.  We firmly believe that what separates a good developer from a great one is a deep understanding of the business that they are supporting.Architect:  Use your experience to drive the design of highly performant and highly available data solutions.Build:  Build solutions that operate on massive amounts of data in high transaction volume applications.Test:  Work with your QA resources to ensure that the software you deliver is of the highest quality. (Our customers are not beta testers.)Launch:  Act as a key member of the product launch team and work closely to DevOps to resolve operational issues.Grow:  Take an active role in mentoring other developers.Are you up for the challenge?Skills & QualificationsBachelor’s degreeA demonstrable track record of building and launching successful products that leverage terabytes of data5+ years of deep database engineering experience3+ years in data pipeline engineering experienceAbility to analyze technical requirements and design new architectures, data models and ETL strategiesHands-on professional experience with AWS SQL and NoSQL databases. Experience with integration products like Glue, Lambda, AWS Data Pipeline, and/or Database migration services a plus.Expertise database design, complex T-SQL programming, performance tuning and index analysisDeliver work products that meets specifications, are free of defects, and have optimal performanceDefine Database Architecture and Development best practicesFacilitate discussions among database developers to exchange ideas and introduce new database technologiesEvaluate emerging technologies to identify opportunities, trends and best practices that can be leveraged to strengthen CoStar’s technology platform and development practices.Willingness to take an active role in mentoring other developersCoStar BenefitsMarket-leading compensationComprehensive medical, dental, prescription and vision benefits with a choice of two plansCompany-paid life insuranceCompany-paid long-term and short-term disability benefitsA rich 401(k) plan<br>CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

name: Senior ERP Data Conversion Analyst
job_info: Senior ERP Data Conversion Analyst<br>Job Description<br>Senior ERP Data Conversion AnalystThe Senior Data Conversion Analyst is primarily responsible for definition, design, development, implementation, validation and maintenance of business data conversions associated with the migration from legacy billing/ERP systems to Oracle Fusion ERP, for existing and acquired businesses. name: SEO Analyst
job_info: SEO Analyst<br>Job Description<br>SEO Analyst – Apartments.com – Atlanta, GA Are you a motivated, emerging SEO seeking the opportunity to work for a best-in-class brand? As an SEO Analyst, you’ll work on SEO initiatives for the Apartments.com Network. With your genuine curiosity about how our audiences search paired with a technical aptitude, you’ll research search trends, monitor traffic and work on traffic-driving initiatives.  As a valued member of the product team, you’ll be part of a dynamic, motivated team that strives to produce the best content in our industry. Your contributions will enhance the user experience and help the team contribute to the overall business goal of making Apartments.com a trusted resource and the go-to marketplace for renting.  Role & Responsibilities: You’ll perform keyword research, creating keyword tracking lists, competitive analysis, technical audits, and other techniques You’ll perform content research and keyword gap analysis to prioritize topic recommendations and plan a roadmap for data-driven content creation You’ll keep track of organic search performance by analyzing rankings, traffic, and conversion data to identify trends You’ll leverage your communication skills to share insights and recommendations to a variety of colleagues, stakeholders, and business leaders with both technical and non-technical backgrounds You’ll help with a variety of traffic driving projects, drive meaningful change, and achieve results while working in a fast-paced environment and thrive under pressure  Basic Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Analytics, Statistics, Engineering, Economics, or other field  1+ years of in-house or agency SEO work experience  ​Some knowledge of various tools to perform keyword research, competitive analysis, and technical SEO activities Proficient in Microsoft Office, especially Excel and PowerPoint Preferred Qualifications: Understanding of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and other front-end web programing languages Some knowledge of Google Analytics, Google Search Console, and Bing Webmaster Tools Experience working on websites or marketplaces Problem-solving and strategic-thinking skills, attention to detail, and objectivity Strong organizational, communication, interpersonal, and writing skills What’s in it for you? Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. name: Senior Market Analyst, Chicago
job_info: Senior Market Analyst, Chicago<br>Job Description<br>OVERVIEW CoStar delivers real-time, verified commercial real estate data that helps clients confidently spot great opportunities and make smart choices ahead of competitors. By combining the power of CoStar’s independent research organization – the industry’s largest – with global data delivery, software, and application solutions, clients can act on opportunities with confidence.The Marketing Research team is the heart of CoStar, capturing market-critical information that enables our commercial real estate clients to make informed, high impact business decisions daily. CoStar Group’s research contributes to the most important segment of our economy, helping businesses open offices, retail stores, warehouses, and manufacturing facilities. CoStar Group is seeking a Senior Market Analyst to join our growing research organization.As CoStar SENIOR MARKET ANALYST, you will compile comprehensive information and data about specific markets. Responsible for the creation of graphics utilizing both Excel and PowerPoint to showcase market trends and analysis for internal and external presentations and reports. Communicate findings regarding the state of their markets. Work side by side with the Researchers, Pipeline Analysts and Research Managers within their markets to share influential market analysis and trends.RESPONSIBILITIESResponsible for producing meaningful, relevant, and insightful analysis of real estate market conditions for inclusion in CoStar’s product offerings. Content will take various forms, including 1) written narratives in CoStar’s market and sub-market reports; 2) visual content included in presentations about the market; 3) verbal discussions about the market with CoStar customers; and 4) written and visual content sent to the media.Works to compile comprehensive information and data about specific markets utilizing that information and personal market knowledge to develop an informed opinion of overall market conditions and peculiarities. Prepares edited market reports that identify trends and data inconsistencies. Uses multiple software platforms to develop/create graphics to showcase market trends and analysis for internal and external presentations and reports. Responsible for analyzing market data and draw insightful conclusions. Responsible for utilizing all the data available at CoStar and to manipulate, aggregate and organize this data to uncover trends, patterns and other insights of interest to the commercial real estate industry.Maintain well-written, timely CRE market and sub-market reports for analysis and commentary on sub-markets and markets covered by CoStar. Commentary should be relevant, insightful, interesting and thought provoking to CoStar clients.Regularly review CoStar data for accuracy, timeliness and quality and ensuring errors and outliers are corrected in a timely manner.Translate analysis and insights into meaningful presentations and deliver them to the market.Deliver in person and video market updates to CoStar clients and industry groups, focusing on economic and CRE trends in the market.Other products containing commentary and analysis may be added as the MA team develops strategies to inform Costar clients and disseminate expert market knowledge.Manages multiple projects simultaneously.BASIC QUALIFICATIONSBachelor's degree, preferably in economics, finance, urban planning or real estate; graduate degree preferred.5+ years of work experience in commercial real estate with familiarity of the local market.PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS Firm understanding of economic theory and principles and their application to the real estate industry.Demonstrated writing skills; ability to write effectively and in large volumes.Strong data and analysis skills, in particular using MS Office.Good communication skills.Polished presentation skills.Strong work ethic and ability to work in a team environment.Must be legally authorized to work in the US.OVERVIEW OF COMPANY:Founded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availability. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; LoopNet, the most heavily trafficked mobile and online real estate marketplace; Apartments.com, the premier rental home resource for renters, property managers and owners; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry; BizBuySell, the largest online marketplace for businesses-for-sales; and Lands of America, the leading operator of online marketplaces for rural real estate.Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of over 4,300 worldwide.WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU:Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. In addition to generous compensation and performance-based incentives, you'll be supported in both your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program.Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to):Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription DrugLife, legal, and supplementary insuranceCommuter and parking benefits401(K) retirement plan with matching contributionsEmployee stock purchase planPaid time offTuition reimbursementOn-site fitness center and/or reimbursed fitness center membership costs (location dependent), with yoga studio, Pelotons, personal training, group exercise classes, as well as Segways and bikes available for use during the dayComplimentary gourmet coffee, tea, hot chocolate, prepared foods, fresh fruit, and other healthy snacksBe part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. name: Lead UX Designer
job_info: Lead UX Designer<br>Job Description<br>Apartments.com is the leading website for marketing rental properties. CoStar Group, the parent company of Apartments.com seeks a Lead UX Designer with financial reporting and payment system experience to lead multiple projects and positively impact the business. This individual will work in an agile and iterative environment collaborating with Designers, Product Managers, Researchers and Developers in shaping all aspects of cross platform applications.This will include researching, sketching, prototyping, testing, and delivering final design solutions. You will be part of a fun, dynamic team with startup creativity backed by corporate stability that is changing the way the rental industry works.Responsibilities: Collaborate with Product Managers and UX Researchers to translate abstract ideas, research findings, analytics data, and business requirements into effective design solutions. Articulately present design concepts to teammates and stakeholders.Manage multiple concurrent design projects.Produce production assets and design specifications for development teams based on approved designs. Collaborate with development teams to ensure interface implementation matches design specifications.Basic Qualifications: BA/BS in Human Factors, User Interface Design, Graphic Design, or equivalent. 7+ years of experience designing for user interaction.Online portfolio demonstrating design thinking/process (problem/solution, before/after, research, sitemaps, user-flows, wireframes, prototypes, visual concepts, style guides, design systems). Experience conducting user research and testing. Proficiency with Sketch and a variety of design tools (including but not limited to Adobe Creative Suite, XD, Webflow, Figma, Proto.io, Principle, Axure, InVision etc.) Ability to articulate design thinking through whiteboard sketches to high fidelity prototypes. Knowledge of UX best practices for applications and cross-platform devices. Knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, JQuery, and how it affects front-end design. Knowledge of ADA UI design standards.COSTAR OVERVIEWFounded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availability. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; LoopNet, the most heavily trafficked mobile and online real estate marketplace; Apartments.com, the premier rental home resource for renters, property managers and owners; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry; BizBuySell, the largest online marketplace for businesses-for-sales; and Lands of America, the leading operator of online marketplaces for rural real estate.Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of over 4,300 worldwide.WHATS IN IT FOR YOUWorking at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. In addition to generous compensation and performance-based incentives, you'll be supported in both your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program.Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to):Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription DrugLife, legal, and supplementary insuranceCommuter and parking benefits401(K) retirement plan with matching contributionsEmployee stock purchase planPaid time offTuition reimbursementOn-site fitness center and/or reimbursed fitness center membership costs (location dependent), with yoga studio, Pelotons, personal training, group exercise classes, as well as Segways and bikes available for use during the dayComplimentary gourmet coffee, tea, hot chocolate, prepared foods, fresh fruit, and other healthy snacksBe part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere.
